story:
In Riches to Rags, Lily Paxton, must leave all the things she loves and arrives in India, sad, lonely and depressed. She meets a beggar girl, Asha.

In the end will Lily who has a knack for getting herself into difficult situations, choose to give up her last best loved treasure for her friend Asha?

Asha is a very happy beggar girl. Does that make sense? Not to Lily.

When I saw pictures of lepers in India it touched my heart. There's no hope for them, begging for a living generation after generation is all they have. I wanted to fix it, but what could I do?  God gave me the theme for Riches to Rags, a novel for ages 9 to 14 (adults like it too.)

This is the leper colony that I visited when I went to India to do research for Riches to Rags. These are the next generation of beggars and lepers unless . . .

As a writer, I decided to write a novel with the majority of the sales going to organizations that work with lepers. 

To self-publish with excellence takes thousands of dollars. A friend suggested I ask others to help. So here I am. I need your help. You can visit my website www.elizabethjoneswrites.com and read three chapters of Riches to Rags.

Third Culture Kids... Like Lily in Riches to Rags, leave everything they know to go with their parents to another country to serve God. Adjusting to a new culture is not easy. My hope is that in reading Riches to Rags Third Culture Kids will be helped to how God can work in their  lives.

This is Sirena, just before she left last year to go to Guatemala. She is a Third Culture Kid , . Please watch her video to hear her story and read some of Riches to Rags.

    What published authors are saying about Riches to Rags.

    A good book carries us to a place we have never been, binds us to people we will never know, breaks our hearts over injustices we have never felt. Thank you, Lily and Asha, for taking us to the hardest places of India and showing us God’s love.

      Kay Marshall Strom      Author of The Blessings of India Series

                                  ******************************

    You are going to love the story of Lily who, though she thinks she has lost everything, manages to find the most important thing of all. 

      Wendy Lawton      Author of The Daughters of Faith series

                                       ****************************

    In Riches to Rags, Lily is whisked away to a foreign land where she discovers that sometimes amid intense poverty God's greatest riches dwell.

      Lynne Thompson     Author of The Official Soccer Mom Devotional and The Wag Series

                                      *****************************

    This book will keep you reading cover to cover. The author draws us in and makes us examine our own decisions and feelings. Lily, the main character, plays outside the book, urging us to read just one more page. After reading Riches to Rags, we have a good idea of the hard life and the hearts of the people of India.  

       Elizabeth Provost, Poet,    Author of Ten Little Sleepyheads

                                       ******************************

    This is a passionately told novel to awaken our senses toward another culture. The author has traveled to India to absorb first-hand the culture and language. Riches to Rags will reward tweens love of adventure as they follow Lily who follows Asha to the garbage heaps in her city and to a leper colony where Lily discovers the real purpose God has for her in India.  

       Pauline Youd, Author of Adopted for a Purpose


    Self-publishing is expensive ... thousands of dollars if you want a professional quality, God honoring book ... there’s editing, artwork for the book cover and it's designing, the process of formatting, producing e-books and printing. That doesn't include a book trailer and all that goes with marketing a book.

    Thank you for considering whatever you can do to help whether a $1 as an encouragement  or any other amount .

    Prayers are essential to accomplishing this goal to help the lepers in India.

    I have been writing children's short stories for over 25 years and have another completed novel complete and at least a third of the sequel to Riches Rags.

    Thank you for being a part of publishing Riches to Rags.

    Please tell your friends, via all the social medias including the old fashioned 'Word of Mouth.

  • I have helped others to fund their Crowdfunding projects. It's fun and it feels good to help friends see their project goals realized.
  • So please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. At this writing there's only 37 hours left.
  • I can't do it without You ... And it's for the lepers we labor
  • Check out my website by clicking on the button below.

story:
WE DID IT!  Keep an eye on our Facebook and Twitter for updates and progress, and anything extra goes towards bringing Robin to Florida to visit us for a few days!

 

 

WE KNOW THE PAGE SAYS THAT WE REACHED $15,000.. BUT WE ACTUALLY HAVE NOT MET OUR GOAL.  Please see the video our parents did here : 

http://youtu.be/wKcOFgDfyJc 

Click that link and watch that video, please, to understand why this campaign is still going. We still need about $2600 more! 

 

Short Summary


My name is Lisa, and Robin is my little sister. She's 20, and has cerebral palsy. She's been confined to a wheelchair her entire life. Due to some rather tragic circumstances, she's spent a good deal of her adolescence in numerous foster placements, and the past few years has resided in a nursing home. Even though our family has always done our best to stay close, Robin hasn't really had much of a chance to know much in the way of stability and security. Despite the unfair cards life has dealt her, my sister is a hero to me, and a sheer inspiration. She always has a smile on her face, a sparkle in her eye, and everyone who meets her describes her as perky and cheerful, with a contagious zest for life. My sister Robin is an exceptionally charasmatic young woman with a generous soul and wonderful potential. She still dreams big, and maintains an enthusiastic outlook. Even with everything she has been through, her bubbly spirit motivates us to not give up like others have.
In her current placement, our family has been doing all we can within our power to make sure her needs are met. However, there’s a very important one that is not. Her wheelchair, needed for her to get around, is older, in need of repair and manual only. For her to do the things she wants, like get a job, hang with friends, taking care of herself, getting to therapy, shopping, & more, a power wheelchair would be much better.
Thus, I got together with our family, and we started "Team Robin".
With all your help we should be able to raise the funding needed to get Robin the power wheelchair that she deserves.

What We Need & What You Get

 

Below, you will read about the Tek RMD, the impetus for starting this fundraiser. However, we have found that it's only available overseas and maintenance and servicing would not be available here domestically.  We researched a number of domestic options, and looks like it will cost us about $20,000. We've been able to extend our campaign until December 14th, in the hopes this will be accomplished. We have a video about it on our Youtube channel (http://www.youtube.com/goteamrobin). Now, we need you more than ever! We're in the home stretch, but still need your help for Robin!  Tis the season, right?


This Amazing Device A New Development in Wheelchairs for Parapalegics


This powerchair, called the Tek Robotic Mobilization Device, is something we came across recently, and Robin desperately needs something like this! She has been in outdated and rickety manual wheelchairs that hinder her health. With what she has been through, she's been denied so much... she deserves something like this so she can build up her strength and become more self-sufficient and independent. Even if we cannot raise enough to fund this miracle, we are researching power-standing wheelchairs (Standing Wheelchair link) that would be beneficial for her. Not only for her independence and self-sufficiency, but her overall health, and her physical therapy progress.
The Tek Robotic Mobilization Device costs about $15,000, as you read in the article. We know that sounds intimidating. We hope that maybe insurance will cover part of it, and in our research, we will discover ways to bring that price down. We're working on that. But that is the ideal goal we'd like for Robin. If that's not able to be achieved, we're still hopeful for a power standing wheelchair that will meet her needs for at least $6,000. That would be the lowest end of the spectrum to improve her quality of life that she so richly deserves.
If we do not reach the goal needed for the wheelchair we hope for her to have, we will use the funds for an upgraded wheelchair that is still conducive for her health and medical needs. If we don't get enough funds for a proper wheelchair? Or if we have any funds left over after we acquire a proficient wheelchair? We'd use the excess to buy her a plane ticket to visit her family in Florida and possibly bring her to Universal (she's a big Harry Potter fan).
We're also working on perks and incentives. We have bracelets that Robin will be making herself, along with t-shirts, as well as all sorts of personal goodies as a thank you for supporting our Robin!

 

Make sure to check out our Youtube, Twitter, and Facebook pages daiily to keep up with everything going on. We'd love to keep you in the loop.   

**Please click the Updates tab to keep track of the latest news, updated pretty much daily.**

Also, keep tabs on our Facebook, Twitter, and/or Tumblr to keep up with all the news!

Your gift will make a huge impact on Robin's life, allowing her to fully enjoy all that is around her that she's been denied for so long. Your contribution makes a difference!

 

** ALSO PLEASE NOTE: If you do make a contribution, and would like to collect on any of the perks , please e-mail us at team_robin@ymail.com  (just so we can verify that you are you, some people aren't so honorable!), just so we have a method in which to get in touch with you. Don't worry, we will keep you anonymous (if you so choose), and we will never sell your information to anyone. We just need to be sure we can contact all of our wonderful contributors! 

 

The Impact


I've watched my little sister struggle for so long, and when we started researching what we could do about her wheelchair, it was realized that a power mobility device will allow her to have a signficantly greater degree of independence and self-sufficiency. This means she'll have greater career options. She'll be able to get out and have a greater social life. This means so many of the things that have held her back before will be out of her way. Doors will be opened that were not before. With a modern wheelchair, she will have options that were not available prior to now.

Other Ways You Can Help


Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help! We'd love for this campaign to go viral. The more people that see this, the more likely we can reach people who can help, and the more likely this dream can be realized for Robin!
So please, whether you can or cannot donate, get the word out and make some noise about Robin's cause. Facebook, Twitter, Google Plus, Tumblr, e-mail, embed it in your website, put it on your blog, smoke signals, however! Thank you!

story:
There are hundreds of travel guide to Paris, but virtually none even mention the city's incredibly rich lesbian and gay culture. I'm specifically reaching out to gay and lesbian visitors to Gay Par-ee, those same-sex-loving travelers who want to learn a little bit more about the role of LGBT men and women in Paris’s incredible history or spend time mixing and mingling with the city’s large, diverse and incredibly welcoming gay community, be it for just a few hours or for your entire Parisian stay. No other city in Europe—and possibly in the entire world—has as large and active a gay community that is supported by as many LGBT-owned or LGBT-friendly businesses as does Paris. There are more than two dozen (yup, two dozen!) gay bars in the city; 25 gay cafes and restaurants, and another dozen-plus that advertise as being gay-friendly; countless gay shops and boutiques; and more than 100 LGBT organizations, including social and cultural groups, athletic leagues, health and support associations and sexual/fetish organizations. And did you know that there are numerous gay and lesbian connections to some of the city’s most popular sightseeing destinations, like Place des Vosges, Pere Lachaise Cemetery and the literary Left Bank? Or that there were (at least) two French kings who preferred the company of men? Of course you didn't, because other Paris travel guides never mention such things. I do! So, if you're a gay person heading to the City of Light and you want some tips on where to learn about YOUR culture and mingle with YOUR people, this guide is a must-have. You won't find the info offered in this guidebook anywhere else!

The LGBT Paris guide will include the following chapters:

1) History of Gay Paris

2) Must-See Gay Sights

3) Sightseeing in the Way-Gay Marais

4) Erotic Art

5) Lesbian Paris

6) Bars, Clubs, Dance Parties and Drag Shows

7) Restaurants

8) Sex Shops, Cruising Bars, Bathhouses and Sex Clubs

9) Shopping

10) Services

11) LGBT Events and Organizations

12) Lodging

I won't just be scratching the surface of Gay Par-ee, I'll be presenting information on EVERY LGBT and LGBT-friendly venue in the city.

 

Most of the book is already researched and is 90% written. A short trip to Paris in late 2012 is planned to finish up with the listings. Once fully written (January 2013), I will be approaching literary agents in the attempt to secure a publisher. As a former editor at national newsmagazines (including The Advocate), I have several resources in this area. If all else fails, I will be self-publishing the guide. Funds raised will be used primarily for the publisher search and revision process or self-publishing costs.

story:
Hey there, my name is Bruno, thank you for visiting my campaing page. I've been living in Taiwan for some time now and I have a dream.

 

My dream is to write a book telling people's stories.

 

But not any story and not any people, I'm planning to visit the most remote and isolated areas of Taiwan for the interviews.

 

In search of people who live in areas that are somehow unreachable and unknown to most of us due to a lack of transportation or difficult terrain conditions.

 

I am convinced that this people have many stories to tell, but have never had the chance to tell them, until now.

 

This book will be their chance to tell their stories to the whole world.

 

I'm planning to conduct the interviews during the months of december and january, putting things together, editing and translating in february to get the book ready for publishing on march 2013 the latest.

 

The book will be published both in english and mandarin and there will be a free online version for everyone to download.

 

I've set up a goal of 3.500 USD and that will cover (hopefully) the purchase of a motorbike + fuel, travel expenses for 6 to 8 weeks, if there's something left will be used for publishing expenses and if there's nothing left it will be self published/printed on demand.

 

If you are interested in joining me on the trip, or want to help out translating, editing, proofreading, or have any questions, suggestions, just write them here on the comments and I'll get back to you, or you can add me to skype: frutigelatin

 

Thank you for reading!

story:
Our Story

Â¡DUENDE! Long Beach was founded in August 2011 by a group of woman artists, poets, performers, and musicians. We are a grassroots community arts organization providing creative programming, mentoring, and performance opportunities for youth in the Long Beach area. Although our approaches to creating are as diverse as our backgrounds, it is the spirit and passion behind our art that unites. Simply, we want to empower and enable the youth in our beloved community with the creative tools they need to become unstoppable leaders and agents for change.


In July 2012, we hope to send a group of talented, committed youth to the Brave New Voices International Youth Poetry Festival in the San Francisco Bay Area, the largest ongoing spoken word event in the world. BNV brings together young artists, activists, educators, poets, and emerging leaders to participate in a celebration and demonstration of free speech, artistic empowerment, and youth voice.


Every year, hundreds of youth compete on slam teams from the U.S. and Europe at BNV. At the center of the festival is the International Youth Poetry Slam. A poetry slam is a high-energy competition where spoken word poets share meaningful original works that are then "judged" by members of the audience. 


However, Brave New Voices also offers numerous community forums, workshops, conferences, and performance events that encourage youth, artists, educators, activists, and community leaders to be advocates and agents for positive change on a local and global scale.



The Impact

Long Beach, California is one of the most culturally and ethnically diverse cities in all the United States. Because of this, the city also has an equally diverse and vibrant arts and cultural scene. Currently, there are dozens of theatre, music, and spoken word venues operating in Long Beach. However, none of them cater specifically to youth. 


Â¡DUENDE! hopes to change this. We envision a Long Beach that values the powerful ideas, talents, and opinions of youth and recognizes their ability to create positive transformation and healing in their communities. 


We believe that spoken word poetry is the perfect artistic medium to enable this vision to become a reality. Spoken word provides a unique opportunity for youth to share their stories and hopes for the future, as a distinct art form that marries music, poetry, theatre, hip hop, and storytelling.


Poetry slams have often been high-octane, dynamic performance events that attract a large audience willing to be inspired and entertained.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with friends, family members, community groups, organizations, etc. through social networking sites such as Facebook, Google+, Tumblr, Twitter, etc.


Please "like" our Facebook page and encourage others to like it as well.


If you are/know a youth who lives in the Long Beach area and is interested in spoken word, please have them contact us.

We are a grassroots community arts organization providing creative programming, mentoring, and performance opportunities for youth in the Long Beach area. Simply, we want to empower and enable the youth in our beloved community with the creative tools they need to become unstoppable leaders and agents for change.


In July 2012, we hope to send a group of talented, committed youth to the Brave New Voices International Youth Poetry Festival in the San Francisco Bay Area, the largest ongoing spoken word event in the world. BNV brings together young artists, activists, educators, poets, and emerging leaders to participate in a celebration and demonstration of free speech, artistic empowerment, and youth voice.

A poetry slam is a high-energy competition where spoken word poets share meaningful original works that are then "judged" by members of the audience.

story:
The Story of Us...

     Phantasmagorium is the literary and artistic collaboration of four friends: a multi-medium artist, an award-winning author, a talented screenwriter and a part-time designer. Our goal was as a simple one, or so we thought:

     To create a venue where talented writers and artists in the genre of horror could publish well honed  visionary works of literature and art...
      And be paid more than a pittance for their considerable efforts to extend the boundaries of the genre.

    Horror has always been an underappreciated medium. For centuries, it has been considered entertainment for the low brow and children. Yet some of the most influential writers and artists of all time created great works of the macabre and grotesque. From Dickinson to Poe, Lovecraft to King, Da Vinci, Dali and Giger; each of these creative geniuses changed the hearts and minds of generations. They did so with the seldom appreciated talent that is needed to craft a believable tale or work that echoes the very basis of the human condition:
 "Life is Pain." ( the Buddha, SiddhÄrta Gautama)

    Phantasmagorium is our attempt to help the current generation of creators to continue to develop the craft and to push the boundaries that is horror.

Impact!

     We aim to assist these talented people!  To begin with, there are some authors from whom we quickly received, edited, and printed their works.  We paid what we could for their excellent short horror stories and poems -- and it was a decent amount, though we would like to be able to increase our purchasing price.  They were published in our new quarterly journal, Phantasmagorium, in print, ePub, Kindle/Mobi, and PDF format.

     (Specifically for artists, we unfortunately did not have enough available cash to pay an artist to do artwork for the first issue.)

     Phantasmagorium has already been picked up by 3 locations of Powell's bookstores and we will continue to expand that in-person offering.  As well, we sell it on our website in multiple electronic versions that suit any reader's needs.  Within the journal itself, we also link eReaders to the author's websites and use the full back page to advertise those same sites or blogs.  What this does for the authors is gives them more exposure to the reading public.

     Issue #2 comes out this month.  We cut back on the number of stories we accepted because we could not afford to pay the same amount to as many and did not want to pay less.  Printing costs ended up being more than we were originally quoted as the cheapest printer who would work with our short 'run' at a discount folded up shop.  And we had other setbacks (file creation/conversion, website issues, etc.) that have tried to keep us down...

     But we do not give up!  There are too many who need their awesome works to be seen and read, and ALSO to survive off of it.  It is not not our 'work', but a mission.

     This project has also brought to light other ways that Gorgon Press can help authors get paid, published, and recognized.  But we can't start toward those goals until we have solidified Phantasmagorium.


What We Need... And What You Get

     We have set the goal for this campaign at $2500.  The MOST important things that it will do is:

* help us pay off the unexpected printer that we had to buy, after the only affordable printing company we could find closed

* hopefully eventually allow us to print 'in bulk', which is the best way to keep the print version affordable

* provide us with a little bit of an advertising budget, instead of relying solely on social media and word-of-mouth

* as well, we'll be able to pay artists for cover designs instead of always relying on our poor overworked Publisher, JD

* and, of course, help us be able to pay a fairer wage without having to charge more for the end-products

     How does helping us help you?  Well, luckily we have tangible products!  Depending upon your generosity, we are able to send you electronic or print copies of the fruits of so many people's labors, and some autographed.  That is how we can thank you directly.

     As well, we are big fans of the 'local' movement.  But one of the few (and most important) things that expands beyond local economies is the written word.  So we do not hesitate to publish great work, no matter where it originated.

     IndieGoGo is a "crowdfunding" website that helps artists and entrepreneurs get their projects and small businesses off the ground.  It has received national press from Good Morning America, the New York Times, Wall Street Journal, PBS and more.  They offer us online resources to promote our start-up and allow us to collect donation (as small as $10) from gracious people like you through a safe and popular payment method (PayPal).  However, we must reach our financial goal in a limited number of days.  Our campaign will end on Feb 23, 2012.  We have lots of plans, so please check back often for updates on our goal and Issue #2!  You can also find us at www.phantasmagorium.co/wordpress or www.facebook.com/groups/271132339566544/.

     Because these are each small goals on their own, Gorgon Press will be able to apply all assistance you give toward easy goals that improve the livelihoods of these talented people!  We might end up starting a separate campaign for an actual 'item' in the near future, which would enable us to attend the many Cons that would help spread the word... but for now, this is an excellent start!


Please!  Other Ways You Can Help Our Mission!

   We appreciate your interest in our fledgling projects!  We encourage you to make yourself known to us so that we may update you as we progress and near completion on Issue #2, as well as assist us in getting the word out!  While Gorgon Press is based in the US, we have already published 2 authors living overseas in Phantasmagorium and enjoy spreading the 'horror' to as many people in as many ways as possible.  Many thanks for any sharing that you do of our campaign and cause.  And no matter what... support your favorite authors and artists!

story:
The Organizing for Mission Cohort of the ELCA is a group of pastors and community organizers working to connect the worlds of community organizing with mission development.

The heart and soul of community organizing in the one to one relational meeting.  That's two people sitting down and having a deep conversation where they each tell their story.  That simple habit happens again and again and builds a network of relationship that gets people connected and fired up to make a difference in their community.

Recently, pastors in the ELCA with a background in organizing have figured out that an organized community is also fertile ground for spiritual connection and thriving congregations have sprung up out of organizing efforts.  Some of the most exciting ministry in the ELCA is happening as a result of this work.  These congregations are dedicated to Social Justice and are making a real difference in their communities.

We have been invited to attend the Fall gathering of this group and we're excited to be a part of this and we both plan to make organizing a central part of our ministry.  The ELCA covers all of our expenses once we arrive, but we're looking for your help to pay our travel expenses.  The gathering will be from October 16th to the 19th in Chicago and our travel expenses will be around $700 total.

We thought that this site would be a good way for our friends and family to support our ministry and we appreciate any money that you can pledge.

Thanks,
Josh and Sara

story:
My nonfiction book entitled The Great Fairy Tales of Christianity: The Negative Impact of Religion In The Black Community is a completed manuscript, which I'd like to publish under my own publishing label, New Revolution Publications. I'm asking for minimum funding in the amount of $2,501 to get started with publishing my book. As a publisher, I would use the services of Lightning Source, which is a publishing company that specializes in print-on-demand, trade paperback and hardback, color books, binding, photography, indexing, illustration, marketing, distribution, digital cover, and digital bookblock. Therefore, all funding that I receive from generous donors would be used for printing, binding, photography, indexing, illustration, marketing, distribution, digital cover, and digital bookblock. I would also use the money for travel/lodging expenses incurred on a promotional tour for my book. The Great Fairy Tales of Christianity: The Negative Impact of Religion In The Black Community is a project that I am most proud of because it is my own personal account of how I transitioned from Christianity to atheism. It is also an honest discussion on the negative impact that religious systems have on the world, and how organized religion account for much of the world's miseries today, including much of the problems that exist in Black America. Because I grew up in a predominantly religious community and was indoctrinated in the Christian faith, it was devastatingly painful to realize that I was raised to believe in an ancient fairy tale. Therefore, I decided to write about my own personal journey from spiritual enslavement to enlightenment.

The Great Fairy Tales of Christianity: The Negative Impact of Religion In The Black Community is a comprehensive subject that tackles a controversial issue on whether organized religion is outdated and whether the bible is to be rendered obsolete. The great fairy tales passed on from generation to generation by primitive-thinking folk have no place in the age of science and reasoning. My book questions whether religious faith is still relevant as we homo sapiens continue to progress in the age of modern technology.

My creative writing journey began at the age of thirteen with essay writing. I later taught myself how to write short stories and poetry. In addition to writing and publishing my debut novel entitled The Evil Within Himin 2007, I've published a short story collection entitled Vanished and Other Short Stories in 2002. I’ve also published Matters of the Heart: A Collection of Short Stories, Poetry & Creative Nonfiction in 2004. My current project is important, because it is a my discourse on the psychological trauma associated with religious indoctrination and how dangerous it is to expose children to religious belief systems before they are mentally mature enough to make informed decisions on what they will choose to believe and not believe. 

My nonfiction book will be the first published work under New Revolution Publications. Since I already have an account with Lightning Source, I will simply submit my completed manuscript to the company, which will then create a file, generate color template, scan for title submission standards, create a digital cover and digital bookblock, and determine the weight and spine width of my book. The finished project will be a fantastic nonfiction work with a great cover that Lightning Source will first get approved through me prior to printing my book.

I am asking for a minimum of $2,501 in funding to get my project started. The funds will be used for initial publishing costs associated with printing, digital cover, digital bookblock, general color template, binding, illustration, indexing, and photography. The funds will also cover the costs associated with distribution, advertisement, travel/lodging, and the purchase of a quantity of books that I will sell at book signing events. If I overfund my project, I will use the extra money to publish my completed manuscript entitled American Essays On Popular Culture. 

Thank you for your assistance in helping me to accomplish my short-term and long-term goals in the business of writing and publishing.

story:
“And in the end, of course, a true war story is never about war. It's about sunlight. It's about the special way that dawn spreads out on a river when you know you must cross the river and march into the mountains and do things you are afraid to do. It's about love and memory. It's about sorrow. It's about sisters who never write back and people who never listen.”  - Tim O'Brien

Since 2001, The United States has sent over two million of its men and women, young and old, to war.  They have borne witness to war without fronts, combat without respite, and ever-changing distinctions between enemy and ally.  They have borne witness to history.

Line of Advance will launch as a non-profit online literary journal dedicated to seeking out, giving voice to and preserving the literary writings of these soldiers.

And we're asking for your help to help make this vision a reality.  We're raising funds for seed money that will help us get off the ground in order to meet our Veteran's Day 2013 launch date. 

Q: How will Line of Advance work? The journal itself will be published bi-monthly in various ebook formats (iOS, Kindle, ePub) and will be available for as small a fee as we can manage.  An annual high-quality printed edition of the journal will be produced each Veterans Day beginning in 2014 and made available for order as well.  We have created an Editors Board of highly regarded writers and professors to assist us in reviewing submitted work for publication.  Writers whose work is selected for publication will receive financial awards, and should we raise sufficient funds, small college scholarships for either themselves or their children.  Ongoing content will be posted at www.lineofadvance.org, including guest columns, recommended reading, and journal news updates.

Q: Who are the founders? Line of Advance was founded by three American military veterans (two enlisted, one officer) who served together in Afghanistan and recognized that veterans needed to to tell their stories, and that the public deserved to read them.  

Q: What will funds be used for? Funds contributed via Indiegogo will be used to help pay for startup costs including website and ebook design and development, awards for writers, legal fees and advertising.

Q: Where will the writing come from? We have already begun reaching out to the veteran community through various channels to invite writing submissions.  We will pay for advertising space on military.com and various service branch publications and websites (eg. Army Times).  We are also launching an outreach campaign to college and university writing professors that will ask them to encourage their students who have served overseas to submit their work for publication.

Q: Are you personally profiting from the project? We've been funding things out of our own pockets thus far.  Line of Advance has applied for formal 501(c)3 non-profit status from the Internal Revenue Service, and has in-place fully transparent accounting practices, disclosure policies and conflict-of-interest bylaws.

Q: Where will the writing come from? We have already begun reaching out to the veteran community through various channels to invite writing submissions.  We will pay for advertising space on military.com and various service branch publications and websites (eg. Army Times).  We are also launching an outreach campaign to college and university writing professors that will ask them to encourage their students who have served overseas to submit their work for publication.
Q: Are you personally profiting from the project? We've been funding things out of our own pockets thus far.  Line of Advance has applied for formal 501(c)3 non-profit status from the Internal Revenue Service, and has in-place fully transparent accounting practices, disclosure policies and conflict-of-interest bylaws.

story:
**For every book pre-ordered, $1 will be donated to National Mill Dog Rescue.**

What Is This About?

I know puppy mills are evil. You know puppy mills are evil. It's time the whole world knows!

I am the creator (photographer & author) of The Photo Book Projects, a series of photo books designed to raise awareness about misunderstood and mistreated dogs. The first books were Deaf Dogs (my dog was born deaf), Rescued in America (on rescued dogs) and Pit Bulls & Pit Bull Type Dogs.

This book, Puppy Mill Survivors, will be the fourth book in the series and it is the most important. It is 2013 and still puppies are being bred in commercial puppy mills around the country. These dogs have very few rights legally. Many live in isolation, with no exercise, inadequate food, no veterinary care, no socialization, no emotional care and no playtime. Many have never been walked. Some live in cages so small that they can't even stand up straight. The wire-floor cages they are forced to stand on tear up the pads of their feet. The females are bred too frequently and their health suffers because of it. Once the breeder dogs are too old to be profitable to the mills' owners, they are disposed of, either killed or dropped off at a kill shelter.

This needs to change! This book will educate people about these mills and help people learn that they should NEVER buy a puppy from a pet store or an online breeder whose physical site they have never visted. More than 90% of dogs in pet stores are from puppy mills, and many online puppy sites get the dogs they sell from puppy mills, too, even when they say they don't. I want this book to get national press. It is time that things change for these dogs. Things NEED to change for these dogs.

Where Does the Money Go? What if We Don't Raise the Full Amount?

I produce high-quality photo books that are printed in the U.S. The books are FSC-certified and Rainforest Alliance certified. A percentage of the proceeds from book sales is donated to rescues around the country.

If all of the printing money is raised, the Puppy Mill book will be approximately 140-160 pages and will contain the stories and photos of 50 former puppy mill dogs who have now found their forever homes. THIS WILL NOT BE A SAD BOOK. This book will be full of HEARTWARMING stories of adorable dogs who have overcome the odds and found the perfect loving home they always deserved.

This is the FINAL ATTEMPT to raise this money. If the money isn't raised then the books will be printed online using a digital printing site such as blurb.com.  I won't be able to sell the book in bookstores or on my website. In short, if the money isn't raised, this book won't have as big of an impact because we won't be able to get press coverage and not as many people will find and see the book.

So WE NEED TO RAISE THE MONEY to get these books printed ourselves in order for the book to have the impact it needs to have...in order for the dogs to get the help they need and deserve.

What Do You Get for Your Contribution?

For $15 you get: A SIGNED copy of  "Don't forget me. Stop Puppy Mills" open edition print. This INCLUDES shipping (see high contribution amounts for Canadian & Worldwide shipping addresses)
 
For $35 you get: A SIGNED COPY of the Puppy Mill Survivors photo book (U.S. shipping only - see higher contributions amounts for Canadian & Worldwide shipping addresses). Check out the other contribution levels to get multiple copies of the Puppy Mill Survivors book.
 
For $125 you get: SIGNED COPIES of all 4 of my books: 1 copy each of Deaf Dogs, Rescued in America, Pit Bulls & Pit Bull Type Dogs AND Puppy Mill Survivors...all SIGNED! (U.S. shipping only - see higher contribution amounts for Canadian & Worldwide shipping addresses).

The Impact & Donations to National Mill Dog Rescue

I raised enough money to print the Pit Bulls & Pit Bull Type Dogs photo book using Kickstarter.com. We can certainly raise enough here to get the Puppy Mill book printed! Let's do this!

PLUS, for every book pre-ordered, I will donate $1 to National Mill Dog Rescue.

Other Ways You Can Help

This is just ONE way I am raising the total printing costs of $30,000! I am also offering...

Sponsorships & Dedications: Get your name, your business' name and website, or a dedication to your dog listed at the back of the Puppy Mill photo book. The cost is just $25. Click here to sponsor!

Fun & Cool Pop Art Artwork: Pop Art prints made from photos of YOUR pet that you email to us. We create pop art graphics, AND showcase these images on our website. You get a print of your pop art and get to show off your dog on our website. For slightly more you can get your own dog's story added to the site! On our site, there is a general page for all dogs, and pages showcasing Rescued Dogs, Deaf Dogs, Pit Bull Type Dogs and even a page for Rescued Cats! Click here to get a graphic made of your dog!

TELL EVERYONE YOU KNOW! Indiegogo also has tools for you to share this project with your friends! Help spread the word on Facebook, Twitter, Pinterest and email!

Thank you so much for your help!

story:
Our Story

Greetings! Thank you for your uncontrollable desire to learn more about these Africans in Greek Mythology :)... We couldn't resist these stories either. We are a team of entrepreneurs that create new and innovative ways for children to learn history and culture. Our creative juices started rolling in when we discovered Homer's "blameless Ethiopians" or what we call Africans today. We feel this story introduces one very important theme to children; historical perspectives. There are many negative things presented to us at a very young age concerning the "dark continent" and these Africans in Greek Mythology challenge this limited worldview. What better story to tell! It is unique and new! First of its kind.

With your help we will pioneer a new age concerning historical perspectives and highlight diversity. The beautiful illustrations of Africans will certainly be one of a kind; truly a rare site seen throughout popular culture. The book will be written in poetic and romantic style that will leave the reader desiring to learn more about these people. Stories like these are important to our children as it helps them embrace our diverse society.

Here is why you should Give:



  • Truly Unique Story
  • Beautiful Illustrations!
  • Kids will Love it!



What We Need & What You Get

We need a total of 8,000 USD for our book project to fulfill the expenses of the artists (illustrators and writers). We will also use the remaining funds to market our book throughout the stages of its release. Any amount will do as long as you support! We provide great incentive for your support!

 Featured Prize for support! Snapback hats


  • Social media will be big for us concerning marketing!
  • Snapback Hats are very stylish and help bring awareness to our project!
  • We want to make this book as visible as possible with your help...the more funds the better!


    The Impact

    This project will help many children gain a new perspective of history, culture and worldviews. The exposure helps to advance the universal nature of humanity. The faces are different and new to popular culture and this brings value to the project and to its young audience.


        Other Ways You Can Help

        Share Share Share!!!! Tell your friends with just a few clicks! We appreciate exposure if your funds are unavailable to us (we understand the struggle)

        • Make some noise
        • Tell your friends

        We hope our passion has rubbed off on you!




        Past Projects


        Tears of Nuba is a clash of culture that pins great minds and fighters together in a tournament of talent. Fighters in search of their own identity use their abilities to win respect and honor. Play to learn their story and the story of humanity!



        DOWNLOAD AT THE APPSTORE! TEARS OF NUBA

story:
Story of My Book

Sparked is a framework I created to guide young adults to recognize and reach their own true potential. Emphasis on “their own" free of the external opinions of others.

My name is Fatimah Ibidunni and I am the author of Sparked. I wrote this book because, as someone who struggled with finding myself, I was unsuccessful in my search for a guide that clearly laid out the path for me and made it clear that my vision for myself was possible. I continually compared myself to others and molded myself into what I believed I should be, overlooking who I already was.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your true self and be proud of that person and their potential. In this book, I hope to change the narrative that becoming a man or woman of excellence is only limited to a select few. I want every reader to see this book as a tool to help you create the life that you envision for yourself. One that is free of any external opinions or comparisons, with the focus being entirely on who you know yourself to be.

In this book, you'll learn about personal development and finding your spark:
  • In a vulnerable interview from Tatiana Elizabeth a model and beauty influencer, she speaks about her path where you will learn the importance of recognizing and believing in your gifts.
  • From actor and comedian Yvonne Orji about her unconventional path to Hollywood which required her to defy her parents to follow a spark in her life.
  • Through stories from my own life and other young millennials who are striving to make their mark on this world while staying true to who they are.

You will love this book if you have struggled to find what that special thing is that you have to offer this world. If you already know what it is and need guidance, this is also the book for you. It was written to encourage young adults and serve as a guide to becoming the person you envision yourself to be. The trick is simply keeping your eyes open for sparks, trusting your intuition, and focusing on your interests and traits that are unique to you.

Sparked is a non-fiction book that speaks to young millennials and adults alike who are looking at self-discovery and guidance for the first time when it comes to putting themselves first as they move through life’s rollercoaster. Sparked is to encourage young adults to free themselves from the external noise and focus on putting themselves first in life’s pursuits.

 

The Book - Sparked

The book is written in 5 Parts.

Part 1 contains the Introduction + Chapters 1-3. In this section, you will learn about The Toxic Mindset. Here, I outline what has led me and many others to our lowest points of doubt and what can be done to pull ourselves out.

Part 2 contains Chapters 4-6. In this section, you will learn about Getting in the Game. We will dive into the important steps involved in building up your self-confidence and worth. Included here are stories from influential women on the lessons they have learned that ultimately will prepare you for the journey ahead.

Part 3 contains Chapters 7-9. Here the topic of Sparks is introduced. Put simply sparks are just another word for interests. This chapter will introduce my theory on how Finding Your Spark is a necessary piece of the puzzle in your journey.

Part 4 contains Chapters 10-13. In this section, it is Time To Get Serious. At this point, you should be fired up about your potential. We are going to go over what you need to do next to put everything together. Many stories are included in this section from my own stories, to those of young millennials and influential icons.

Part 5 contains Chapters 14-18. Finally, it’s all about The Highway To Success. This section is to get you prepared for what is next once you have locked your sights on the future you plan to create for yourself.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2019
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Christmas season.

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

About the Author

Fatimah Ibidunni is an incoming Global Finance and Business Management Analyst in Chicago. In addition, she is the face of travel and lifestyle blog, Simply Timah and Co-Founder of a digital marketing agency, The Wealthy Kids. Fatimah made the choice to showcase her journey of balancing both work and play through creative and engaging content on Youtube and Instagram which guides her audience through her balancing act of enjoying the wonders of the world while also pursuing her professional endeavors.

Fatimah is a travel junkie who is in awe of the adventures that lie all over the globe, from trying new foods to meeting new people. When she is not on the go, she loves nothing more than spending time with the ones she loves and being in the beautiful city of Chicago

For more information, you can connect with Fatimah through email at ibidunni.f@gmail.com on Instagram and YouTube @simplytimah, as well as LinkedIn at Fatimah Ibidunni. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #Sparked and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

xoxo,
Fatimah Ibidunni

story:
Resumen

 

Soy Alberto López Calvo, más conocido como Claalc en Internet, fundador de Taller Skywalker, miembro de The Force Group, presentador del podcast de la Biblioteca del Templo Jedi y colaborador de Cificom. Toda la vida me ha encantado escribir, sobre todo relatos y novelas fanfiction. De hecho, mi primera novela, desarrollada cuando tan solo tenía 9 años, tomaba como protagonista a Indiana Jones. Años después, publiqué, bajo el sello de UNO Editorial, una obra de James Bond titulada 007: Libertad para Vengarse con notable éxito de ventas, dado que no solo recuperé lo invertido sino que, además, obtuve algunos beneficios y muy buenas críticas.

 

Ahora, pretendo repetir la operación con esta novela de Star Wars que escribí hace algunos años. Claro que para eso requiero de tu colaboración, a cambio de la cual obtendrás un ejemplar de la obra. El libro incluye, además, 25 relatos cortos de mi cosecha -ambientados tanto en la Trilogía Clásica como en la de las Precuelas- y su propio marcapáginas. 

 

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes

 

Únicamente necesito 728€. Con este dinero cubriría todos los gastos, que son los siguientes:

 
  • 640€ = coste de la impresión de la tirada de 50 ejemplares 
  • 32€ = coste del uso de esta página de crowdfounding
  • 56€ = coste de las transferencias bancarias

 

A cambio de tu aportación de 25€, tienes derecho a:

 

  • 1 Novela "Star Wars: Misión Fortuita"
  • 25 relatos cortos de Star Wars
  • 1 Marcapáginas
  • 1 Novela "Star Wars: Misión Fortuita" en formato Word y PDF
  • 25 relatos cortos de Star Wars en formato Word y PDF
  • Gastos de envío incluidos (por correo ordinario, no certificado, y solo península ibérica)

 

En caso de que no se logre alcanzar la meta total, tomaré una de estas dos decisiones:

 

  • Si alcanzo al menos el 80% de la meta, seguiré adelante, es decir, pondré el resto del dinero de mi bolsillo, de modo que trataré de conseguir el resto por medio de la venta posterior de la obra.
  • Si no alcanzo el 80% de la meta, utilizaré el dinero para lanzar una tirada de 25 ejemplares, cuyo coste de fabricación es de 542 euros.

 

Dado que faltaría que la imprenta maquete tanto la obra como los relatos cortos, al estar en formato Word en formato A4, al tamaño clásico de 15x21 cm, he calculado que rondará las 350 páginas. Contará con encuadernación rústica fresada (tapas blandas) e incluirá solapas y marcapáginas. La portada irá en papel estucado mate de 300 gramos, mientras que el resto constará de papel offset ahuesado de 90 gramos.

 

El impacto

 

Dado que tanto la novela como los 25 relatos cortos siempre han gustado mucho en todos los sitios y foros de Internet en los que los he publicado, pienso que merecen tener una versión física. Así se podrán disfrutar de una mejor manera que delante de una pantalla. Al mismo tiempo, me permitiría obtener un mayor reconocimiento porque bien es sabido que se tiende a infravalorar lo digital y lo gratuito.

Lo digo por experiencia propia. Nunca se tuvo en cuenta mi colección de 20 relatos cortos de James Bond o la citada novela 007: Libertad para Vengarse hasta que publiqué el conjunto de todo ello en un ejemplar físico. ¡Incluso fui entrevistado por La Nueva España, el periódico de mayor tirada de Asturias, ahí es nada!

 

Riesgos y desafíos

 

Dado que tanto la novela como los 25 relatos cortos ya están escritos, el único riesgo reside en la financiación. Como expliqué en un apartado anterior, el plan B pasa por contratar una tirada de 25 ejemplares en vez de una de 50 en caso de que no alcance el 80% de la meta.

 

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

 

Compartiendo esta compaña a través de la herramientas propias de Indiegogo o cualquier red social, foro, página, etc. Con especial atención, claro, a aquellas relacionadas con Star Wars.

story:
Short Summary

      My name is Laura Marie Parker.  I am a mother of three boys and the wife of an artist.  After experiencing the power of giving birth in my own home with my husband there to assist me, I began to understand the responsibility and wonder of what it feels like to take ones power for themselves in order to be self-reliant.  So often do we give ourselves away to others to experiment with their own curiosity, and we forget how to own our intuition, we forget that we chose to come here with a purpose.  I am writing a book about my process in how I came to understand the power I have to heal myself.  My book is a spiritual story, it is a love story, it is a birth story.

      My dream and intention in this lifetime is to help people come back to their primal self, the self that is always held and nurtured by Mother Earth.  When we are able to relax into being, we are able to heal our bodies, be nourished deeply and feel full of energy and life, we begin to depend on our light source instead of seeking the support of drugs, we connect fully with our loved ones, and we are able to birth our creations with harmony, trust and love with the Great Spirit.  I am asking for my community and the world's help so that I can spend my time in this life carrying my message of light, love, and truth. 

     I have connected with my purpose in life, to be a writer, a healer, and guide for those who are seeking to be fully connected, conscious and empowered in their lives and in the birth of the their children.  This campaign will give me the support I need to get my feet wet, so that I may jump in fully as a creator, as I have a lifetime of books to create, I am ready to begin.   

 I have three parts in this campaign that will begin my venture as a Published Author, and a Birth/Soul Mentor.  There are two small zine books I will produce, one is a cookbook for women who are in the process of growing, laboring and caring for a new baby, the other is a small zine book that serves as a guide for those who want to lead and create a Blessing Way ceremony for Birthing Mothers.  Your contributions will help me create and produce these two mini books and will help me to write, illustrate, edit and self-publish my book Birth Is Now, which is a book about how changing the way we see birth, will empower people to change the way they view themselves and the world.

 

 

What I Need and What You Get

I have set a goal of $25,000. This amount will support me in putting my entire self into the project; this book is the emblem of my true soul purpose in life and it deserves to be given a great value.  Depending on how much is raised will vary the costs of what I will put into the printing and mailing costs, so I will give you a general breakdown of where the money goes and say honestly that it will be disbursed in a very honest fashion and will all go back into the community in conscious ways.  A quarter of the amount will fund the perk reciprocation, another quarter will help fund the production of more books which I will take on the road with me to book readings/signings and birth conventions.  Another quarter will provide living expenses while I am writing the books,producing the books and licking many envelopes with books enclosed, and the final quarter goes to paying tuition to Waldorf School during the time that I am producing my book, so that my kids are nurtured by a loving and inspiring environment while I work.  I am asking for the amount that allows me to give this project my full and true self, which in turn is my giveaway.  (One note:  I am fixing up a xerox machine, so that I can print my little zines and continue to write and print more, so if anyone has skills in xerox maintenance let me know).

My two mini books are wonderful for a gift to an expecting mother, who needs the most support in a time of her life when she needs to feel closest to the earth and the mother spirit. These two perks are perks for those who can spare $15.  My book Birth Is Now will be signed by me and is a a truthful telling of the creator in all of us male or female, and for $25 you get a signed first printing.  For you friendly supporters that want a signed book but want to get a little more love from me, I will write a personal inspiring message in the cover for a $50 contribution.  For $100 you will recieve an original print of the cover art for the book, created by my amazing artist husband, Jacob j. Norris.  There are two packages created with the midwife or Birth Center in mind.  These packages include tickets to the book is published party, multiple copies of the three books all with personal inscriptions, and a print of the cover art.  ( read more details in perks section).  There is the Goddess of Birth package, for those of you who love to experience nourishing, exquisite cooking and who want to be big supporters of my birth movement this is $1000. (read more in perks).

In the case that I do not reach my goal, I will continue to be a single pointed arrow in creating my Books.  I am asking for this amount to build enough capital to support me in being a full time writer/mother/birth mentor, so if I don't get the full $25,000, it will not stop me, though it may slow me down a bit.  If I get the full amount I will be living in my truth, leading the way for others to live in theirs.  There is no denying the goodness in that.

 

The Impact

Woman used to give birth by flowing rivers, in tipis, surrounded by their tribe of women, or alone behind a tree near their village.  Women used to Bleed into the dirt, feeling their power and connection to the earth.  Women used to bathe in the rivers, dance under the full moon, and know which plant to pick to heal the body of their loved ones.  And still we hold this wisdom deep within our memories;  deep within our memories we know how to heal ourselves.  It takes patience and gentleness, and it begins with birth.  My book Birth is Now is intended to give permission back to all of us who yearn to spend our time with the earth, who yearn to be full with health and joy, who yearn to sing our babies into the world.

 Last year I wrote a small zine called "Destroy,Create, Be.  A raw and real  zine by Laura Marie Parker and Jacob J. Norris."   When I printed and sold it, I was able to feel the truth of what I am here to do in this earth walk.  I am hear to speak about what I see and to share my experiences of challenges, tests, stepping into power, and taking the power for myself so that I can be truly be self- reliant, not only in a financial way, but in the way of owning myself and my truth. 

I love my husband deeply.  I love my self deeply.  I am learning to love all the insecurities about myself that my children show me I have, so that I can nurture them with gentleness.  I gave birth to my third son in a pool at home with only my husband, and it took me knowing that no one else could do it for me.  Now I am ready to achieve an equally powerful act and write about it.

Other Ways You Can Help

Thank you for taking the time to look over my campaign.  I appreciate any help that you can give.  Passing on the word, sharing my campaign with others, writing articles, sending people you know that would like to support me, are all ways you can help too!

story:
La Roja de Bruselas es un equipo amateur de fútbol que representa a España en la Brussels Euroleague (www.bxleuroleague.eu), una competición en la que participan 21 equipos formados como selecciones nacionales.
 
Hemos completado cuatro temporadas con muy buenos números: 3º, 1º, 3º y 3º, además de la victoria hace dos años en el trofeo de Copa. Entre 2010 y 2011 pasamos 44 partidos sin perder (40 victorias y 4 empates). Estamos en plenos play-offs de nuestra 5ª temporada y ya vamos por 1/4 de final.

Además, la temporada pasada se puso en marcha "La Rojita de Bruselas", un proyecto formativo para niños de entre 3 y 11 años. Por ahora tenemos cuatro equipos: 1 sub11, 2 sub8 y 1 sub5 que ya suman casi 50 niños. Son la cantera, la apuesta de futuro y una forma de organizar actividades para los niños españoles que viven en Bruselas. Por ahora se financian gracias a sus padres, pero queremos ayudarles para que den un salto adelante.
 
Necesitamos tu ayuda para seguir creciendo. La crisis nos ha hecho perder varios sponsors y el crecimiento del equipo genera más gastos: alquiler de campos, inscripción en competiciones, equipaciones, material de entrenamientos, etc. Los jugadores ponen una cuota anual, tenemos varios sponsors, organizamos fiestas e incluso vendemos algo de merchandising, pero no llega.

Ahora acudimos a ti para que, dentro de tus posibilidades, nos ayudes a seguir adelante con este proyecto que tantas alegrías nos ha dado y que moviliza a buena parte de la comunidad española de Bruselas con iniciativas como la de "La Rojita de Bruselas", el germen de la cantera que ya es una realidad.
 
Si haces tu aportación firmándola, aparecerás en nuestra web (www.larojadebruselas.eu) en el apartado de "miembros de honor". Pero también puedes hacerla de forma anónima. No hay ningún límite, puedes donar desde 1 euro. Si quieres hacerla a nombre de tu empresa, pondremos tu logo entre nuestros patrocinadores durante un año si tu contribución es de un mínimo de 300 euros y durante 2 años si aportas 500 euros. Tenemos, como puedes ver en la imagen que preside esta página, una gran exposición mediática.

Y si no tienes medios para ayudarnos, te agradeceríamos que dieras a conocer nuestro proyecto entre tus contactos y, sobre todo, en las redes sociales.
 
Mil gracias,
 
Idafe Martín Pérez, capitán de La Roja de Bruselas

story:
WHAT IS BYBS? 


STEP 1. Read the book's Preface

STEP 2. Keep reading. 


The Be You Be Sure Project (a.k.a. BYBS!) is a mixed-media publishing venture on a mission to help millennials discover and pursue their convictions. We're here to encourage the search young people take to find out who they are and what they believe in. 

Our ultimate goal is to promote liberty through self-discovery. We want to make our readers feel good about who they are and where they're at, while offering tools (never taught in school) to help them decide for themselves the best way to move forward in their lives. 

We believe this process can help heal our planet. 


The millennial movement of young adults on a quest to find their purpose is already happening.


  • Who am I? 
  • What should I do? 


Perhaps no two questions haunt modern emerging adults more (and certainly some more than others). Yet, these two questions have inspired our entire campaign.

 


 “There is only one success – to be able to spend life in your own way.” - Christopher Morley 



WHO IS THIS BOOK FOR?

Emerging adults. 20-somethings. Kidults. Members of Generation Screwed. The infamous millennials, who may seem from the outside like drifters who won't grow up and can't commit. This book is for all the people who want to better understand us, too. 

If you’re someone who believes that maximizing profits is the only North Star, that confusion is life's only constant, that you must look around at other people to figure out who you are and what to do  – than this is not your book.

This book is a crash-course through America for the young people who want to take the jump to test their dreams, because now is the time to do it. Our book is for the 83 percent of 20-somethings who know this decade in life is full of change, and the 86 percent who crave careers with meaning. We are an ode to the many millennials out there who are choosing to live their truth in the face of uncertainty. 

Our founders started this project to address the widely documented rates of anxiety, depression, and feelings of worthlessness currently afflicting young adults worldwide due to disheartening economic realities. It is our hope to inspire; to energize young people to hold tightly to their virtues, despite the disappointment, rejection, sadness, and trauma that are a part of life. 

We are building empathy by humanizing the life experiences of the people in our diverse generation. 

We are fuel to keep you banging on the door of opportunity, until someone lets you inside the damn gate. 



WHAT MAKES OUR PROJECT DIFFERENT?

There are a ton of books on how to come-of-age in post-industrial America. Really, there are a ton. We’re different. We’re not going to tell you to define the value of your life based on how quickly you get married, buy a house, make babies, and land a job that earns you a spot in the upper middle class. Yes, all these things are lovely. They are what most people ultimately desire. However, due to economic and political forces outside of our control like: debt, inflation, unemployment, and staggering income inequality, the reality of many millennials resides far from this picture-perfect scenario. So much so that 50 percent of 25 to 32-year-olds see this 'American Dream' as fading. 

Our book is the missing voice willing to celebrate this shift in social norms. We recognize that depending on luck, biology, your capitalist-imposed lot in life, and what you feel called to do as a career, you may never get the proposal by age 30, or the mortgage you can't afford, or the kids – and this shouldn’t constitute failing if it was the outcome of self-understanding and a steady stream of conscious decision-making. 

Our book is for the outliers, as well as those who want a conventional life. We've interviewed bankers, homeless people, lobbyists, artists, law school students, non-profit workers, plus size models, farmers, nurses, plus many others to create the most comprehensive guide through your twenties MADE BY 20-SOMETHINGS that exists in the market today. 

This is a book people of all ages can learn from. 

The millennials are throwing away traditional notions of success. We, along with a growing number of Americans, know there is no linear track toward true wealth and wellness. 


REWARDS


OUR VISION 

A country where people are personally liberated to live the life they choose, where diversity and variance is embraced; a place where free will and creativity is more fully realized to implement solutions and cooperatively transform the structure of our society to be more caring, more sustainable, and more beneficial for more of its participants.

We believe your twenties are the perfect time to pursue self-realization, and that doing so is essential for the future of this planet.  We need more intentional members of society if we are going to rise to solve its most pressing issues.

Across the board, it is the goal of emerging adults everywhere to live a better life than their parents. Previously, this 'better' life was defined as moving up in class and income. All this has changed since the recession that has not ended. Millennials are now the first generation in history predicted to be worse off than our predecessors by this definition. 

It is BYBS's vision that our generation will grow to redefine quality of life in America - that we will reject this quantitative interpretation, learn to do more with less, and work together to enjoy a joyful existence on this planet filled with so much visible suffering as well as beauty. 

We. Dream. Big. 

Join us as we steadfastly stride toward the ideal...

tripping. along. the. way. 


HOW WILL THESE FUNDS BE USED?

We need to complete the second half of our research - to stay on the road to interview more people. Gas is expensive. Our RV runs like an old woman with osteoporosis. She breaks down and needs constant maintenance. 

The septic tank leaks. Our fridge doesn't work. A rat ate through our water pump and our electrical system. This isn't meant to be a sob story, but to keep going we have to face this reality. 

We've invested all our savings (every last penny) to get this far. Publishing is expensive. Not only will the funds received make our research more thorough, it will also help us pay for: 

  • conceptual & line editing
  • proofreading
  • bulk printing
  • marketing & PR 
  • distribution

Our ultimate goal is to have this be on the shelves of bookstores and in college campuses across America. 

Increased visibility = increased awareness = increased action. 

We are open to being picked up by a publishing house - if we get to keep our message, as it is - because this is the best way to achieve our goal. However, it's a crap shoot. We are doing this fundraising campaign to make sure this information is brought to the masses.  

METHODOLOGY

We used our brains on this. Learn more about the science behind our research.

Give your two cents on topics far and wide by filling out this Likert-scale questionnaire.


VIDEO CREDITS:

Song: "Follow the Sun" - Xavier Rudd

Sound Editing: Joshua Van Dyke // Contact: jvdaudio@gmail.com

Big thanks to Adam Saewitz and TruthNow for all the love, push, and support.

WHAT IS BYBS? STEP 1. Read the book's PrefaceSTEP 2. Keep reading. The Be You Be Sure Project (a.k.a. BYBS!) is a mixed-media publishing venture on a mission to help millennials discover and pursue their convictions. We're here to encourage the search young people take to find out who they are and what they believe in. Our ultimate goal is to promote liberty through self-discovery. We want to make our readers feel good about who they are and where they're at, while offering tools (never taught in school) to help them decide for themselves the best way to move forward in their lives. We believe this process can help heal our planet. 
The millennial movement of young adults on a quest to find their purpose is already happening.

Who am I? 

What should I do? 
Perhaps no two questions haunt modern emerging adults more (and certainly some more than others). Yet, these two questions have inspired our entire campaign.  “There is only one success – to be able to spend life in your own way.” - Christopher Morley WHO IS THIS BOOK FOR?Emerging adults. 20-somethings. Kidults. Members of Generation Screwed. The infamous millennials, who may seem from the outside like drifters who won't grow up and can't commit. This book is for all the people who want to better understand us, too. If you’re someone who believes that maximizing profits is the only North Star, that confusion is life's only constant, that you must look around at other people to figure out who you are and what to do  – than this is not your book.This book is a crash-course through America for the young people who want to take the jump to test their dreams, because now is the time to do it. Our book is for the 83 percent of 20-somethings who know this decade in life is full of change, and the 86 percent who crave careers with meaning. We are an ode to the many millennials out there who are choosing to live their truth in the face of uncertainty. Our founders started this project to address the widely documented rates of anxiety, depression, and feelings of worthlessness currently afflicting young adults worldwide due to disheartening economic realities. It is our hope to inspire; to energize young people to hold tightly to their virtues, despite the disappointment, rejection, sadness, and trauma that are a part of life. We are building empathy by humanizing the life experiences of the people in our diverse generation. We are fuel to keep you banging on the door of opportunity, until someone lets you inside the damn gate. WHAT MAKES OUR PROJECT DIFFERENT?There are a ton of books on how to come-of-age in post-industrial America. Really, there are a ton. We’re different. We’re not going to tell you to define the value of your life based on how quickly you get married, buy a house, make babies, and land a job that earns you a spot in the upper middle class. Yes, all these things are lovely. They are what most people ultimately desire.
