story:
***Please scroll down for the English version***

3594 Miles là ai?

Chúng tôi là ba người bạn cấp III từ Việt Nam: Rio Lam, Zi Nguyen, và Iris Le. Hiện tại chúng tôi đang học Đại học ở Mỹ, và theo đuổi những mục tiêu khác nhau: Rio tiếp tục con đường viết lách từ khi ở Việt Nam, Zi hiện đang hoạt động trong lĩnh vực Nhiếp ảnh thời trang; và Iris hướng đến mục tiêu trở thành thành viên của các tổ chức nhân đạo phi chính phủ.

Tháng 11, 2012 chúng tôi quyết định sẽ viết và chụp lại cuộc sống nước Mỹ dưới con mắt của ba cô gái Việt Nam sống xa nhà, và đặt tên quyển sách là “Get Lost. Be Found.” Để thực hiện mục tiêu đó, chúng tôi đặt ra tên nhóm 3594 Miles, tượng trưng cho quãng đường lái xe từ bờ Tây đến bờ Đông nước Mỹ, tượng trưng cho tuổi 21 mà chúng tôi đã trải qua vào năm 2012 – khi chúng tôi quyết định sẽ ghi chép lại quãng thời gian thanh xuân ở Mỹ của mình. Tương tự như những du học sinh khác, chúng tôi đã cùng trải qua những buồn vui, những lần được chào đón và những khi bị đặt ra bên lề; những lúc ngao du trên những cung đường bất tận và những khi cả tuần chỉ sống bằng mì gói, những cú shock văn hóa lạ lẫm lẫn những lúc thấu hiểu chính mình, nhận ra mình muốn trở thành ai và muốn làm gì.

Tất cả những trải nghiệm, những cảm xúc đó; chúng tôi sẽ kể lại trong "Get Lost. Be Found."

Waco, TX

Austin, TX

Tại sao là “Get Lost. Be Found.”?

“Get Lost. Be Found.” là tập hợp những bài viết và ảnh về những sự kiện đã xảy ra trong cuộc sống du học sinh của chúng tôi, đặc biệt là những chuyến đi vòng quanh nước Mỹ. Quyển sách sẽ được trình bày bằng tiếng Anh và tiếng Việt, xuất bản dưới dạng ebook download miễn phí như món quà tri ân dành cho những điều tốt đẹp, những người đã ở bên cạnh chúng tôi, dành cho hai đất nước đã giúp chúng tôi tìm ra ước mơ và đam mê của bản thân mình. Bên cạnh đó, chúng tôi đồng thời sẽ xuất bản “Get Lost. Be Found.” dưới dạng sách in như quà tặng đặc biệt dành cho những người ủng hộ.

Khi chúng tôi nhận ra rằng thời gian ở Mỹ của chúng tôi có hạn, 3594 Miles đã lên kế hoạch đặt chân đến thật nhiều nơi, từ những thành phố lớn đến những thị trấn nhỏ xưa cũ, từ những công viên quốc gia đến những vùng đất vỏn vẹn 50 người dân. Những chuyến hành trình đã mang lại cho chúng tôi nhiều bài học: làm sao để thay bánh xe giữa đường cao tốc không một bóng người, ngủ qua đêm trong xe giữa rest area hoang vắng vốn dành cho giới lái xe tải đường dài, ăn mì gói trong cửa hàng tiện lợi hiếm hoi nằm trên cung đường sa mạc đến Grand Canyon. Chúng tôi đã gặp những con người thú vị; những người chỉ có thể gặp một lần khi họ dừng chân hỏi chúng tôi cần giúp gì, những bạn bè ở khắp mọi nơi sẵn lòng giúp một chỗ ở qua đêm, những sinh viên ở các trường hàng đầu nước Mỹ và những người làm việc 24/7 trong môi trường nặng nhọc. Họ giúp chúng tôi nhận ra nước Mỹ rộng lớn nhưng nếu cần sẽ tìm được đúng người vào đúng lúc.

Cuộc sống du học không phải màu hồng, điều này tất cả du học sinh đều biết. Và để đi du lịch, chúng tôi đã nhận làm rất nhiều công việc khác nhau, có những lúc thức trắng đêm để sửa ảnh chụp cho khách hàng hay viết bài cho kịp hạn chót; có những ngày trước kì kiểm tra nhưng chúng tôi vẫn phải đến chỗ làm. Cuộc sống sẽ không là màu hồng cho bất kỳ ai ở bất kỳ nơi đâu; và chúng tôi – cùng với những người bạn xa nhà xung quanh mình – đang biến nó thành bức tranh cầu vồng, ở nơi đó niềm vui đứng cạnh nỗi buồn, thách thức đi cùng cơ hội.

Tháng Mười hai năm nay, chúng tôi sẽ lái xe vòng quanh nước Mỹ, từ Dallas, TX đến bờ Tây (California) để rồi sang bờ Đông (New York). Đây sẽ là chuyến hành trình đánh dấu những trang cuối cùng của “Get Lost. Be Found.” Giáng sinh vốn là dịp quay về nhà đoàn tụ với gia đình. Chúng tôi – Rio, Zi và Iris – sẽ chọn Giáng sinh để lên đường vòng quanh nước Mỹ - ngôi nhà thứ hai của mình – cùng với Việt Nam trong tim.

Grand Canyon, AZ

Texas State Capital

Ủng hộ “Get Lost. Be Found.”

Sự ủng hộ của mọi người sẽ giúp “Get Lost. Be Found.” được ra mắt độc giả khắp nơi, cung cấp thêm một góc nhìn về cuộc sống du học sinh Việt Nam ở Mỹ.

Với mỗi mức ủng hộ, chúng tôi sẽ tri ân bằng những phần quà khác nhau, nhưng bản thân “Get Lost. Be Found.” chính là điều có giá trị nhất mà chúng tôi có thể đem lại cho mọi người – những người chúng tôi đã và sẽ có cơ duyên được kết nối. Đồng thời, chúng tôi mong mọi người sẽ cùng chia sẻ thông tin này đến với bạn bè, người thân của mình.

Lưu ý:

- Cộng thêm $7 phí vận chuyển quốc tế

- Bìa sách thực tế có thể thay đổi so với bìa ở trên.

- Mọi chi tiết xin liên hệ 3594miles@gmail.com


Chúng tôi xin chân thành cảm ơn. Nếu bạn đang ở Mỹ, hy vọng chúng ta sẽ gặp nhau. Nếu là một nơi khác, ngày nào đó sẽ có duyên gặp nhau. Bạn sẽ luôn là người bạn đồng hành đã đi cùng chúng tôi trong hành trình này.

3594 Miles

Rio Lam - Zi Nguyen - Iris Le

Savannah, GA


---oOo---

Who is behind 3594 Miles?

We are three high-school friends from Vietnam: Rio Lam, Zi Nguyen, and Iris Le. We are currently following different paths in the United States: Rio continues with her writing career started in Vietnam, Zi takes Fashion Photography as her life-time goal, and Iris aims to work for non-profit organizations.

Back in November 2012, while chilling out at White Rock lake, it came to our mind that we should write and capture the American life in the eyes of us as three Vietnamese girls living away from home. We decided to name that book “Get Lost. Be Found.” as a symbol for what we have been going through during the time of our youth in the States. As many other abroad students, we have got a handful of happiness and sadness, wild moments on the road and hard time in everyday life, culture shocks, and, the most precious one- finding out who we are. Thanks to this big adventure, we learn who we want to be and what we want to do at a quite early age.

Everything will be told by words and photos in “Get Lost. Be Found.”

Charleston, SC

Caddo Lake, LA

Why “Get Lost. Be Found.”?

“Get Lost. Be Found.” is a collection of journals written in both Vietnamese and English, and photos depicting our life in the States through the scope of remarkable events, valuable experience, everyday life, and interesting people; mostly based on our trips around America. The ebook version of “Get Lost. Be Found.” will be published and uploaded for free as a gift of appreciation towards both good and bad things happening, people who have been here for us; and two countries which help us to find out our dreams and passions. Besides, we also publish the hard-copy version of “Get Lost. Be Found.” as a special gift for those who support us in this project.

At the point we were aware of our possibly limited time in the States, it came to our minds that we should explore as many places as possible, from big cities to forgotten towns, from national parks to remote farms. These trips have taught us numerous important lessons: checking up car, changing flat tires (as girls, it took us quite some time to learn), sleeping safe and sound in a car parked at a rest area with the heat turned off to save gas, eating instant noodles with hot water begged from convenient stores on the way during the whole trip. We have met interesting people: some of them we only probably saw once in a lifetime for they only stopped to ask if we need help, friends from everywhere who hosted us, students from top schools, and workers who work 24/7 in poor conditions. Humans of America help us realize that despite of its vast area, we always can find right people at right times.

Manhattan, NY

Life is not filled of roses for abroad students. Life is never a monochrome canvas for anyone anywhere. Life is a rainbow, an endless and sophisticated spectrum for us to live it up. There were days before important exams we still had to get up and work. There were nights we had to pull an all-nighter to edit photos for clients or finish writings before deadline. 

And yet those hard days have led us to new places some of which we even hadn’t thought of. This December, we will take a road-trip around America, from Dallas, TX to West Coast (California) then East Coast (New York). We chose Christmas since that is time of the year supposed for people to be at home with family, but here we are, in the United States and thousands miles away from our families. That will be the time for us to discover America – our second home – with Vietnam always at hearts. That will be the final journey marking the last pages of “Get Lost. Be Found.” 

Dallas, TX

New Mexico


Back Up “Get Lost. Be Found.”

Your support will help to bring “Get Lost. Be Found.” into fruition, provide another viewpoint on life of Vietnamese abroad students in the States.

For each of donation amount, we offer different awards, but “Get Lost. Be Found.” itself – which will be able to download free – is the most valuable one we can give to those we have a chance in life to connect. 

Note:

- We add 7$ for shipping international.

- The actual cover of "Get Lost. Be Found." maybe subject to change.

- Contact us at 3594miles@gmail.com

Please share the words to your friends and relatives so that together we will make it come true.

We thankfully invite you to be a part of our adventures.. 

3594 Miles

Rio Lam – Zi Nguyen – Iris Le

in the middle of nowhere

giúp gì, những bạn bè ở khắp mọi nơi sẵn lòng giúp một chỗ ở qua đêm, những sinh viên ở các trường hàng đầu nước Mỹ và những người làm việc 24/7 trong môi trường
nặng nhọc. Họ giúp chúng tôi nhận ra nước Mỹ rộng lớn nhưng nếu cần sẽ tìm được
đúng người vào đúng lúc.
Cuộc sống du học không phải màu hồng, điều này tất cả du học sinh đều biết. Và để đi du lịch, chúng
tôi đã nhận làm rất nhiều công việc khác nhau, có những lúc thức trắng đêm để sửa
ảnh chụp cho khách hàng hay viết bài cho kịp hạn chót; có những ngày trước kì
kiểm tra nhưng chúng tôi vẫn phải đến chỗ làm. Cuộc sống sẽ không là màu hồng
cho bất kỳ ai ở bất kỳ nơi đâu; và chúng tôi – cùng với những người bạn xa nhà
xung quanh mình – đang biến nó thành bức tranh cầu vồng, ở nơi đó niềm vui đứng
cạnh nỗi buồn, thách thức đi cùng cơ hội. 
Tháng Mười hai năm nay, chúng tôi
sẽ lái xe vòng quanh nước Mỹ, từ Dallas, TX đến bờ Tây (California) để rồi sang
bờ Đông (New York). Đây sẽ là chuyến hành trình đánh dấu những trang cuối cùng
của “Get Lost. Be Found.” Giáng sinh vốn là dịp quay về nhà đoàn tụ với gia
đình. Chúng tôi – Rio, Zi và Iris – sẽ chọn Giáng sinh để lên đường vòng quanh
nước Mỹ - ngôi nhà thứ hai của mình – cùng với Việt Nam trong tim.


Grand Canyon, AZ

Texas State Capital


Ủng hộ “Get Lost. Be Found.”

Sự ủng hộ của mọi người sẽ giúp “Get Lost. Be Found.” được ra
mắt độc giả khắp nơi, cung cấp thêm một góc nhìn về cuộc sống du học sinh Việt
Nam ở Mỹ. 
Với mỗi mức ủng hộ, chúng tôi sẽ
tri ân bằng những phần quà khác nhau, nhưng bản thân “Get Lost. Be Found.”
chính là điều có giá trị nhất mà chúng tôi có thể đem lại cho mọi người – những
người chúng tôi đã và sẽ có cơ duyên được kết nối. Đồng thời, chúng tôi mong mọi
người sẽ cùng chia sẻ thông tin này đến với bạn bè, người thân của mình. 

Lưu ý:
- Cộng thêm $7 phí vận chuyển quốc tế
- Bìa sách thực tế có thể thay đổi so với bìa ở trên.
- Mọi chi tiết xin liên hệ 3594miles@gmail.com



Chúng tôi xin chân thành cảm ơn. Nếu bạn đang ở Mỹ, hy vọng chúng ta sẽ gặp nhau. Nếu là một nơi
khác, ngày nào đó sẽ có duyên gặp nhau. Bạn sẽ luôn là người bạn đồng hành đã
đi cùng chúng tôi trong hành trình này.
3594 Miles
Rio Lam - Zi Nguyen - Iris Le


Savannah, GA


---oOo---

Who is behind 3594 Miles?
We are three high-school friends
from Vietnam: Rio Lam, Zi Nguyen, and Iris Le. We are currently following different paths in the United States: Rio continues with her writing career started in
Vietnam, Zi takes Fashion Photography as her life-time goal, and Iris aims to
work for non-profit organizations.
Back in November 2012, while chilling out at White Rock lake, it came to our mind that we should write and capture the American life in the eyes of us as three Vietnamese girls living away from home. We decided to name that book “Get Lost. Be Found.” as a
symbol for what we have been going through during the time of our youth in the
States. As many other abroad students, we have got a handful of happiness and sadness, wild moments on the road and hard time in everyday life, culture shocks, and, the most precious one- finding out who we are. Thanks
to this big adventure, we learn who we want to be and what we want
to do at a quite early age. 
Everything will be told by words
and photos in “Get Lost. Be Found.”


Charleston, SC





Caddo Lake, LA

Why “Get Lost. Be Found.”?
“Get Lost. Be Found.” is a collection of journals written in both Vietnamese and English, and photos depicting our life in the States through the
scope of remarkable events, valuable experience, everyday life, and interesting
people; mostly based on our trips around America. The ebook version of
“Get Lost. Be Found.” will be published and uploaded for free as a gift of appreciation towards both good and bad things happening, people who have been here
for us; and two countries which help us to find out our dreams and passions.
Besides, we also publish the hard-copy version of “Get Lost. Be Found.” as a
special gift for those who support us in this project.
At the point we were aware of our possibly limited time in the States, it came to our minds that we should explore as many
places as possible, from big cities to forgotten towns, from national parks to
remote farms. These trips have taught us numerous important lessons: checking
up car, changing flat tires (as girls, it took us quite some time to learn), sleeping
safe and sound in a car parked at a rest area with the heat turned off to
save gas, eating instant noodles with hot water begged from convenient stores
on the way during the whole trip. We have met interesting people: some of them
we only probably saw once in a lifetime for they only stopped to ask if we need
help, friends from everywhere who hosted us, students from top schools, and
workers who work 24/7 in poor conditions. Humans of America help us realize that despite of its vast area, we always can find right people at right times.



Manhattan, NY


Life is not filled of roses for abroad students. Life is never a monochrome canvas for anyone anywhere. Life is a rainbow, an endless and sophisticated spectrum for us to live it up. There were days before important exams we still
had to get up and work. There were nights we had to pull an all-nighter to
edit photos for clients or finish writings before deadline. 
And yet those hard days have led
us to new places some of which we even hadn’t thought of. This December, we
will take a road-trip around America, from Dallas, TX to West Coast
(California) then East Coast (New York). We chose Christmas since that is time of the year supposed for people to be at home with family, but here we are, in the United
States and thousands miles away from our families. That will be the time for us
to discover America – our second home – with Vietnam always at hearts. That will be the final journey marking the last pages of “Get Lost. Be Found.” 


Dallas, TX

New Mexico




Back Up “Get Lost. Be Found.”
Your support will help to bring “Get Lost. Be Found.” into fruition,
provide another viewpoint on life of Vietnamese abroad students in the
States.
For each of donation amount, we offer different awards, but “Get Lost. Be Found.” itself – which will be able to download free – is the most valuable one we can give to those we have a chance in life to connect. 
Note:
- We add 7$ for shipping international.
- The actual cover of "Get Lost. Be Found." maybe subject to change.
- Contact us at 3594miles@gmail.com
Please share the words to your friends and relatives
so that together we will make it come true.
We thankfully invite you to be a part of our adventures.. 
3594 Miles
Rio Lam – Zi Nguyen – Iris Le


in the middle of nowhere

story:
"Help Make Jocelyne's Dream Come True!"

 

Short Summary

Montreal Canadiens-Stanley Cup Champions is a book that focuses on each of the Montreal Canadiens 24 Stanley Cup winning seasons.

The author, Jocelyne LeBlanc, has chronicled the Canadiens illustrious record with help from her father who passed away before she finished writing the book. He was a Montreal Canadiens fan from a young age and she has dedicated this special book to him. Help Jocelyne honour her late dad in getting this book published by choosing one of the perks listed here.

It took Jocelyne approximately a year to complete this book. She spent countless hours doing research, double and triple checking statistics, reading books and watching hockey videos. 

Left Photo: (Jocelyne LeBlanc and her late father Emery LeBlanc); Right Photo: (Super Montreal Canadiens fan Emery LeBlanc with Maurice "The Rocket" Richard)

 

Jocelyn has teamed up with RetroMedia, a small publishing company based in Prince Edward Island. 

"With your contribution to this campaign, I am hoping to be able to have this book published in English and French." - Jocelyn Leblanc.

What We Need & What You Get

We have priced the perks for this campaign to help raise enough money for the proceeding steps needed in publishing Montreal Canadiens-Stanley Cup Champions.

Our perks are ranked similar to the journey a player would make along his way to a Stanley Cup victory. The larger the backing, the more significant the role. Our most valuable perk, and also the most exciting, places you among the select few in the "Cup Champion" list. 

Above, and including, the "Top Six Forward" perk contributers will have their name and name of their city placed in the book. It's a special printing of the book and those who wish to contribute will be among a select group of super fans!

The Impact

Montreal Canadiens-Stanley Cup Champions is a unique, one of a kind printing of the most famous team in hockey history. Publishing this book is extremely valuable to hockey fans of all ages, especially to super Habs fans. This is the first time a book has been written exclusively on the Montreal Canadiens Stanley Cup winning teams. 

“This book is dedicated to both my parents, with a very special dedication to my father Emery, who was a huge Montreal Canadiens fan just like me. His incredible knowledge of the sport helped me tremendously with writing this book. It breaks my heart to say that he passed away just before it was completed. He was very proud of this book and I will be equally as proud to have it published in honor of such a great man” - Jocelyne LeBlanc

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Interview Jocelyne for your blog or website! (email Jocelyn for more info) 
  • Share our campaign with friends and family on Twitter, Facebook, websites, blogs, etc! 
  • Tell sports blogs or other news outlets about Montreal Canadiens Stanley Cup Champions and our campaign!

 

In the News

Read the AllHabs.net Fan Focus feature about Montreal Canadiens-Stanley Cup Champions by clicking here!

story:
English / ITALIANO SOTTO

Help Tassocrazia – La Voce del Tasso host a conference on faith and civil rights by best selling author Timothy Kurek in Rome, Italy.

You will get our gratitude and a lot of great perks if you make this come true!

 

What will you help finance?

With your help we shall get the money we need to pay for Mr Kurek's:

  • Plane Tickets (to and from Rome)
  • Accommodation (3 nights)

So that he can come to Liceo Tasso High School and speak to all who wish to come (free entrance).

 

Who is Timothy Kurek?

«Timothy Kurek, a Portland, Oregon based author and speaker is tackling some of the front burner issues of our day. His unrestrained style of immersion lends a uniquely empathetic perspective, engaging his audiences with empathy, humor, and refreshing candor.

Timothy Kurek, raised within the confines of a strict, conservative Christian denomination in the Bible Belt, Nashville, Tennessee, was taught the gospel of separation from a young age. But it wasn’t long before Timothy’s path and the outside world converged when a friend came out as a lesbian, and revealed she had been excommunicated by her family.

Distraught and overcome with questions and doubts about his religious upbringing, Timothy decided the only way to empathize and understand her pain was to walk in the shoes of very people he had been taught to shun. He decided to come out as a gay man to everyone in his life, and to see for himself how the label of gay would impact his life.

In the tradition of Black Like Me, The Cross in the Closet is a story about people, a story about faith, and about one man’s “abominable” quest to find Jesus in the margins.

Tim is an internationally sought-after speaker and has been featured on ABC's The View, Fox News Alan Colmes, CNN, MSNBC, CTV, HLN, Sirius/XM and dozens of other national and international outlets.»

( From http://www.timothykurek.com/about )

 

Why Rome?

This campaign is organized by Tassocrazia – La Voce del Tasso (Tassocrazia, the Voice of Tasso), the school newspaper of Liceo Tasso high school in Rome.

As young people, we are most interested in the theme of civil rights, more so since Italy, a mostly Catholic country, is one of the least LGBT-friendly countries in Central Europe, not recognizing same-sex couples and with no specific law against hate crimes towards members of the LGBT community.

We have thus decided that the best way to understand how faith and civil rights are (or can be) interconnected was to invite Mr Kurek as a witness of what discrimination can feel like, and how faith itself does not always equal to discrimination.

 

Who's behind Tassocrazia?

Tassocrazia is a mixed-medium (paper/online) newspaper written by Liceo Tasso high school students for their fellow students.
We provide information on things happening inside the school, and in the world we live in.

Tassocrazia was founded in 2011 by a group of students, and has been wildly recognized both by the school itself, and by the people we have interviewed and who have been our guests as a stable well-balanced project.

Simone Ramacci (Section Editor in Chief) and Laura Cardinale (Managing Director) are behind this campaign.

Website

  • http://www.tassocrazia.it (in Italian)

Info/Press

  • simone.ramacci [at] tassocrazia.it
  • laura [at] tassocrazia.it





Aiuta Tassocrazia – La Voce del Tasso a ospitare una conferenza su diritti civili e fede dell'autore di fama internazionale Timothy Kurek a Roma, Italia.

Avrai la nostra eterna gratitudine e tanti magnifici regali!

 

Cosa aiuterai a finanziare?

Col tuo aiuto pagheremo a Timothy Kurek:

  • Biglietti d'aereo (andata e ritorno per/da Roma)
  • Alloggio (3 notti)

In modo che possa venire al Liceo Tasso e parlare a chiunque desideri venire (ingresso libero).

 

Chi è Timothy Kurek?

«Timothy Kurek è un autore di Portland (Oregon, USA) che sta affrontando uno degli argomenti più scottanti di questi anni. Il suo stile narrativo comporta un'esperienza di totale immersione, stimolando i lettori con empatia, humor, e piacevole candore.

A Timothy Kurek, cresciuto in una congregazione di Cristiani tradizionalisti nella Cintura della Bibbia (Nashville, Tenessee, Stati Uniti del Sud), è stato insegnato fin dalla più tenera età l'Evangelo della separazione, non dell'unità. Ma non c'è voluto molto prima che il destino di Timothy lo facesse scontrare col mondo reale, stringendo amicizia con una giovane lesbica che gli rivelò di essere stata cacciata dalla propria famiglia.

Devastato e assalito da dubbi sulla sua educazione religiosa, Timothy ha deciso che l'unico modo per capire il dolore dell'amica era calzare i panni di quelle stesse persone che gli avevano insegnato a odiare: gli omosessuali. Ha deciso di fare coming out con tutti i suoi conoscenti, e vedere come l'etichetta di "gay" avrebbe cambiato la sua vita.

Il libro The Cross in the Closet (non ancora edito in Italia) è una storia di persone, fede, e della scelta “abominevole” di un uomo che ha cercato Gesù fra gli emarginati.

Tim è un nome di fama internazionale ed è stato ospitato da vari canali TV: ABC, Fox News, CNN, MSNBC, CTV, HLN, Sirius/XM e dozine di altri canali americani e stranieri.»

( Tradotto da http://www.timothykurek.com/about )

 

Perché a Roma?

Questa campagna è organizzata da Tassocrazia – La Voce del Tasso, giornale scolastico del Liceo Tasso di Roma.

Noi studenti siamo interessati all'argomento diritti civili, ancor di più dal momento che l'Italia, paese a maggioranza Cattolica, è agli ultimi posti fra i paesi europei in materia di diritti degli omosessuali, non riconoscendo le coppie dello stesso sesso e non avendo una legge specifica contro l'omofobia/transfobia.

Abbiamo per questo deciso di chiedere a Timothy Kurek di illustrarci il rapporto fra fede e diritti civili, perché credere non significa per forza discriminare.

 

Chi c'è dietro Tassocrazia?

Tassocrazia è un giornale (cartaceo e on-line) scritto dagli studenti per gli studenti.
Informiamo su fatti interni alla scuola, ma anche del resto del mondo.

Tassocrazia è stato fondato nel 2011 da un gruppo di studenti, ed è stato riconosciuto come un progetto affidabile e ben equilibrato sia dalla scuola, che da tutti i personaggi di pubblico interesse che abbiamo intervistato.

Questa campagna è stata realizzata da Simone Ramacci (Capo Redattore di Sezione) e Laura Cardinale (Fondatrice e Direttrice Responsabile).

Sito internet

  • http://www.tassocrazia.it

Info/Stampa

  • simone.ramacci [at] tassocrazia.it
  • laura [at] tassocrazia.it

Support Puppetry Arts Non Profit's New Book & Book Donation 

                                               Thats What Tuffy Tigers Do!

As part of the mission of the Brooklyn-based non-profit Puppetry Arts, Executive Director T. E. Young uses the art of puppetry to educate, entertain, and inspire. To help secure and strengthen the impact and outreach of this mission, Mr. Young created the adorable and unforgettable Tuffy Tiger.

T. E. Young’s orange little tyke Tuffy is featured in a new series of Life Books for Kids That’s What Tuffy Tigers Do. In the first set of three books, Tuffy practices how to count, learns how to bathe, and discovers how important it is to be a friend. Tuffy takes each necessary step to ensure that he learns, takes care of himself and others, and grows. As part of the charming children’s book series, the first three chapters include the titles Numbers 1 to 20, Taking A Bath, and Making Friends. 

The $5000 goal is to off-set costs of self-publishing the first three books and purchasing books for the over 30 kindergarten classrooms of the low-income schools and shelters that the organization works with all year long. Thats roughly 750 students that will be directly affected by your support.

If we raise more then our goal, we will extend book donations to MORE schools in the NYC area and beyond! 

The book itself, will also be available for purchase on line and all proceeds will go directly to community outreach programs provided by Puppetry Arts which impacts over 27,000 youth, families, and individuals every year. 

                                    A Snippet From Taking A Bath

Washy washy Tuffy said

Scrubby scrubby Tuffy’s head

Don’t forget behind his ear

Clean his belly and his rear 

Arms and legs his hands and knees

Rinse the cloth out with a squeeze 

Drain the water when you’re through

That’s what Tuffy Tigers do

                    Be sure to listen to Tuffy's Washy Wash Song in the Gallery!

                                      MAKING THIS BOOK EXTRA SPECIAL...

This set of books are introduced by the most well-known dad on any street; Roscoe Orman aka "Gordon" from Sesame Street

Mr. Orman writes of Tuffy Tiger:
Education and methods for teaching our youth have always captured my interest. When the role of “Gordon” on Sesame Street was offered to me, I remember thinking what a wonderful opportunity I would have to be able to teach children world-wide as a TV personality. Throughout my experience as a teacher, author, and a role model among Muppets, I’ve found that parents and teachers have the most important role in shaping positive adult behavior over time through teaching and inspiring children when their curiosity is peaked and their imagination is stirred. These values are at the heart of the stories of Tuffy Tiger that T.E. Young brings to life. Having worked with T.E. Young and the charitable community arts non-profit Puppetry Arts, I’ve had the chance to be part of the impact that the organization provides to thousands of youth and families each year infusing puppetry in programs that engage youth and empower families. Under the direction of T.E. Young, Puppetry Arts is truly the little organization that does big things.

                                           PERKS! PERKS! PERKS! PERKS!

Perks include Autographed Books, Meet N' Greets with Tuffy & Puppet Making Workshops for your child's classroom.

There is a $50 Perk, $150 Perk, $250 Perk, $500 Perk, $1500 Perk, and a whopping $2500 Perk

The BIGGEST PERK OF ALL is a visit from Tuffy Tiger with his pal Roscoe Orman from Sesame Street!!!!!                               

                                                      IN CONCLUSION.....

Curious, outgoing, clever, and thoughtful, Tuffy Tiger is an appealing character that becomes an important confidant and friend to the many, many kids that he meets everyday helping them to explore the world around them. That’s What Tuffy Tigers Do series of books provide that same opportunity for you and your child.

The Tuffy Tiger series of life-books are the perfect tools to help parents and teachers emphasize educational goals, healthy choices, and social principles. Tuffy’s experiences reinforce positive life lessons and habits for children through his honorable, endearing, and gentle nature.

After all….That’s what Tuffy Tigers do.

story:
Dear fellow Interneter,

I didn't want to have to do this, thought i could make it on my own but i must recognize I need your help.

I left Montreal a month ago, alone on a motorcycle after receiving my license, and wanted to go to Guatemala then back.

Unfortunately, due to underpreparation, too many bribes and some very very rainy weather in Mexico, it looks like I won't be able to go to Guatemala, then back. Unless you can help me...

I'm writing a book about this journey, where the kindness and help of strangers is a central theme. For only a few bucks you could allow me to keep traveling and secure your copy of the said book. Plus it is very fitting don't you find?

I hope this cry for help finds you well, and if you can't help directly, please share with your friends. Maybe they can!

You can also follow my adventures on Instagram: @vintagecrap

Cheers fellow adventurers, please keep this dream alive :)

Franck

story:
THIS CAMPAIGN IS NOW OVER.  THANK YOU FOR ALL OF THE SUPPORT.

BUT WE ARE NOT FINISHED. 

IF YOU ARE STILL INTERESTED IN SUPPORTING AND DONATING TO OUR CAUSE PLEASE VISIT THE IDAANP WEBSITE   www.idaanp.org

THANK YOU!


In 2005, Idaho passed a law that licensed Naturopathic Physicians (NDs); however, due to the ambiguity of the law, it has never been implemented. The Idaho Chapter of the American Association of Naturopathic Physicians (IDAANP) is returning to the Idaho Legislature in an effort to campaign for clarification of the law in order to match ND licensing requirements currently accepted in other states. This will allow NDs to practice within their full scope of medical training and education. Licensure for NDs helps to lead the way for future insurance coverage for patients. Of primary importance, though, is licensing assures quality and accountability for this profession, improves access to healthcare and will help to keep Idaho and our local communities healthy!

This campaign aims to raise funds to successfully lobby our State Legislature for implementation of our proposed changes to the law while raising awareness about the field of Naturopathic Medicine. Here is how you can best support the IDAANP in our efforts:

• Become a Member: The IDAANP now offers a "supporting membership". Your $25 contribution will help us reach our goal of building stronger, healthier communities. Members will receive news and updates about licensing efforts and current issues impacting the Naturopathic Medicine community. Plus, annual membership gets you our sticker to display in support of NDs.

• Come dine with us: Attend our exquisite "Food is Medicine" fundraising dinner Thursday, February 20th, 2014 in Boise, ID. This event takes place from 5-9pm at the Visual Arts Collective. You will get the opportunity to meet and share healthy food with NDs and other practitioners in our community that share our vision of health, while enjoying a beautiful, local, organic meal--sponsored by the Boise Co-op.

• Look for our new publication: Get a copy of the IDAANP’s "Food is Medicine" magazine that includes recipes, health tips and current information on ways to become more involved and active in your community through IDAANP’s movement. 

You can learn more about the IDAANP and how to get involved at www.idaanp.org or on Facebook: www.facebook.com/IDAANP.

Thank you for joining us on our mission to license Naturopathic Physicians in the State of Idaho. Please share this link with anyone who believes Naturopathic Medicine should be licensed--assuring quality and accountability--in EVERY state!

story:
Greetings, fans and supporters of the ASHBATH.COM FRAUDCast!

I, Lester Greystone, will be launching a book tour in order to promote my book, Ugly as HELL.

I will be driving to visit Captain Awesome in Kansas to promote the book.  A MEGASODE will be recorded and aired from there.  I will take 15 copies of my book, Ugly as HELL, and stash them in random locations along the way, and/or give them to random individuals. 

Using my patented reverse-profit business model (I'm gonna see if I can get companies like Starbucks to license it), I will be traveling and dispensing books at my expense, in perhaps the world's first "Uninvited Book Tour."

You see, normally, somebody courts YOU to go on a book tour...this is a system that makes economic sense, but not much "dream-realization" sense.

This is because (and scientists have proven this) the Universe works backwards; the best way to get a girl is to have a girlfriend already, the best way to get things for free is to be rich, and the best way to get a book tour is to already be successful and popular.

If you've listened to the FRAUDCast you already know; we don't wait to be "invited to success."  Life is about creating moments, not hoping for them. The truth (in my life, anyway) is that simply having dreams is not good enough to break free--other people have to want you to win, and that can only come from quality work, good vibes and a willingness to reach out.

Along the way I will be doing FRAUDCast episodes, blogging, taking photos, and anything else I can stuff in.

I plan on embarking (or is it disembarking?) When I get the money.  Once I get enough funds to go, I'll go.  No fixed dates yet; I need this campaign to raise the cash, and also to prove that listener interest is high enough before I take the trip.  Make sense?     

I NEED HELP. 

Captain Awesome and I have pulled together to get the word out and ask for donations.  Even as little as 1 dollar is about 7 miles worth of gas (that's MATH, homie) and that's nothing to sneeze at!

I have calculated the costs, and for the books, gas, rooms, and incidentals, a round trip out to Kansas and back should cost about $1500.  So I am going to try to raise $5000 to enable additional traveling--I want to literally make it ACROSS America, book a LOT of other stops, and create MUCH more content during the tour, but because of costs I cannot yet plan anything beyond Captain Awesome in Kansas. 

In the end, I will put whatever I DO raise to use for the show. 

To alleviate fears that I may run off and try to construct a Monorail with the money, my cost breakdown is below. 

• BOOKS: For the 15 copies I will be surreptitiously planting throughout my travel, the cost is approximately $150.

• GAS: 3700 Miles (The route as I have planned it so far), divided by 30 m.p.g. (my gas mileage), times about $4 (approximate per-gallon price of gas) = Approximately $493.

• LODGING WHILE ON THE ROAD: Some sort of a room (about $75 per night, I seek rooms slightly above fugitive quality) Times 4 (two nights each way) = Approximately $300.

• FOOD AND INCIDENTALS: (Things I have failed to imagine so far, likely prostitutes, moderate chance of Peyote): $500.

• TOTAL: About $1500.

Again, I am asking for a total of $5000; $1500 is only for the minimal trip I have planned so far; to hit the East Coast will easily cost me another (larger) shitload of wampum.

***READ THIS NEXT PART CAREFULLY BECAUSE AS A CONTRIBUTOR, YOU SAY YOU UNDERSTAND MY CAMPAIGN FULLY, AND THAT IT HAS BEEN DESCRIBED TO YOUR SATISFACTION.  YOU CAN ASK ME QUESTIONS VIA E-MAIL AT WHATWOULDCLETUSDO@ASHBATH.COM, BUT I CAN TELL YOU WITH 99% CERTAINTY THAT THIS IS THE WAY IT'S GONNA BE.***

IF YOU REALLY WANNA BREAK MY BALLS ABOUT MONEY:

There are NO REFUNDS for any contributions made to this tour.  Don't give if you plan on hunting me down because I didn't make it to destination X.  So how much money is really "enough?"  And what if I don't get "enough?"

  • IF I RAISE THE $1500:

If I raise $1500 I WILL COMPLETE the tour to Captain Awesome's pad and back, and I WILL HAND YOU YOUR FACE in raw podcasting entertainment, with all the trimmings mentioned previously. 

  • IF I RAISE MORE THAN $1500:

It depends on how much more money we are talking about.  I will play by ear how much more I can do, for the money I have--you're just gonna have to trust me.  It's a road trip, so if you want it planned down to the millimeter, you're looking at the wrong guy and the wrong campaign.

  • IF I RAISE LESS THAN $1500:

This means I really can't afford to go, but I will do what I can.  At the very least we will give you a MEGASODE for free (Originally we wanted to charge for those).  I still want to do a road trip, and I will make do with what I have.  NO PROMISES ON DESTINATIONS OR CONTENT PROVIDED UNDER THIS SCENARIO, because it likely means I had to scrap the whole thing and take on a goddamned roofing job.

Many thanks to all our listeners and fans!  Let's ROLL.

story:
Winter Tangerine Review is a literary journal dedicated to exposing the best poetry, prose and art from young writers to established writers, all over the world. 

It was only after receiving rejection letter after rejection letter that I realized how difficult it was for a young writer to break into the writing industry. Established journals were definitely more willing to publish well-known writers who have a name to back them, rather than unknown writers who would be a risk. I decided to create Winter Tangerine Review because I feel that every writer, from the 17 year old poet in Alaska to Joyce Carol Oates, deserves a chance to be published.

Now, with a prospective staff of over 40, Winter Tangerine is a thriving source of literary and artistic talent. We have the most qualified, diverse staff from all over the world, from England to Australia to Singapore to Spain. We plan to publish our first issue in May- but we need some help doing that.

What We Need 

These are the things we need funded:

  • The Winter Tangerine Awards: An annual poetry and prose contest, with guest judges and cash prizes.
  • Compensation: We want to be able to pay our contributors.
  • General things: Our Submittable's account, our website fees and postal services so we can mail out issues.

What You'll Get

  • My undying gratitude: I will really, really, really appreciate even a nickel from you, as will all my staff and all the people contributing to this journal. Everything my amazing staff is doing is with the knowledge that there is no salary- they aren't getting paid for it. All the reviews and critiques are made solely on volunteer work, with the hope that maybe they'll be able to hold the tangible fruit of their labor, the journal for which they worked for. I would really appreciate it if you'd help us make this dream a reality.

  • Member of our email list: Whenever anything interesting happens in regards to Winter Tangerine Review, you'll be notified by a cute little email. 

  • The knowledge that you are contributing to the arts: The arts have always been underfunded, and it's always been the people who have helped support it. It doesn't matter who you are- a Wall St. business man, or a single mom in Toronto- the arts influences your life. Literature is everywhere; art is everywhere, but the writer and the artist is constantly neglected. By contributing, you're helping us change that.

  • Any of the perks you choose to receive: You can get a Skype breakfast with the Editor-in-Chief, a signed copy of our first issue* or a lifetime subscription to the journal, among other things!

Other Ways You Can Help

Share this campaign through Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, your neighborhood book club, everything!

If you're a writer or artist, submit to us! Contributors keep our publication alive, and we're always interested in seeing new work!

-

(All artwork used in this Indiegogo campaign was done by Kelly Luc)

* Note: Perks do not include shipping costs. That will be discussed with each individual contributor once the fundraiser has ended.

story:
THE ARCH CONSERVATIVE at The University of Georgia

THE ARCH CONSERVATIVE is a student-run journal of opinion and website serving the University of Georgia. Founded in the Fall of 2013, it articulates the tenets and nuances of a thought tradition that is too often neglected on campus. To this end, its pages are devoted to well-written, well-researched views on current events, philosophy, history, theology and culture.

(Read our Fall 2013 magazine edition here!)

The editorial voice of the publication is conservative in the fusionist sense, although content is welcome from many corners of the right and left. Our fundamental beliefs are laid down in THE ARCH CONSERVATIVE’s inaugural editorial, accessible here. They are as follows:

  • That there exists an enduring moral order. That a healthy respect for traditional beliefs is prudent, as they represent the accumulated wisdom of history.
  • That free markets enable human flourishing, contribute to the general welfare and safeguard liberty.
  • That individual rights are imperative and, unacceptably, not available to millions around the world. That free nations are obligated to oppose, by force of arms when justified, the designs of tyrants.
  • That ultimately the great experiences of life are outside the realm of politics, and cannot be manufactured by government.
Your funding will allow us to distribute a professional-quality print version of our magazine to thousands of UGA students. As a contributor to THE ARCH CONSERVATIVE, you will be a key partner in equipping the next generation of conservative thinkers and leaders at the University of Georgia.

What We Need & What You Get

WWN: Through your generous contributions, we aim to print at least 1,000 copies each of four yearly issues of THE ARCH CONSERVATIVE to distribute to subscribers and UGA's student population of 30,000.

WYG: For each donation above $35, we will send you a year's worth of THE ARCH CONSERVATIVE, an 18-page, glossy magazine filled with jaunty and insightful commentary. We'll also keep you informed of the latest happenings on campus. You will have the additional satisfaction of helping young conservatives revive intellectual conservatism on a major college campus.

Other Ways You Can Help

We greatly appreciate your interest in THE ARCH CONSERVATIVE. You can also help by spreading the word about us and our campaign on Facebook ("The Arch Conservative") and Twitter (@archconuga). Also, help us promote this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools.

If you'd like to mail a check in lieu of an online donation, our mailing address is as follows: 

The Arch Conservative
P.O. Box 1181
Athens, GA 30603

Finally, we can be contacted directly at our email address, archconuga@gmail.com. We are happy to answer any questions you have about our venture.

Raising the Standard,

The Editors

M. Blake Seitz, Editor-in-Chief

Elizabeth Ridgeway, Publisher

John Henry Thompson, Manager

story:
I've been blessed to write as an independent journalist for 16 years now and broadcast on a public radio station for more than 10 years.  Being an independent journalist is great work and very rewarding but when news breaks, it breaks and it waits for no one.

It doesn't care if you'll have the money to buy this awesomely low ticket on Friday.  Or if the last rental car available at your destination spot is $50 over your budget.  LOL!  News waits for no one.

I get many calls asking and inviting me to come to various cities to cover many hard hitting issues and incidents but travel arrangements on a breaking news cycle for this indepedent journalist is often brutal. 

This campaign is important to me because your news is important to you and I've had to turn away many stories just because I couldn't get there.  Writing and interviewing for radio from my central area is sufficient oft times but in some cases, you've just got to get those pumps on the ground to give the readers and listeners the full breadth of the story and what people are dealing with; their advocacy and the voices of their advocates often ignored in mainstream media.

Any donation large or small will help me to get to those people and their stories and any contribution would be greatly appreciated.

Several key areas right now are Sanford Florida with people's continuing organizing around the Zimmerman verdict; New York, for the same; the San Francisco Bay Area/Oakland, where inmates are waging a grueling hunger strike and advocates are supporting them outside the walls and, families like Oscar Grant's are continuing to mobilize with other victims' families against police murders and police brutality; and Arkansas, where action is drumming up around Chavis Carter. Remember him:  he allegedly committed suicide while handcuffed in police custody.  AND in Columbia, where Afro Columbians are holding their 1st National Congress around the government's recognition and implementation of their rights as a sovereign people.

Some people can't contribute but there are ways you can help.  Please, ask people you know to help get the word about my Pumps on the Ground travel campaign. 

And thank you if you've ever read an article of mine or shared it with anyone, or listened to a radio broadcast and/or shared that too.

Above all, whether you contribute to Pumps on the Ground or not, please, continue to support Black newspapers, radio stations, and independent media where many of us are struggling to tell the truth, the whole truth and nothing but the truth.

 

Peace, Sis Charlene

story:
Thank you for taking this time to spend with us!

The grand ideas behind this book are directly resulted from the creative union of Alex Godbold and Rachel Toney. 

 

        Stylistically inspired by the epic illuminations and grimoires of the 11th and 12th centuries, Solaris Compendium will be a comprehensive work of adventure-based, participatory journalism, collaborative art, astronomy, esoteric geometry, history, hidden history, anthropology, folktale, shamanic-based geomancy and documentary photography. Solaris Compendium will be compiled throughout Mexico and beyond in the days leading up to and following December 21st, 2012.

 

Raw illustration of outside cover and inside spread (measuring 9"x12")

 

Solaris Compendium will feature:

  •  600+ pages of metaphysical wonder both ancient and modern 
  •  High quality + heavyweight parchment paper
  •  Finely detailed metal hinges, custom made by hand
  •  Old World style codex binding
  •  Antiqued brown leather cover, colored with naturally found dyes

 

          

Inspirational photo of inside book (source unknown)

 

        The ultimate goal of this project is to document a time in place and space that has been anticipated by many cultures throughout history. It seems  this "New Age" is actually a resurgence of old, ancient wisdom and energy that is being brought back to light through the open minds of creative people. Whatever happens, big or small, celestial or cultural, physical or metaphysical, known or unknown, we will be there to document, preserve, and expound upon the experience in creative ways. Like any book, we hope thatSolaris Compendium can serve as a kind of multi-faceted reference for future humans. Hopefully we can inspire the future...the way our past inspires us today.  

(profeciamaya2012.wordpress.com)

       

        Of the four initial master copies of Solaris Compendium we hope to create, three of which will be donated to the Jose Vasconcelos Library in Mexico City, Mexico, the Swiss National Library in Berne, Switzerland and the Library of Congress in Washington, D.C. The fourth copy will be made available for future projects that have yet to be determined. A digital copy of Solaris Compendium will also be made available for free online. 

        If this project were to be overfunded (dreamin' big), any remaining amount would be used to create as many master copies as possible, to be donated to as many major libraries and collections as possible. We're hoping for a world-wide communication and preservation of time, knowledge and history. 

        Anyone wishing to contribute their own work to Solaris Compendium is fully encouraged to do so! Though we already have a healthy handful of talented artists, writers and other creative individuals lined up to collaborate on this enchanted project, we will gratefully include any appropriate submissions from around the globe. Artistic contributors and pledgers alike will be featured in a special section of the book. :)

 

How You're Helping:

The majority of our budget goes to printing the four original books. Additional funding amounts will go to printing smaller, paperback versions of the book for our pledgers. Also factored into budget are creative supply costs, shipping, rewards, time to produce this project, and fees charged by Indiegogo and Paypal. 

Solaris Compendium will also feature a patron section, where project backers will have the opportunity to see their name beautifully displayed, as well as the opportunity to contribute original artwork, insights, recipes, photos, whatever and ever.  We see this section of the book as an expression of our gratitude for the people who made this all possible, as well as a chance for our backers to express something about themselves.

 

Selected Works from Alex and Rachel:


"Curiosity Cabinet" 2011 © Alex Godbold

 

 "Wailing Wall Wilson Hall" 2011 © Alex Godbold

 

 

"Point Perspective Pennsylvania" (acrylic) 2003 © Rachel Toney

 

"Saving Home" (acrylic) unfinished / lost. 2006 © Rachel Toney

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

        We filmed this video a few months ago. It's a true way for you to get a feel for us. We're just a bunch of sillies with lots of neat ideas and love to share.

 

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

Rachel and I have tickets booked and bags (almost) packed. No matter the outcome of this campaign on Indiegogo, we are traveling to Mexico in just a matter of days. We will document everything...sights, tastes, feelings, thoughts...as much as our heads, notebooks, and cameras can handle. "One way or another...this darkness has got to give"...and we're here to shine beautiful lights on the parts of history and human creativity that are often overlooked in the Western world.

Aside from all the typical risks and challenges involved with backpacking through Mexico and camping in the jungle for weeks on end, our major challenges with this project are financial in nature.  If we manage to avoid falling from cliffs, malaria and scorpion attacks in the course of this research/compilation, then we still have to worry about funding.  ;)

Both Rachel and I are confident that we can give this much anticipated, cultural and solar happening, the multi-layered, in-depth look it deserves.  We are so grateful for any help you are able to offer. Thanks for reading this.

 

-Alex

story:
Our Story

The Poet Laureate of Kansas program lifts up the poetic power of language to enhance our lives and help us discover greater meaning, courage and clarity. Started in 2005 with Dr. Jonathan Holden as the first Kansas Poet Laureate, followed by Dr. Denise Low in 2007, the program now features Caryn Mirriam-Goldberg as the Poet Laureate. In the past two years of her three-year term, she organized a Midwestern and then a National Convergence of State Poets Laureate; co-edited an anthology, An Endless Skyway: Poetry from the Poets Laureate; presented many workshops, reading and trainings; shared podcasts and radio broadcasts on writing, and traveled the state widely to promote and encourage the literary arts.

Earlier this year, the Kansas Arts Commission's funding and staff were eliminated. With no public funding forthcoming from the NEA or Kansas Arts Commission, we turn to you -- the public -- to ask you to show how much you support the literary arts, to keep the poet laureate on the road and doing programming throughout the state, and to lay the groundwork for this program to continue under the auspices of another organization in the future.

The Impact

In the past, tax dollars from Kansans supported this very efficient, well-run and extremely inexpensive program. Now we turn to you to help keep the current poet laureate in specific and the program at large alive and well as it transitions to more stable ground. The Poet Laureate program needs your support to continue this work:

  • Begin Again: 150 Kansas Poems: In commemoration of the Sesquicentennial, the poet laureate edited an anthology. Published by Woodley Press, the anthology features the work of Kansas poets. During fall 2011, a 20-city book tour is planned with readings in Garden City, Ulysses, Manhattan, Salina, Topeka, Wichita, Lawrence, Kansas City, Pittsburg, Emporia,, Leavenworth, and other towns.

  • Poetry Across Kansas: Reading and Writing Our Way Home: Public readings, writing workshops, and trainings for ongoing writing circles.

  • Readings & Workshops: Public readings and workshops throughout Kansas in nonprofit venues including schools, colleges and universities, libraries, arts centers, and community centers.

  • Original Poems for Special Events: Events including the Kansas 150th Anniversary of Statehood, the inaugration of the KU chancellor, the 10th anniversary of 9/11, Governor's Arts Awards and more.

  • State Poets Laureate Conferences: Participation in a national event in New Hamsphire this October with statewide readings and a conference engaging 20 state poets laureate, legislators, politicians, journalists, and the public. Caryn organized a similar event in Kansas (March, 2011) with 20 state poets laureate, two days of programs, and attendees from 16 states.

  • Poetry Month Activities: Programs encouraging reading and writing poetry will be offered in conjunction with National Poetry Month (April). Past activities: the Poetry Pen-Pal Project, Kansas Daily Poem in Your Pocket, and weekly contests announced on the Poet Laureate website.

  • Daily Blog, Facebook Page & Twitter. The poet laureate will maintain a blog about literature and the writing life with automatic posts to the Poet Laureate pages on Facebook and Twitter.


To learn more about the poet laureate activities, see this summary of Caryn Mirriam-Goldberg's work over the last year, information about Jonathan Holden, and information about Denise Low.

What We Need & What You Get

The poet laureate program, in recent years, had a $5,000 annual budget in total, $2,500 as a stipend for the poet laureate, and $2,500 for expenses (travel, copying and printing, mailing, and covering program costs for communities unable to cover these costs directly). Our fundraising plan includes this campaign, followed by special appeals at readings and events, and other fundraising. Our premiums for contributions of $40 and above include books, CDs, poems written just for you and even a song written and recorded for you.


The Kansas Area Watershed (KAW) Council is a not-for-profit educational organization. All contributions are tax-deductible (less the actual value of any premium products). KAW Council is an all-volunteer organization focused on exploring and celebrating the prairie ecosystem, making community with each other, and growing local culture. KAW Council is serving as a transitional fiscal sponsor to the Poet Laureate program. If you would rather mail a check directly to KAW, please send it to KAW Council, P.O. Box 1512, Lawrence, KS 66044.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please post this on your facebook book, share this with friends via email, your blog or in person, or spread the information other ways. Thank you!

story:
Pot Tourism Pitch 

Pot tourists will spend at least $100 million in Colorado’s first year of legalization. Tourists who purchase pot as readily as Napa tourists purchase wine will also spend money on lodging, restaurants, bars, museums, theaters and other attractions.

This project is the first in a series of guides for travelers interested in pot, food, art, culture and leisure.

In addition to making numerous recreational pot pilgrimages to Amsterdam and Vancouver, I have reported on pot tourism in Northern California’s Emerald Triangle. I have produced travel-oriented food and craft beer features throughout the West. 

What I need

I enjoyed expense accounts for previous projects. I need your help funding my reporting in Denver. 

  • Air fare
  • Lodging
  • Bus/Light Rail fares 
  • Meal expenses

What you help fund 

The image above is a screen shot of an interactive map that plots the story of a pot tourist's weekend in Denver. 
With your funding, I will be able to fill in the map information and report on: 
  • 30 stores where anyone over age 21 can buy pot; 
  • smoke-friendly hotels, inns and private AirBNB rentals where you can legally smoke pot; 
  • restaurants and craft-beer bars where you can partake of Denver's other great flavors; 
  • and attractions from art museums to a breath-taking free-fall simulator, all mapped out, professionally edited and easy to use.
In addition I will write and edit a feature-length article and sidebars based on my reporting. I have already pre-sold a story to one publication. 

Who I am

I am a veteran journalist and media producer who has reported on lifestyles and culture topics — food, restaurants, travel, sports and pot — for daily newspapers, websites and national media, including Wired, High Times and The Splendid Table. 

I have produced food and travel features from datelines throughout the West: Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, Las Vegas, Vancouver and Victoria, BC.  In 2010, I created Pot Appetit, a lifestyles brand whose content has been republished in the Sacramento Bee and West Coast Cannabis Magazine.

Most recently, I produced multimedia food and travel content for the Sacramento Convention & Visitors Bureau and its Farm-to-Fork Capital of America website. 

In this clip below from 2010, I appeared on KCET Los Angeles public television discussing pot tourism in California.

and attractions from art museums to a breath-taking free-fall simulator, all mapped out, professionally edited and easy to use.
In addition I will write and edit a feature-length article and sidebars based on my reporting. I have already pre-sold a story to one publication. 

Who I amI am a veteran journalist and media producer who has reported on lifestyles and culture topics — food, restaurants, travel, sports and pot — for daily newspapers, websites and national media, including Wired, High Times and The Splendid Table. 
I have produced food and travel features from datelines throughout the West: Seattle, Portland, San Francisco, Las Vegas, Vancouver and Victoria, BC.  In 2010, I created Pot Appetit, a lifestyles brand whose content has been republished in the Sacramento Bee and West Coast Cannabis Magazine.
Most recently, I produced multimedia food and travel content for the Sacramento Convention & Visitors Bureau and its Farm-to-Fork Capital of America website. 
In this clip below from 2010, I appeared on KCET Los Angeles public television discussing pot tourism in California.

story:
This year marks my 10th year as a Breast Cancer Survivor.  I was diagnosed at the age of 33.  At the time my children were 5, 3 and 11 months old.  While we were focused on my health and the surgeries and chemo, I worried constantly about my children and the lasting effects the battle would have on them.  They were well cared for and attended by my husband and I as well as an amazing network of friends and family.  I consulted multiple sources to seek out information and support for them with no success.  I was actually told by a major cancer center's social worker that they were "for the most part at ages where they are so self-focused, they will not notice my battle unless it affects them in physical ways".

10 years later I find that was absolutely not the case.  While they are well-adjusted and wonderful, they certainly bear the lasting emotional scars.  We really could have used professional guidance to help us focus on what each of our children needed at the ages they were and what they needed going forward even after treatment was complete.

I am writing this children's book, The Day My World Turned Pink, from the point of view of my (then) five year old.  I would like to finish the book and publish it to share with the children of survivors to help them understand the changes that are happening around them and reduce the fear and uncertainty.  Further, I would like to take most of the proceeds from the book and invest them into programs that will target the children of breast cancer survivors and provide education and programming for them.

If I could fund this on my own, I certainly would.  Since I cannot, I am hoping you will consider supporting me.  Your support will pay forward to future generations if I am successful in my goal.

story:
I'm a certified Home Canner.  I teach canning classes through Cornell University Cooperative Extensions.  I have canned meat since I was a child growing up on a farm in Upstate New York.

This fundraiser is to pay for the first hard copy publishing of my book:  Prepping for Doomsday.  The exact printing costs, ISBN number, barcode, and shipping.

I feel no one should go hungry if they have the tools to preserve food including meat.  That is why I teach home canning classes.

No one knows what tomorrow will bring but having a well stocked pantry reduces the anxiety of preventing anyone from being hungry.

Please tell your friends and family about this project.  Hunger can be prevented.

story:
My Project:

I have planned a novel from start to finish.  I have started, but have yet to finish, but I am close.  My story follows a girl who suffers from bipolar manic depression.  She grows up in a small somewhat rural area of southeast Texas, in a place with an air of angst and aggression, in which her eccentric intelligence and creativity is unnoticed.  Her parents are inattentive and she feels isolated, struggling with her own mind and her development of her mania begins in her teen years.  
The story follows her from age 17 into adulthood, beginning with her having an affair with one of her high school teachers.  She loathes him because he is ignorant, married, and just looking to empower himself with an underage girl, but she allows herself to take pleasure in the encounter to see if she can truly separate sex (which has become a NEED for her already) and emotion because she cannot find an emotional connection.  She succeeds and ends the affair with an unexpected veracity making him feel small and guilty (sort of a mantis-esque affair).
The story follows her through failed attempts at college, marriage, careers, many affairs, pitfalls, and is ultimately about her struggle to find a balance between the forced ‘normalcy’ of society and her contentment with her non medicated state, and her search for love and happiness.  It is a wild ride intended to give readers insight into their own sense of balance with the life they have to live, and the life they want to live.  

About Me:
I am a bit of a free spirit/loose cannon who got a second lease on life be creating one…  Which led to two then three, so I am the father of three beautiful little girls.  I won awards for poetry in high school and have been published and loved writing but convinced myself that I couldn’t make a living doing so, so it was off to the world of peddling pot, doing construction, and selling cars.  (the pot dealing stopped when the girls were born, just to clarify)  Then, in 2008 I got a job at a plant.  I worked the night shift and it was a slow job, and to stay awake I began to write again.  I mapped out a couple of novels and finished up a screenplay that I never submitted anywhere, just for fun.  The first novel was my passion, and as the book was finishing so was my marriage, and I put the pen down for a while.  I started doing web design and I am also a licensed electrical contractor, and wearing those hats has been incredibly time consuming... so now when I do have the urge to get something accomplished, I can rarely find the time. 

I want to create.  I want the opportunity to leave a legacy.  I want the opportunity to find out if what is in my heart is my true path.  It would be the single greatest opportunity of my lifetime to be able to immerse myself headlong into this work and finish it, publish it, and present it to the world.  I had a qualm when debating on whether or not to appeal to the public for help, telling myself that a passionate determined writer would just make the time, so I put it on myself to finish this while juggling 2 jobs (I am also an electrical contractor) and being a father, and I am coming up short.  When I found indie gogo I was intrigued, but now, facing the reality of an actual opportunity to see if my life as a writer can begin NOW… to see if my life can be truly led by my soul and not my pursuit of a stable dollar, I am humble and hopeful.

 

The finances:

I want to get away for one month.  I have enough money to pay for my own food, etc, but I want to be able to put my company on auto-pilot and disconnect for a four week period in a cabin somewhere remote and isolated and do nothing but connect with my novel and finish it.  I have researched self-publishing along with minimalistic distribution options.  I have that process estimated at around 12,500 USD.  The other 4,000 USD comes from the cabin rental and covering bills as I will not be at my job for that 4 weeks.

IF I do not need the money in it's entirety, I will redistribute the remaining money back into indiegogo.com for other aspiring artists who need a boost to get going.

story:
Why Me?

Who is Jennifer Elizabeth Masters?

Today I am a life, love and relationship coach, hypnotherapist and energy healer. This was not my personal goal in life, however healing from my life experiences is what led me to do deep and profound work with women. As a child I experienced trauma which impacted me almost my whole life. I was molested by 4 different men by the time I was 12. Over 3 million Americans alone have been molested, that have been reported. One in three women experiences molestation, one in 5 experiences rape or sexual assault in their lifetime. Molestation does not just affect the emotional aspect of a person, it also impacts their physiology, specifically creating deep pain in the g-spot of the vaginal wall.

What most people don't realize is that without specific healing, this trauma  stays in the vaginal walls and can create pain during sex, and/or cause sexual dysfunction. 40% of all women have sexual dysfunction that prevents them from experiencing orgasm. 80% of women fake orgasm for a reason, most men AND women do not understand what the issues are. Even fewer know what to do to remedy the situation.

It was not until I was in my 50s that I began to study tantra and experienced a sexual healing through this study that alleviated my issues. I have been married and divorced 4 times. I experienced issues with orgasm in all 4 marriages. I faked it a lot. It was no body's fault. We just didn't know any better. 

Through my own experience, I learned what works and what doesn't. Sexual dysfunction leads to frustration, resentment and even anger within relationships. We all know that resentment, anger and feeling like a victim can kill a marriage. When we blame the other person for how we feel it causes issues. Molestation causes victimization which untreated continues into adulthood. My first book, Odyssey Victim to Victory is all about the healing that I experienced through over 30 years of soul searching, deep introspection, study and deep inner work on myself. This is the work I use in my coaching practice today. I help women (and some men) find fulfillment and happiness through self love. Most of my clients have either been raped, molested or both.

Most people are not so driven, but want answers and help. Over the years of coaching women in love and relationships I have discovered frustration with a huge gap in the understanding of their partners and spouses. That is why I wrote this book. Orgasm for Life a compassionate, loving and direct look at both men and women. It does not bash or beat up men. I use humor to help both sexes understand their partners. You will find out how they think, feel and desire. We are both different, yet we all want the same things, ultimately to love and be loved. 

Men and women even look at romance differently. Men are like the PCs of this world and women are the Macs. We can't direct connect because our operating systems are vastly different. Our programming is different and even our protocol is different. 

Want to know more? Read my blog:

Love Yourself Fearlessly

What This Book Isn't

  • It isn't pornographic
  • It is not about me 
  • About bashing either sex 
  • Isn't negative or disrespectful
  • Isn't about healing victimhood. Read my first book for help: Odyssey Victim to Victory

Teaches You How To

Help your wife heal from sexual dysfunction in a kind, loving, compassionate way.

  • give a woman what she needs to reach orgasm with regularity
  • I even offer coaching calls privately and in group format to help you right now!
  • Be a better lover (both men and women)
  • Help women get over their aversion to the thing men like best (we both know what this is!)
  • Heighten your sexual experience without toys
  • Raise your libido
  • Get over your insecurities in the bedroom

Better Sex, Better Love, More Intimacy

The end result is more happiness. Ease within your relationship. Sex is not THE relationship, but it IS THE GLUE THAT HOLDS IT TOGETHER.

  • Statistically, marriages that have great sex last longer
  • Intimacy is built outside the bedroom, I give you ways to build intimacy
  • Orgasms fire up over 80 centers of the brain (nothing else does this)
  • Orgasms lead to better health and even bring you closer to enlightenment!
  • If I can do it, after years of sexual dysfunction - YOU CAN TOO!
  • I teach you how to bring love into sex.
  • I teach you how to have FUN!
  • Sex is play, you will learn to bring out your inner child and even laugh in the bedroom
Where Your Money Goes
The funds you donate will be used to create a website for Orgasm for Life, pay for press releases, publishing and advertising. I am grateful for your help. Television shows, conferences and seminars are my goal.

Spread The Word

If you can't contribute, that's okay, please help spread the word. Post on FaceBook, Twitter and e-zines. Radio, t.v. interviews and public forums need to hear about this book to make it a BEST SELLER and a success. I am already interviewing on blogtalk shows and other radio stations. If you know of someone that should interview me, let them know! Let me know! I appreciate all your help. 

It takes people talking about this book to make it a success. Thousands of books are written every year. Help heal the world of sexual dysfunction, so that millions of happy people on our planet will enjoy deeper connection, intimacy and ultimately greater love. Happy people, happy planet! Make LOVE NOT WAR!

  • Join me on FaceBook, and tell your friends
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help

Thank you for all your support, sharing and help!

story:
Who Are You & What Is landscape / heartbreak?

Hello! I'm Michelle Peñaloza and I am a poet living in Seattle. You can learn more about me and read some of my poems here. 

landscape / heartbreak is my literary and cartographic project.  

I'm asking people to take me on walks from the Hugo House to places in Seattle where they've had their hearts broken (I take "heartbreak" to extend beyond romantic heartbreak to trauma of any kind that my volunteers are willing to share). I’m recording the audio of these walks and writing poems based on these conversations to create a chapbook of poems and maps, which will result in a literary cartography of heartbreak in Seattle.

landscape / heartbreak takes up the project of discovering a city by way of its people’s stories and exploring the interplay between the emotional and physical landscapes of a specific place. I begin the walks from Seattle's Hugo House to focus the project in a meaningful way by linking all of the walks to this physical landmark of Seattle's literary history and present. 

This project is a priority for me now because of the richness of opportunity for healing—for myself, for the participants, and for the larger audience the project will reach if this campaign succeeds. I believe landscape / heartbreak will speak to a wide audience and, hopefully, spark conversation, empathy, and catharsis in Seattle and beyond. 

What I Need & What You Get

Your contribution to landscape / heartbreak will fund essential aspects of the project:
  • Transportation: the cab / Car 2 Go rides / gas money post-walks to get my volunteers home (some of these walks are pretty far!)
  • Recording and Editing Equipment
  • Website
  • Printing (of maps and cool swag!)
  • Illustration, Mapping, and other Artwork
  • Time: for walking, editing the recordings, and, of course, writing and revising the poems. 

I need $3000 dollars to fund the continuation and completion of this project. 

You can help me raise it! And look at all the cool swag you’ll get! 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you can't contribute monetarily (I know, ya'll. I'm a poet. I'm a teacher.), you can help  by getting the word out about landscape / heartbreak. Please share the link to this page or to my website. Like landscape / heartbreak on Facebook! Tweet! Help me spread the word throughout Seattle and beyond.
  • If you're a letterpress or printing maven or master who believes in my project and are interested in contributing discounted or in-kind printing--please contact me!
  • If you have a specific place in Seattle you can name as a place of heartbreak, send me a query. I still have some walking to do.

I teach part-time at a community college and work part-time for human services non-profit; I strive to protect some number of hours a week dedicated to the creation of art. The success of this campaign will determine the ways in which I can devote time, attention, effort, and resources to landscape / heartbreak. 

Thanks for taking the time to check out my project!

story:
I Love Las Vegas

I'm Keith and I'm a hopeless degenerate, so Las Vegas is the perfect vacation spot for me. I haven't been in about two years, mostly because all my friends are married and/or have children. 

However, some friends are going to Vegas on January 16, and I want to go in the worst way. 

Since I'm self-employed, and that comes with all sorts of financial uncertainties, I decided that to pay for this trip I would recruit backers and reward those who help with gifts ranging from personalized poems to t-shirts (since I run a t-shirt business) to random stuff I have.

What I Need & What You Get

I need about $550 to pay for this trip. I understand there are more pressing monetary pursuits for all of you, so I'm willing to give you items commensurate with the amount of your contributions. Check the perks on the sidebar for the full rundown. 

The Impact - Other Ways You Can Help

Look, the only real impact here will be you helping me have a hellacious time on vacation. Maybe you can even live a little vicariously through me, a single-with-no-kids slacker who likes to party. 

If you can't give, or don't want to, I completely understand. Viewing and sharing this is still very meaningful to me. Every little thing you do is magic (dang, the Police are wack).

story:
Approximately 5 years ago, Naomi created a blog and called that blog “kwetoday.” Kwe means woman in Naomi’s traditional language, Anishnabemowin. Naomi frequently writes about feminist issues and responds to issues in Canadian media. More specifically, Naomi writes about issues relating to missing and murdered Indigenous women and girls, sex work, human trafficking, and her personal experiences in sex work, law school, and in general, her adventures in life. Her writings from her blog have been used in many courses at universities across Canada (generally, at no cost to the people using the writings) and many people from all around the world read her writing.

Since creating the blog, Naomi has used the same laptop—a trusty Mac (so old that they don’t make the kind she uses anymore). Over these years, Naomi has had to replace her screen, battery or power adapter/cord. Naomi is requesting help to raise funds to help purchase a new laptop. Contributing to this campaign will allow Naomi to continue to write at www.kwetoday.com. Moreover, by contributing to the campaign, you will also permit Naomi to continue to organize with other activists and leaders in indigenous feminist and sex work communities. Much of the organizing in these communities takes place online via social media (Facebook) or other online gathering places (google hangout, skype). Because her current laptop is so old, Naomi is limited to when and where she can assist with organizing in these communities (she cannot open google hangout or skype on her current laptop and Facebook conversations crash her browswer). So, not only will your contributions help Naomi to continue to write at www.kwetoday.com, but your contributions will also help Naomi to continue to assist the communities she writes about and assist the communities she represents.

Note: Any funds that are raised above the desired goal will be donated to an organization providing support to families of MMIWG2S (missing and murdered Indigenous women/girls/two-spirited).


Image credit: http://jessgillis.com/
