story:
¿Qué?

Donde tú me lleves es una obra llena de sentimiento y sentido que, la verdad, nadie nadie nos va a presentar mejor que el propio autor.

Donde tú me lleves, mi segundo poemario, es una mirada a lo profundo, a todo aquello que cada cosa que nos rodea esconde en su interior y que, aparentemente, no se ven con ninguna luz, porque sólo pueden sentirse. Son poemas desnudos que hablan, no solo del amor y el desamor, sino también de pequeños momentos simples que nos pueden sacar algo de nuestros adentros, de esa lucha que existe entre lo que pensamos de algo y lo que realmente es.

En cualquier rincón de alguna calle, en la naturaleza, en el trabajo, en cualquier celebración; los versos nacen en todo aquello donde estamos presentes o imaginamos estar, pero siempre hay alguien que te acompaña (físicamente o no) y que te ayuda a que esos versos se plasmen en el papel.

Donde tú me lleves es, al mismo tiempo, es una descripción de todos esos lugares que por segundos te abrazan y no te sueltan hasta que el poema no está terminado.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Luis García Piedehierro.

Tiene treinta  años y es extremeño, concretamente de la población de Almendralejo, provincia de Badajoz. Desde el año 2010 ejerce la profesión de policía local en el municipio de Fuente del Maestre (Badajoz). Ama la poesía desde que con trece años leyó un poema de Pablo Neruda de manera casual y quedó atrapado en este género. “Donde tú me lleves” es su segundo poemario, después de publicar en el mes de Octubre de 2015 “Con sabor a tus palabras” (Ediciones Albores), del cual se agotó la primera edición.

La escritura le ayuda a apreciar las cosas importantes de la  vida, ya que debido a su profesión, forzosamente tiene que dejar atrás el sentimentalismo, por lo que la poesía le salva, en cierto modo, de esa labor, a veces, no muy agradable.

En 2008 gana uno de los accésit del concurso de poesía y relato “del amor y otros relatos”, organizado por el Excmo. Ayuntamiento de Almendralejo a nivel autonómico, en Enero  de 2016 le publican uno de sus poemas en la revista anual de la congregación de “Los Luises” de Almendralejo,ha participado en el encuentro-recital de poetas extremeños organizado en Fuente del Maestre el pasado mes de Enero, y también ha impartido diversas charlas por varios institutos de su ciudad sobre poesía y literatura universal.

Luis García Piedehierro despertará tus sentidos.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 750€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Donde tú me lleves que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Luis García Piedehierro vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Agustin Astacio and I Host an internet Radio ministry called Healing X Outreach on blog talk radio and serve as a pastor in Accokeek, Maryland. On our first campaign for Holy heaven Ministry which serves the Lahore community in Pakistan with now over 150 children and a center for widows we raised 620 dollars and they were able to have a wonderful day feeding all the children and paying a month's rent with the money raised. After the success of the last campaign and seeing the joy it brought to the children and those working hard in the ministry in Pakistan I realized God put us in touch for a reason. If I can dedicate some of my time, money and efforts to make their days of poverty better than I have served a great purpose here on Earth.

What We Need & What You Get

This is a campaign to give these children a grand Christmas. If we raise our goal of 2,000 dollars it will give the children and widows there a great Christmas feast which may be the only meal they will have that week for some of them! It will also help Holy Heaven with their expenses in paying their rent for the month and perhaps even enough to give the children each a small inexpensive gift to take home for Christmas!  

The Impact

When I first took on this cause I was very reluctant and I was not heeding the call from God that he put these people in my path for a reason. I remember listening to the song, "Do Something!" by Matthew West and it has occurred to me that we all need to stop passing by those who are in need. In our little ways we all can do something and it starts with one step at a time. I've taken my first step and I hope you will with me to better the quality of life of those who don't have as much. The very small things we do can make a world of difference in the life of a child and our generosity can change their worldviews of others who cared for them despite the distances we have from them.

 

Risks & Challenges

I have to say that this is a campaign of significant risks for Pastor John Asher and his daughter Joyce. Religious freedoms do not exist and this very campaign could put them in jeopardy. They are willing to take the risk and I have been willing to do something they cannot do without any form of ostracism and perhaps persecution.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you cannot help financially or have access to a paypal account. What you can do is share with others about this campaign so we can reach our goal to give these poor children the grandest Christmas they could have. You can also send a check or money order to Agustin Astacio in the for category write "Pakistani children" I am the current pastor at First Baptist Church of Accokeek in Accokeek, MD.

story:
I am Nobby Clark, the original singer and founder member of the Bay City Rollers. Brought up in Edinburgh, I started the group with Alan and Derek Longmuir.

I sang on all of the early Rollers hits including Saturday Night that reached No.1 In the U.S. charts. I also wrote songs for the group. All my recordings and songs have sold millions of copies around the world and have been included on at least twenty six albums sold world wide over a fourty year period. I have not recieved one cent in royalties.

The court case in New York last year cost me a lot of money and ended when The Bay City Rollers filed a motion to have me dismissed from the case on the statute of limitations despite having admitted it was my voice on all the recordings.

My reasons for needing funding are two fold. I want to pursue further legal action against both the record company and The Bay City Rollers which will not involve the statute of limitations. If you hate injustice as I do, then I hope you will consider contributing to the fund.
The second reason is that my book The Lost Roller was self funded and with the help of Facebook has atchieved some good circulation but I now need to take it to the next level which will require advertising. It's my ambition to have as many people read my life and the true story of The Bay City Rollers as possible. It is a shocking story that needed to be told. If you would like to be a part of that campaign then please consider contributing to the fund.

I am fully committed to pursueing every avenue open to me and you're contribution will go along way to putting right this injustice.

I have not included a target ammount but every penny raised would either go towards the legal action or to publicise my book The Lost Roller.

Further information can be found on Facebook/Nobby Clark or youtube Nobby Clark.
If you are not in a possition to help with funding but would still like to help my campaign, then please help spread the word and use Indiegogo share tool.

Thank You

Nobby Clark.

story:
The fact of the matter is, I'm heading across country to chase ma dream. I've been saving and planning for months and then a guy short stopped me on the expressway and screwed my car up, causing my insurance to pep up and a deductible to infiltrate my savings. 

I'm still going to chase my dream. (deep breath) I wanted to become a Meteorologist. 

The first time I saw the movie "Twister", it changed something inside of me. it also solidified for me that Bill Paxton sucks and Bill Pullman rules. I knew that I had to be in front of a tornado before I died. I saw myself running and screaming and getting little aluminum balls to fly up in the air to somehow collect data that would eventually help us predict these unpredictable storms better. When Philip Seymour Hoffman died, I decided to stop chasing that dream and decided to really focus on play writing. 

On December 27th I'll be on my way to California with my cat Craig Jr. so that I can get paid to write for the screen. I'm also going to be writing a book along the way of short scenes that will take place in each location I stop in. Every single person who donates will be in the Special thanks of the book.

(Traveling with my buddy) NY-->Philly-->D.C (For any House of Cards reenactments).-->Wilmington N.C (Where they shot Dawsons Creek)-->Myrtle Beach, S.C.--> Savannah GA (Gump bench)--> Tallahassee--> New Orleans --> Texas (To visit Robert Dursts' nieghbor murder site. Just kidding. Maybe)

(Traveling with another buddy) Texas--> New Mexico (Roswell & Santa Fe - to sing a selections form Newsies and Rent)--> AZ(Grand Canyon)--> NV (Vegas, baby!) --> LA (home sweet home) 

I also will be running around performing the greatest perks of all time for those who find it in their hearts (and wallets) to donate.

 The last 10 years in New York were fun, challenging, disgruntling and fruitful. I've seen triumphs and I've seen setbacks. One being a car accident, which hurt my car Barry Scheck and my wallet, and another setback being  all the times I got broken up with.

This Campaign is Threefold:

1. Helps get me to LA with so that I can chase ma dream.

2. Helps me focus on writing a scene in EACH place I stop. (and driving)

3. Helps you get fun, crazy, cross country perks.

Where the Money Will Go:

1. Gas (estimating $30 in each stop) So a total of about $400

2. Tolls (estimating about $30 total)

3. Food (For me and for Craig Jr.) - To fuel us as we drive & write (Not at the same time), under estimating about $30 a day totaling: $240

4. Supplies (Like... febreeze for when Craig Jr. poops and duct tape) Let's say an estimation of $100

5. Lodging (So I don't have to sleep in my Rav4) Estimating all pet Friendly hotels through out the trip around $1000

6. Perks (making sure they are executed well) Let's say an estimation of $50 for any props or costume pieces. lol


** Honestly I can't wait to do any of these perks!

story:
My name is Austin, I live in Cold Lake, AB, I have been invited to Ontario to play Junior A hockey.

I have decided to write a book outlining the experience of a life time from the point of view of a 16 year old playing Midget tier 3 hockey to the unlikely events that saw me scouted for a junior A team as well as the successes and struggles of playing Junior A hockey, as well as the ups and downs of moving across Canada away from my family.

I decided it would be good idea to publish this as an inspiration to kids.

The funding would assist me on my journey there, as well help provide the funds to turn my journal into a book and have the book published.

story:
Hello, I'm Liam and I'm the founder of ODOU – a beautiful, award-winning print magazine dedicated to the sense of smell. Help us to bring you the next issue by pre-ordering your copy on Indiegogo.

What is ODOU?

ODOU, is the world's only printed magazine about smell and perfume. It's for readers who love beautifully designed publications housing intelligent, in-depth features. And of course, for those who simply live through their noses.

Perhaps you've been there; the smell of cut grass and the memories of summers gone by, or the whiff of a passerby's perfume and your head turns. Maybe it's the smell of your newborn baby's head or your grandparent's cooking – nearly all of us have favourite and fond smells. Articles in ODOU discuss all these kinds of topics lightheartedly, longingly, scientifically, even lovingly.

We've carried articles about the journey of an essential oil distiller in the sunny Mediterranean, we got to know a perfumer and how they work, and we've been challenging the perfume-gender debate since issue one.

You won't find content about the latest trend, must-have celebrity scent, or even top-tips running down the inside fold because these already exist in print and that's not what we're interested in. ODOU is much more exploratory, curious and revealing. Its aim is to awaken your interest in your olfactory surroundings, to stop and smell the roses.

Issue three

Issue two

Issue one

You can get in touch with me liam@odoumag.com, say hello on twitter @odoumag.
Need press stuff?

The beta launch

As a self-funded initiative, with very little marketing, ODOU has managed to sell over 700 copies across the world. This was great to test the water and see if there was a demand for this kind of publication, which there clearly is.

I started the magazine as a side project via an online, on-demand printing service. The quality of printing from this service is fine, but it's not great, and it doesn't allow for scalability and the practicalities associated with traditional printing. Getting to three issues was my first goal and I'm confident that future issues can be even better. I need use traditional bulk-printing to create a magazine that can be stocked in shops.

Currently ODOU comes out twice a year and that format works for us. In early 2014, three articles in issue one were nominated for a Jasmine Award – the UK's prestigious competition for excellence in fragrance journalism, organised by the Fragrance Foundation. The lead article won the coveted Literary Award. And just this year, six articles from issues two and three were nominated in multiple categories, once again ODOU nabbed the Literary Award. This kind of recognition spurs us on.

The plan – issue four

Currently issue four is already under way. It contains articles on the illustrious scent of ambergris, fragrance in Greek mythology and a personal account of a perfumer's journey in education.

For this upcoming issue, we decided it was time to walk away form on-demand printing. We just can't stock the magazine in shops with this service, and the cost per page is significantly higher, so traditional bulk-printing makes sense.

Why Indiegogo?

I tried raising funds on Kickstarter, whilst this was exciting, ultimately the all-or-nothing approach didn't work. So I'm on Indiegogo to raise funds to print issue four with a flexible option that enables me to use any of the funds raised whether or not I reach the goal.

I've already got the majority of the content in for issue four and work has already begun on laying out and experimenting with layouts and concepts.

Reaching the goal would mean printing issue four in a fitting format that's deserving of the content within. Backing ODOU issue four would enable the magazine to stand on its own for future issues. It would mean crafting a magazine with a befitting look and feel that could not have been achieved previously with an on-demand printing service.

With this in mind, I won't be developing digital versions of the magazine at this time.

I'm not going to pretend it's easy to self-finance a magazine. Which is why we're reaching out to scent-lovers, and lovers of niche magazines around the world to help get this issue made, by pre-ordering your copy, or supporting our campaign in other ways.

It's time to ramp up the game for issue four, and this is where we'd love your support.

Rewards and perks

Back ODOU and receive some lovely goodies like a tote bag, or your name in the magzine! The images below are mockups so things might change slightly.

Risks and challenges

My background is in digital design and the world of print is a big challenge to me so this is a new undertaking, with proportions larger than what I'm typically used to. Nonetheless, any good designer worth their salt embraces new challenges and technicalities. Having worked on the first three issues, I'm confident that I can develop issue four further, and hopefully as a result, future issues.

There's some truth that printed publications are lost in favour of their digital counterparts. This might apply to the mainstream market, however there is an acute interest rising in independent, niche, quality publications. The latter is where I see ODOU.

What is ODOU?
ODOU, is the world's only printed magazine about smell and perfume. It's for readers who love beautifully designed publications housing intelligent, in-depth features. And of course, for those who simply live through their noses.
Perhaps you've been there; the smell of cut grass and the memories of summers gone by, or the whiff of a passerby's perfume and your head turns. Maybe it's the smell of your newborn baby's head or your grandparent's cooking – nearly all of us have favourite and fond smells. Articles in ODOU discuss all these kinds of topics lightheartedly, longingly, scientifically, even lovingly.
We've carried articles about the journey of an essential oil distiller in the sunny Mediterranean, we got to know a perfumer and how they work, and we've been challenging the perfume-gender debate since issue one.
You won't find content about the latest trend, must-have celebrity scent, or even top-tips running down the inside fold because these already exist in print and that's not what we're interested in. ODOU is much more exploratory, curious and revealing. Its aim is to awaken your interest in your olfactory surroundings, to stop and smell the roses.

story:
De 3 ani, peste deal de Roșia Montană, în Corna, o echipă de câțiva localnici și studenți, la inițiativa Asociației RYMA din Alba Iulia, și-a propus să recupereze clădirile care odinioară constituiau centrul administrativ al satului, în prezent aflat într-o starea avansată de degradare.  

 

În planurile companiei miniere de la Roșia Montană, satucul de la poalele Cârnicului nu reprezentata decât ”amplasamentul” unui mare decantor, care l-ar fi înghițit cu totul. Timp de 15 ani localnicii nu au trăit doar cu gândul că satul lor va dispărea definitiv, dar și cu realitatea demolării unei părți importante din sat, mai bine de două treimi, precum și cu dispariția treptată a tuturor serviciilor - dispensar, alimentară, școala și căminul cultural. Satul trebuia golit pentru a face loc marelui iaz de decantare...

 

Un loc altadata viu, a fost depopulat și saracit. Azi, cu ajutorul voluntarilor și localnicilor, câteva dintre vechile clădiri pot fi readuse la viață. Una dintre acestea este vechea grădinița, pe băncile căreia sute de corneni au învățat, ani la rând.

 

O parte din proiectul de recuperare a fostei grădinițe a primit sprijinul Ordinului Arhitecților din România. Astfel, pentru echipamente, hrană pentru studenții și voluntarii implicați în restaurarea clădirii, contracterea de specialiști etc au fost asigurate fonduri printr-un grant.

Pentru finalizarea acestei inițiative mai sunt însă necesari cel puțin 7000 RON pentru achiziționarea materialelor:

> 6000 buc. șindrilă + manoperă, meșteri locali

> 3mc scândură pentru astereală

> 2mc scândură pentru dușumelele de lemn

> 500Kg var pastă

> 2mc nisip

 

Clădirea urmează să devină un punct de informare turistică cu spațiu minimal de găzduire pentru cei ce doresc să înopteze în Corna. Funcțiunea va genera un loc de muncă pentru un ghid local și va asigura materiale informative pentru promovarea turistică a satului Corna și a vecinităților.

 

În zona Roșiei Montane și a satelor învecinate ajung anual mii de turiști. Multitudinea de puncte de atracție și necesitatea unui punct de informare tematic este astfel pe deplin justificată și în acord cu planurile de dezvolatre pentru întreaga zonă.

----

Corna a rezistat la locul său datorită unui uriaș gest de solidaritate din partea societății civile din România și nu numai. E momentul să îi dăm șansa să recapete ceea ce a pierdut prin indiferența și oportunismul altora. 

Dacă puteți ajuta cu materiale sau chiar alimente, dați-ne de știre: contact@ryma.ro.

Pentru donații puteți contribui în contul Asociației RYMA, care nu se află la prima astfel de intervenție (anul trecut căminul cultural din Corna a fost renovat printr-o acțiune similară):

RO 47 BTRL 0010 1205 1151 38XX - banca Transilvania, cont RON

story:
WHY THIS BOOK?

When we grow up we forget to enjoy things that we enjoyed when we were little, like picture books for example. I have learnt so many things out of them as a young girl and they really boosted my imagination. A lot of times they helped me explain things I couldn’t understand. But why should we stop with this habit as adults? Why shouldn’t we explore the symbolism of pictures and find ourselves in written words again? This is why I made this project and this is why I believe it can help us find wonderself, even when we think we lost it.

BACKGROUND

I am Maruša Štibelj, a collage artist from Slovenia. 

I started to do this little art book project when I was staying in an artist residency in Germany in 2015 (Alte Schule Hohenstein). It was supposed to be an exhibition about relationship towards ourselves, but in the end it turned out to be much more than that.

I always wanted to write a book but lacked the courage to actually publish something. Well, that was until Alice came into my life. No, don’t be confused. It’s not actually Alice from Wonderland even though she was a great inspiration for me. It’s a different Alice, already grown up but this time totally lost in her thoughts and well, her life. To get out of this mess, she needs to pick up the phone and call herself and when she does, the adventure of finding Wonderself begins.

To find out more about my artwork and references please visit my portfolio site here: www.marusastibelj.com

THE PICTURE BOOK

The book contains 8 collages, which are in size of 80×100cm in real life, so you can imagine there are a lot of collage details. 


The collages are made out of old napkins (collecting napkins in Slovenia was a big hit in the 60ies), old magazines, old family photos found on flea markets (from year 1920 and up) and colored paper.

In the story you will find creatures like ear butterfly, chicken with a golden palace, octopus that looks like a politician, talking house, fat snake of fear…. 

What is special about this book is that Alice symbolically grows through the book. In every collage she is a different girl though. 

I would say that symbolism plays a big role in this book and that makes it suitable for adults.

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

PRINTING THE BOOK

I am doing this crowdfunding campaign because I want to show the Wonderself around the world. Like my Alice in the books says “It’s not fun to keep the good things only to yourself!” The book is already written and illustrated with collages, but now I need some money to do a first edition of the book - 100 hard cover copies. I am not a mathematician but in the end I calculated I need around 1000 euros to do that.

DESIGNING THE BOOK

I am not going to do that, because the story and the collages are good and I don’t want to mess it up with bad design, as I am the worst when it comes to computer skills. And here is where Tanja, my good friend, who is an excellent designer (specialized in books and usually helps me with design stuff), comes into the picture. But now I really want to pay her, even though she said she believes in the project and will do this for free. But because I believe in this project too, I think I can raise money for her as well.

PROMOTION

That takes time and money. I have time so now all I need is some money for flyers, book promotions and so on.

OTHER STUFF

And finally, I want to take all the family and friends that helped me out to dinner. Maybe they helped just with an idea, a cheer up talk, or maybe I want to thank them just because they are sticking with me on this artist path that I chose to be on.

WHAT'S UP WITH PERKS?

To support the project and to make it happen you can choose between this perks: 

- The standard text eBook and a personal email of thanks with a picture of a telephone collage postcard as a reminder so you don’t forget to talk to yourself.

- Package of postcards (5 different postcards) – images from the collages in the book. (15×21cm)

- Package of Old school postcards (5 different collage images) made from old family photos with written thoughts. (10×15cm)

- Package of Whats up? Postcards (5 different collage images) made from old magazines from the 60’s. (10×15cm)

- Signed poster of your choice (42×52 cm (37×47cm image size), 150 g/m2) of your favourite collage from the book. Once the campaign is finished I will send you the options by mail (8 different options). 

- Hardcover book (will be between A4 and A3 format size).

- Book Special - a signed hardcover book with a handwritten quote inside (will be between A4 and A3 format size). Only 30 Available.

- Gicllee art print - signed Giclee print of your favourite collage from the book  on Fine Art mat paper 310g (42×52cm). Once the campaign is finished I will send you the options by mail (8 different options).

- Signed limited Edition Giclee print of book cover. Only 30 fine art limited Edition Giclee Print on Fine Art mat paper 310g (42×52 cm).

THANKS TO ALL OF YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT. LET'S MAKE THIS HAPPEN! :)

story:
"Back Room"

Lawrence "Larry" Smith had never been one to take chances. Playing by the rules was how he lived his life and built his career. But then Tracy walked out and Aksel went off the rails, all in the same week, and just like that Larry's world was shattered.

As World Aid Corps' (WAC) Middle portfolio began to crash and burn somewhere between the windswept deserts of southern Syria and the English-themed pubs of Amman, Larry found himself pulled into the murky world of cross-border humanitarian operations. Little could he know that the truth of what actually happened with grant US-008-58673-0062 would spiral through the cramped offices of the Ronald Reagan Building, smoky pubs in Sweifiah, and the dusty planes of As Sweidah. What connected Aksel, head of office for WAC in Amman to a Syrian warlord with international ambition? Would Larry take the fall for Aksel’s fast-and-loose style? Would he survive outside the safety of the D.C. headquarters? And what would become of the alluring but mysterious Hannah?

This is the sixth book, and fifth humanitarian novel by veteran humanitarian, J.

The manuscript for Back Room is complete and under beta-review at this time.

Be sure to check out J.'s author page on Amazon.

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • Contributions to this project will all go toward professional editorial assistance, original cover art, and production costs:

    This book will be professionally edited and have original cover art. Evil Genius will use the services of Bethanyeditorial for the production of Back Room. A creator for the cover has not yet been identified..

    Funds raised up to the goal of $2000 will be split evenly between these two.

    Funds raised in excess of the goal of $2,000 will be used to offset production costs, such additional identifier numbers (ISBN) for print versions, etc.


    The Evil Genius Publishing reward system:

    $10 or more gets you a free advance copy of the published ebook (PDF).

    $50 or more gets you a free advance copy of the published book (PDF) and mentioned by name on the "Special Thanks" page of the published book.

    $100 or more gets you everything above, plus an autographed print version.

    $500 or more gets you everything above, plus a character in the story named after you.

     

    The Impact

    By contributing to this important project, you're directly making the world better in three ways:

    You're helping to further establish Evil Genius Publishing, a tiny indie publisher that focuses on the humanitarian industry: books by, for, and about aid workers. This will be Evil Genius' fifth unique publication. Every little bit of experience we get makes us all that much better.

    You're contributing to the amount of writing and literature out there specifically for and about the humanitarian aid industry that isn't dry, boring, pretentious, technocratic, academic drudgery. The medical field has Dean Koontz and Grey's Anatomy; the spy world has Robert Ludlum. But what does the aid world have? (Please, not Angelina Jolie or Ben Affleck.) Make the world better: support Evil Genius.

    You're helping up to three starving artists gain real world experience (me, the writer; my freelance editor, trying to make a go of it; and the person who will create the original cover art). Writing is hard. Editing and drawing are even harder. The world needs more of all three. Be part of the solution.

    Risks & Challenges

    As we said above, the manuscript for this book has already been written: Back Room will absolutely be published. It's just a matter of time, and a matter of what the final, published version will look like. Some of the primary challenges in releasing a book like this is that things tend to take longer than projected. 

    Some specific things that might delay the release of Back Room:

    A big disaster happens and J. gets deployed (I'm a disaster response manager in real life. Some times my real job happens).

    The editor and artist get slammed with real life (kids, day jobs, etc.), and take longer than expected.

    Beta-readers (see below) take longer than expected to give their feedback.

    How Evil Genius works with these kinds of challenges:

    Total transparency about delays, challenges, revised deadlines. We'll update the Evil Genius and Tales From the Hood (author's personal) Facebook pages with regular updates so that contributors and readers know what's going on.

    Make it right: If anyone--contributor to this project, reader--feels that we've not lived up to our promises, whether here or elsewhere, we welcome that feedback, and will do all we can to make it right.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    There are ways to support this project besides/in addition to financial contribution:

    Be a reviewer. Got a blog or a website? Help get the word out by reading a pre-release version of Back Room and publishing your review on your site.

    Want to edit pro bono? Okay, cool!

    Spread the word! Facebook, tweet, Instagram, like, or graffiti the link to this fundraising project; brag about being a supporter or beta-reader.

    Interested in any of these? Drop a line to evilgeniuspubs@protonmail.com

$50 or more gets you a free advance copy of the published book (PDF) and mentioned by name on the "Special Thanks" page of the published book.
$100 or more gets you everything above, plus an autographed print version.
$500 or more gets you everything above, plus a character in the story named after you.
 
The Impact
By contributing to this important project, you're directly making the world better in three ways:
You're helping to further establish Evil Genius Publishing, a tiny indie publisher that focuses on the humanitarian industry: books by, for, and about aid workers. This will be Evil Genius' fifth unique publication. Every little bit of experience we get makes us all that much better.
You're contributing to the amount of writing and literature out there specifically for and about the humanitarian aid industry that isn't dry, boring, pretentious, technocratic, academic drudgery. The medical field has Dean Koontz and Grey's Anatomy; the spy world has Robert Ludlum. But what does the aid world have? (Please, not Angelina Jolie or Ben Affleck.) Make the world better: support Evil Genius.
You're helping up to three starving artists gain real world experience (me, the writer; my freelance editor, trying to make a go of it; and the person who will create the original cover art). Writing is hard. Editing and drawing are even harder. The world needs more of all three. Be part of the solution.
Risks & Challenges
As we said above, the manuscript for this book has already been written: Back Room will absolutely be published. It's just a matter of time, and a matter of what the final, published version will look like. Some of the primary challenges in releasing a book like this is that things tend to take longer than projected. 
Some specific things that might delay the release of Back Room:
A big disaster happens and J. gets deployed (I'm a disaster response manager in real life. Some times my real job happens).
The editor and artist get slammed with real life (kids, day jobs, etc.), and take longer than expected.
Beta-readers (see below) take longer than expected to give their feedback.
How Evil Genius works with these kinds of challenges:
Total transparency about delays, challenges, revised deadlines. We'll update the Evil Genius and Tales From the Hood (author's personal) Facebook pages with regular updates so that contributors and readers know what's going on.
Make it right: If anyone--contributor to this project, reader--feels that we've not lived up to our promises, whether here or elsewhere, we welcome that feedback, and will do all we can to make it right.
Other Ways You Can Help
There are ways to support this project besides/in addition to financial contribution:
Be a reviewer. Got a blog or a website? Help get the word out by reading a pre-release version of Back Room and publishing your review on your site.
Want to edit pro bono? Okay, cool!
Spread the word! Facebook, tweet, Instagram, like, or graffiti the link to this fundraising project; brag about being a supporter or beta-reader.
Interested in any of these? Drop a line to evilgeniuspubs@protonmail.com

story:
Story of My Book

How to Use People Analytics to Promote Personal Growth tells stories about people and data. While leaders can inspire with big ideas, it’s often hard cold facts that get people motivated to set and achieve personal goals.

I’ve interviewed dozens of experts on this topic, including data scientists, workplace health consultants, health insurance leaders, human resource executives, and university researchers. They agree that companies that collect employee data have much to gain from consolidating it and analyzing it to improve employee experiences.

My name is Colleen McFarland and I’m the author of How to Use People Analytics to Promote Personal Growth.

I wrote this book because I know that personal data motivates individuals to set goals, stay the course, and make the changes necessary to better their lives. I know that privacy laws are going to make it possible for even more employees to get their personal data from their employers. I see an opportunity for employers to go beyond adhering to the letter of the law and partner with their employees by serving up their data in an a way that inspires them to engage with it and use it to set goals and better their lives.

My hope is that, -- in reading this book, you will discover reasons why people data should be shared in a smart way with employees. I also hope that you will come to appreciate the different types of people data that many companies have and how that data is used today.

In this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for leveraging people data to promote personal growth. And then ultimately I want you to see this book as a tool to help you champion the case for consolidating people datasets in your company and using them to better the employee experience and the lives of your employees.

In this book, you will find several stories like these:

  • Leaders saw which group of employees need support from managers from digital activity
  • An unemployed 25-year-old went from $2.26 in savings to $1.25 million in just over five years by daily monitoring his finances
  • An analysis of employee health data revealed how to stop healthy employees from becoming addicted to opioids

 

If you agree that many people spend a good amount of their time at their workplace and for that reason the workplace is an ideal environment to reach-out and inspire someone to set personal goals and achieve them, this is the book for you.


How to Use People Analytics to Promote Personal Growth  is a non-fiction book that speaks to CEOs and Chief Human Resources Officers who are looking at the implications of employee data privacy laws and exploring the cost-benefit of consolidating their employees' data for the first time.

The Book - How to Use People Analytics to Promote Personal Growth

The book is written in three parts....

Part 1: Why Share People Data contains an introduction plus five additional chapters. You will learn that existing privacy laws provide some employees the right to get their personal data from their current and past employers. Employers that don’t comply with the laws face the risk of financial penalties. I believe when people data is provided to the individual in a regular and meaningful way, it makes that person smarter about understanding data. Comfort with data contributes to what is referred to as a “data-driven cultures” Companies with “data-driven cultures" have a significantly higher revenues (96 percent), cash flow (88 percent), and profit margins (82 percent).” [Forbes.com]

Part 2: Types of Data contains four chapters that describe typical people data that employers have. Included is Health Risk Assessment (HRA) data. HRAs measure employee health as it relates to the lifestyle practices. Analysis of the HRA data often results in recommendations to fund employee wellness programs like fitness walks, healthy eating seminars, or smoking cessation incentives in efforts to reduce health risk. Also covered is engagement data. Engagement data measures the emotional connection employees have to their company and its goals. Analysis of Engagement data will include tabulated data by leaders of specific groups.

Part 3: Using People Data contains seven chapters. Included are stories describing the typical ways people datasets are used today. For example, you will read about how Salesforce reviewed compensation data to test an assumption that compensation was biased by gender. Also included is the story of the Tech company committed to preserving its culture of openness between employees. They demonstrate this with frequent short surveys to employees that result in instant culture scores for managers.


What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor 
  • The cover design of my book  (the mockups you see currently are a placeholder)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book 
  • The copy editing for my book 
  • The launch & promotion Efforts for my book 

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.

 

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • Your name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Invitation to a Book Release Party (tentative date:  Fri. April 17) somewhere near Wrigley Field in Chicago
  • Early access to the introduction of my book and my parts of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

 

About the Author

Colleen McFarland’s expertise is organizational change management. She works with leaders who appreciate the value of anticipating and preparing for the impact a business change will have on their customers and employees. She has seen the benefits of good change management on business outcomes and culture. She is also a huge advocate of networking and has made it part of her every day life. Being open to others, getting to know them, working to understand their point of view, and learning from them is what she does best.

Colleen was curious if companies were leveraging employee data the way she has seen customer data being used. She’s been impressed with customer experiences she’s had that demonstrate the smart use of data to better understand what’s important to her and provide it. She wondered if the same investments were being made to better the employee experience and inspire employees to push themselves to set and meet personal goals.

In her personal life, the data savviness of young adults has wowed her. She and her husband John have two young adult sons. Her research for this book led her to learn about the rise of mental illness in young adults and its link to the overuse of technology that robs individuals of face-to-face contact. Colleen believes that, with the help of data, the workplace offers the opportunity for individuals to identify that they need to make lifestyle changes to improve their wellness and lead lives of purpose.

For more information, you can connect with Colleen at colleenmcfarland1@gmail.com and https://www.linkedin.com/in/colleenmcfarland1/.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #peopledataworks and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to with a couple of friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.

Thank you for your love and support. I appreciate it.

Sincerely,
Colleen McFarland

story:
Story of My Book


Rise is about how you can make the best out of the experiences that you have experienced in order to have a life worth living. No matter where you come from, it is important to understand that you are unique, and your uniqueness should be an asset when you walk into a room full of people that are different than you. 

My name is Nia Rainer and I am the author of Rise. I wrote this book because I wanted to show people the importance of believing in yourself, regardless of what the world may tell you. In a world where there is always a standard to live by, it is important that you stay true to who you are and appreciate the experiences, stories, and memories that make you the best person that you can be. It does not matter where you come from or the experiences that made you believe that you were not enough. What matters is that you have potential, regardless of how unorthodox your background may be. 

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover your inner badass. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to discover the power of resilience, persistence, and believing in yourself. 
 

FOR ALL: 
You will love this book if you have struggled with the challenges that come with being a part of an underrepresented group, want to improve on your leadership skills, or want to. try something new in your life.

Rise speaks to underrepresented groups and potential leaders who want to learn to persist and believe in themselves in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Rise inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

How can I value my uniqueness? 

How can I give back to my community?

How do I thrive in a world that always wants to tell me no?

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discovering the power of resilience, persistence, and believing in ourselves will change us all for the better. 

What I Need & What You'll Get:

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April,2021

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring .


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.

You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.

You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.

You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.

And much more!

 

About the Author

Nia Rainer is a junior at High Point University studying International Business with a minor in Spanish. She is the founder of Caona Culture, Vice President of the Alpha Zeta Chapter of Lambda Pi Chi Sorority, Inc., an HPU Student Justice, a projectBASTA fellow, and a member of Alpha Kappa Psi. 

She values the importance of embracing your true self. She wrote this book because she’s passionate about teaching people to utilize their unique selves in order to make an impact on the world. Nia became interested in how a person’s background, challenges, and experiences make them the person they are today, and how those experiences will make them an even better person tomorrow. 

When Nia isn’t writing, you can catch her practicing her guitar, cooking pasta from scratch, or catching up on some of her favorite Netflix shows, including but not limited to: Girlfriends, Big Mouth, and The Good Place. While she is currently studying in High Point, North Carolina, Nia was born and raised in Queens, New York. You can follow her on Instagram @niarainer. 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier. 

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #risebyniarainer and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Nia Rainer

story:
Our Story

The Magpie Anthology will be curated by Christine Taylor (photographer) and Amber Beard (writer). We both have long backgrounds in publishing and magazines, are passionate about the written word and fabulous imagery and realise that there is a gap in the market for a great online blog / magazine hybrid - a blogzine! Ideal for reading when you're travelling, on the go or just about anywhere, The Magpie Anthology will showcase what's going on here, there and everywhere; from travel and food to wellbeing, art and culture - there's a big wide world out there that needs talking about. Editorial contributions will come from a wide range of contributors and we are eager to hear from any writers or photographers with great ideas.

The blogzine will be based on a Near, Far, Further basis - so where your near is will depend on where you might be reading it and will be a perfect platform for restaurants, hotels, holiday accommodation, galleries, publishers, shops, designers and influencers to showcase their wares through specifically targeted editorial and reviews.

For businesses we will work on the basis of editorially led promotion rather than advertising as we believe that this is more in keeping with our format. Editorial will be available on a paid for basis and can be written in house or by the client. The benefit of this format is a live link to your website, social media and e mail thus ensuring immediate engagement. Unlike a printed format which will ultimately be  discarded, The Mapgie Anthology will enable readers to store articles for future reading or reference which will add to the longevity of your presence. As with editorial, imagery can be produced in house or submitted and will be edited by us.

 

What We Need

We need funding to realise our dream project, to invest into what we believe will be an exciting new platform for readers and advertisers alike. Our funding will cover the initial website build and publicity materials and will set us on our way.

There are some small perks to helping us. We have some beautiful cards which we'll be sending out, featuring Christine's photographs, online shout outs for businesses and a launch event in September that anyone funding £100 or over will be invited to. 

We understand that not everyone can afford to fund us, but we'll still need help with editorial topics and great reviews of where you've been, what you've done and how you did it! The Magpie Anthology will also devote some of its pages to charity and these will, of course, be free of charge.

 

The Impact

The impact of your funding help will be that we will have a fabulous project up and running by the beginning of September. We will have two members of staff on a part time basis to assist us with the techy stuff and the accounts - so we'll be providing employment too.

We'd love you to be even a small part of this right at the beginning and we'd also love you to tell you friends AND most importantly subscribe to what will be something just a little bit different from the norm.

And that's all there is to it.

Ideal for reading when you're travelling, on the go or just about anywhere, The Magpie Anthology will showcase what's going on here, there and everywhere; from travel and food to wellbeing, art and culture - there's a big wide world out there that needs talking about. Editorial contributions will come from a wide range of contributors and we are eager to hear from any writers or photographers with great ideas.
The blogzine will be based on a Near, Far, Further basis - so where your near is will depend on where you might be reading it and will be a perfect platform for restaurants, hotels, holiday accommodation, galleries, publishers, shops, designers and influencers to showcase their wares through specifically targeted editorial and reviews.
For businesses we will work on the basis of editorially led promotion rather than advertising as we believe that this is more in keeping with our format. Editorial will be available on a paid for basis and can be written in house or by the client. The benefit of this format is a live link to your website, social media and e mail thus ensuring immediate engagement. Unlike a printed format which will ultimately be  discarded, The Mapgie Anthology will enable readers to store articles for future reading or reference which will add to the longevity of your presence. As with editorial, imagery can be produced in house or submitted and will be edited by us.
 
What We Need
We need funding to realise our dream project, to invest into what we believe will be an exciting new platform for readers and advertisers alike. Our funding will cover the initial website build and publicity materials and will set us on our way.
There are some small perks to helping us. We have some beautiful cards which we'll be sending out, featuring Christine's photographs, online shout outs for businesses and a launch event in September that anyone funding £100 or over will be invited to. 
We understand that not everyone can afford to fund us, but we'll still need help with editorial topics and great reviews of where you've been, what you've done and how you did it! The Magpie Anthology will also devote some of its pages to charity and these will, of course, be free of charge.
 
The Impact
The impact of your funding help will be that we will have a fabulous project up and running by the beginning of September. We will have two members of staff on a part time basis to assist us with the techy stuff and the accounts - so we'll be providing employment too.
We'd love you to be even a small part of this right at the beginning and we'd also love you to tell you friends AND most importantly subscribe to what will be something just a little bit different from the norm.
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Story of My Book

Conceal::Reveal is a story of entrepreneurship in the defense innovation ecosystem before, during, and leaning into our post-COVID world. 

My name is Julie Willis and I am the author of Conceal::Reveal. I wrote this book because my transition from being a government contractor, inside Army Futures Command, to being an entrepreneur in defense innovation, exposed me to opportunities for the military and the defense industrial base to protect and defend our country.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover what is blocking the disruptive technology our warfighters need (yikes). I want you to see this book as an opportunity to understand defense entrepreneurs and enable them to conduct critical research and development. 

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of entrepreneurship and the defense industry in 2020 through narratives like:
  • The true cost of research and development: what small businesses have to spend in time and money to contribute to national security.
  • The test of COVID: how my startup, DEFIANT Communication, pivoted to create a community that serves the disruptors. 
You will love this book if you can handle a raw, honest look at the way business is done in defense. Conceal::Reveal speaks to public servants and entrepreneurs who want to grapple with the real challenges of research and development in a new way. 

Ultimately, I hope that Conceal::Reveal inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:
  • How can I contribute to the success of our military in 2028 (and beyond)?
  • What systems are we willing to question to make that happen? 
  • What trade-offs are we able to make to support innovation?
I really look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. Coming together and discussing the modernization of our military will change us all for the better. 

 

The Book - Conceal::Reveal

My book is written in 3 Parts: 

Part 1 contains the introduction + additional chapters. My first editor told me this is a love story. I’m not sure I agree, but I have to admit I am weirdly committed to the warfighter. In Part 1, you will learn why.

Part 2 contains the stories from the first few months of my startup life. From airport lounge hopping to getting close to a couple near-scandals, it’s a bumpy ride. Thankfully for me, I was moving too fast to feel it. 

Part 3 contains a breakup (boo), the collision of COVID and DEFIANT, and the struggle to find a way forward. You will learn what I learned - that we’ve created a system that enables and effectively endorses taking a percentage off research and development dollars in the United States.

Part 4 contains the process of me figuring out how I can do something about this problem. There was no doubt I’d address it, but I didn't have a solution...yet. 

Part 5 is when I set everything you now see in motion. Tada!

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The cover design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The copyediting for my book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The launch and promotion efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this winter

Milestones:

  • When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, the book will be published.
  • When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover.
  • When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish an audiobook.


***

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when it is published
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of Conceal::Reveal and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share the experiences of writing my book.
  • And more...!

 

About the Author

Julie Willis is the founder and CEO of DEFIANT Communication, a strategic communication firm dedicated to making connections that make an impact in defense innovation.

Did we mention Conceal::Reveal is basically a love story? Julie is not a Disney fairytale princess. She’s the sidekick in a bad romcom who’s married to her work. Why? Because in a different chapter she was the spouse left behind to worry if her husband would come home. From Iraq. For three years. It matters to her that this country equips the people who do the job that the rest of us are unwilling or unable to do.

Outside of her role as CEO and romcom sidekick, she is devoted to ice cream. Julie once went into a total fangirl tailspin when she met the man who invented Halo Top. It was so embarrassing that she felt compelled to apologize to his wife. Her response was, “are you kidding? This is the best day of his life!” Not because Julie did a great fangirl impression, but because he received an award. We just want to clarify that.

For more information you can visit DEFIANT's website, connect with Julie at julie.willis@defiantcomms.com, and follow the journey on LinkedIn and Instagram. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

One of the many risks that comes with sending pre-sale copies of a book is getting the books to you on time. I'm working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you! The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please us #ConcealReveal and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support. I’m excited for this book to be in your hands and I hope you are too!

Thanks again - let's do this!

Julie

story:
Story of My Book

Overgrown is a collection of poetry that explores life, death, and rebirth in the context of the natural world and a year of life experiences.

My name is Carolyn Maynard and I am the author of Overgrown. I wrote this book because poetry has always been a favorite writing style of mine, but it is one that is often overlooked. Before the thought of writing a book ever crossed my mind, I would write short phrases or poems in a journal, and the ideas kept flowing. I wanted to create a poignant and reflective collection of poems to revere life’s beauty and challenges and to inspire readers to examine their lives in new ways.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will see the recurring cycle of life, death, and rebirth through the book’s core themes, and interpret each piece to your benefit. In this book, I explore ways of navigating life with purpose and finding a way back to joy from hardship. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a celebration of both the mundane and the extraordinary facets of life and other people.

In this book, you'll be able to observe the following topics:

August chapter: Building personal strength internally and externally

October chapter: Acknowledgment of pain but a refusal to suffer

November chapter: Somber reflection on challenges, and a surrender to nostalgia 

April chapter: The various nuances of love and relationships as they live and die

You will love this book if you are interested in how we navigate life, and you are open to reflection on the various perspectives and occurrences that shape who we are and how we live. There is something for everyone among each piece in this book. 

 

The Book - Overgrown

The book is written in 4 sections, each named for a month of the year that I feel best represents the theme of each respective section.....

The August section was inspired by belief that life, no matter what, is always worth living. It explores finding strength as a woman in the world, and then simply as a person. This section also celebrates close relationships and how crucial they are to a healthy life.

The October section deals with the difficulties of enduring toxicity and moving on from troubling encounters. with other people. It’s an autumnal reflection on the challenges we are given, often in the face of futility.

The November section is darker than the other sections, as it explores the multifaceted nature of death – that of relationships, parts of ourselves, and the world around us as winter sets in.

The April section is celebratory and representative of rebirth. In the heart of spring, April sees the world born again, covered in flowers and new life. This section contains several poems about finding love in all its forms.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2019

The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!

The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)

The Copyediting for my book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter

When I pre-sell 100 copies of my book, I will publish. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish an audiobook. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition.


I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish

A Personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book

Your Name will appear in a Special, Acknowledgements Section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)

Early access to the Introduction of my Book and my entire manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback

The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover

I will do a poetry reading where I will share selected pieces from Overgrownand share the experience of writing my book

And more...

About the Author

Carolyn Maynard is from Marietta, Georgia. She attended Emory University as a Psychology major with a concentration in Neuroscience. During her time there, she worked as a writing consultant, gave a TEDx talk on modern relationships, and became a member of Alpha Epsilon Upsilon honor society. In addition, she launched a small business and interned at Children’s Healthcare of Atlanta.

Carolyn was drawn to Psychology in college, because she wanted to research what shaped our minds, our relationships, and our behaviors. She wrote this book for the same reasons - to explore the harsh realities and beautiful moments through a poetic lens in order to appreciate life as a whole through its complexity.

Beyond writing and research, Carolyn loves playing video games with her younger brother, rewatching the same shows over and over again, stand up comedy, and (against her better judgement) going out for coffee in the middle of the night.

For more information, you can connect with Carolyn at cfmaynard820@gmail.com and @carolynfrancesmay on Instagram.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #overgrownbook and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page

Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you so much of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Carolyn Maynard

story:
¿Qué?

Todas las cosas buenas se llaman Dios narra el trayecto vital de un joven de gran fe religiosa y de cómo, tras perderla, sustituye la figura sagrada por un movimiento social.

Medellín (Colombia) se convierte en Eterna Primavera: una ciudad cansada de la inseguridad en donde sus habitantes han decidido tomar la justicia por mano propia, castigando a los criminales en la calle. Erón Sera es el hijo adoptivo de un cura que trabaja como monaguillo en la iglesia de su padre y cuestiona sus creencias al confrontar la figura de un dios que nunca actúa contra las injusticias que se viven en su ciudad. Una noche, por conflictos con las licencias de construcción de la iglesia, la Alcaldía decide demolerla. La campana cae encima de Erón y lo deja atrapado dentro de ella por cuatro días y tres noches. Cuando el monaguillo sale de su encierro, al no encontrar respuestas al porqué Dios permite las cosas que permite, deja de creer en él. 

Erón concluye que la figura de un dios justo debe existir y decide crear un movimiento que castigue las injusticias. Para ello cuenta con Lidia Toro, una periodista local interesada en su caso de la campana y Simón Caballero, un incógnito con habilidades para la pelea. Con el apoyo de algunos feligreces que van a la iglesia, expande su grupo de seguidores bajo el nombre de ‘Renacer’ y se esparce como un virus en Eterna Primavera. Santa, un periodista compañero de Lidia Toro, decide seguir la pista de Erón y su grupo para exponerlo públicamente pero para ello debe rebuscar entre las sombras y el periodista olvida, como a veces olvidamos todos, que son las sombras las que van detrás de nosotros.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy te presentamos a Andrés Pastrana.

Nacido en 1991 en Apartadó, Colombia, estudió Comunicación Social en la
Universidad Eafit (Medellín) y Creación Literaria en la Universidad Pompeu Fabra (Barcelona). Ha trabajado como periodista en la Corporación Ruta N de la Alcaldía de Medellín sobre temas de ciencia, tecnología e innovación y en el periódico El Colombiano (Medellín) como periodista de calle y corresponsal internacional desde Barcelona. Participó en el proyecto de investigación periodística estatierraesmia.co donde viajó a Apartadó para entrevistar a las familias de campesinos que habían sido despojados de sus tierras y asesinados por reclamar sus derechos. Creó la serie virtual de perfiles periodísticos Fuera de Foco, donde se contaba el día a día de las personas con oficios sin visibilidad en la ciudad de Medellín (tanatopracticos, tragafuegos de calle, exorcistas y limpiavidrios de rascacielos).

¿Por qué?

Y por aquí una muestra de lo que encontraréis en sus páginas:

«Cuando hablé con Simón y Lidia en la iglesia, trazamos un plan absurdo y descabellado con una base muy poderosa: la verdad. Queríamos sacar a relucir los crímenes de tanta gente que camina por las calles como si nada, algunos con muertos o violaciones en sus manos, beneficiados por una justicia de brazos cortos y selectivos. Lidia propuso que hiciéramos un programa de radio donde fuésemos delatando a los malechores con la información que ya teníamos. Yo tenía una larga lista solo de los que iban a confesarse a la iglesia, en cuerpo o por decisión de sus madres. Pero viendo el auge que había tenido la justicia por mano propia en Eterna Primavera, pensé que lo mejor sería salir a la calle y entregarlos a la gente.
          Una justicia, si se quiere llamar, express.
          De modo que necesitaríamos una mano que los señalara y un ojo que los mirara a la cara. Suena fácil decirlo pero era un riesgo considerable, teniendo en cuenta la clase de personas con las que íbamos a tratar. Era allí donde entraba Simón, con su agilidad de gato y sus habilidades exclusivas para la pelea o la huida. Vestido de animero, él le echaría el agua sucia a los que lo merecen y el ciudadano de a pie haría el resto, como ya lo venían haciendo por su cuenta. Nosotros solo tendríamos que dar ese pequeño empujón, abrir la jaula y lavarnos las manos. El animero sería visto como un símbolo para expiar los pecados y le daría luz verde a la multitud para actuar como quisiera. Nunca pensé que esto fuera la solución al problema de la gente mala, por lo menos no a largo plazo, pero sí era un comienzo. Esa primera piedra desataría el caos y de las cenizas podría nacer una ciudad nueva.»

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 880€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cincuenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Todas las cosas buenas se llaman Dios que saldría después a la venta.

Aviso para navegantes: La opción RESPALDAR es únicamente para realizar donaciones a la edición, por lo que no habrá comunicaciones posteriores en busca de datos de envío... cualquiera de las opciones válidas de reserva exige cumplimentar formulario para poder servir el pedido.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Andrés Pastrana vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

Política de Privacidad

¿Qué?
Todas las cosas buenas se llaman Dios narra el trayecto vital de un joven de gran fe religiosa y de cómo, tras perderla, sustituye la figura sagrada por un movimiento social.
Medellín (Colombia) se convierte en Eterna Primavera: una ciudad cansada de la inseguridad en donde sus habitantes han decidido tomar la justicia por mano propia, castigando a los criminales en la calle. Erón Sera es el hijo adoptivo de un cura que trabaja como monaguillo en la iglesia de su padre y cuestiona sus creencias al confrontar la figura de un dios que nunca actúa contra las injusticias que se viven en su ciudad. Una noche, por conflictos con las licencias de construcción de la iglesia, la Alcaldía decide demolerla. La campana cae encima de Erón y lo deja atrapado dentro de ella por cuatro días y tres noches. Cuando el monaguillo sale de su encierro, al no encontrar respuestas al porqué Dios permite las cosas que permite, deja de creer en él. 
Erón concluye que la figura de un dios justo debe existir y decide crear un movimiento que castigue las injusticias. Para ello cuenta con Lidia Toro, una periodista local interesada en su caso de la campana y Simón Caballero, un incógnito con habilidades para la pelea. Con el apoyo de algunos feligreces que van a la iglesia, expande su grupo de seguidores bajo el nombre de ‘Renacer’ y se esparce como un virus en Eterna Primavera. Santa, un periodista compañero de Lidia Toro, decide seguir la pista de Erón y su grupo para exponerlo públicamente pero para ello debe rebuscar entre las sombras y el periodista olvida, como a veces olvidamos todos, que son las sombras las que van detrás de nosotros.
¿Quiénes?
Tandaia es una editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el emplear una campaña preventa para valorar la aceptación y viabilidad de cada título.
De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.
Hoy te presentamos a Andrés Pastrana.
Nacido en 1991 en Apartadó, Colombia, estudió Comunicación Social en laUniversidad Eafit (Medellín) y Creación Literaria en la Universidad Pompeu Fabra (Barcelona). Participó en el proyecto de investigación periodística estatierraesmia.co donde viajó a Apartadó para entrevistar a las familias de campesinos que habían sido despojados de sus tierras y asesinados por reclamar sus derechos.
