story:
Story of My Book

Skilled: Why Customer Service is More than a First Job focuses on the skills you can develop when you work in customer service. These skills are transferable and can be taken to any level in your career and in your personal life.

My name is Alma Angel and I am the author of Skilled: Why Customer Service is More than a First Job. I wrote this book because I want to highlight the skills people develop when they work in customer service or customer-facing roles. During the COVID-19 pandemic I was submitting job applications, but as my experience is mainly in customer service, I questioned whether I would be considered for these roles that are outside of customer service. As I worked on my cover letters, I realized that the skills I had gained through customer service are beneficial to have throughout your career and your personal life.

I wrote this book because I want to reach new graduates and college students and show them how they can benefit from working in customer service. Instead of just showing up because it’s their job, I want to show them what skills they can strengthen early and help take them into their future careers.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover the personal benefit of working in customer service and how those skills can be applied in both future jobs and your personal life. In this book, I hope to encourage new entrants in the workforce to see the opportunities in working in customer service early on. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you leverage the soft and transferable skills you develop through customer-facing roles in your career.

In this book, you'll learn about skills that are learned and useful in customer-facing jobs. You will hear stories of how...

  • Using active listening to find out what the problem is and preparing how to respond based on what you hear and see.
  • Assisting customers directly develops your ability to solve problems, by knowing the common possible solutions and narrowing down which one to apply.
  • You can learn to manage stress in fast-paced environments.
You will love this book if you work with high school or college students developing their professional skills, you’re currently working in customer service and looking to transition into other types of roles, or you’re a hiring manager and want to see what candidates with a customer service background can bring to the team.

Skilled: Why Customer Service is More than a First Job is a nonfiction book that speaks to new graduates and current customer service employees who want to look at the development and experience customer service jobs can give them in a new way.
 

The Book - Skilled

The book is written in 3 parts.

Part 1 contains the introduction and chapters 1-2. This section introduces what the main concepts in the book are and defines them. You will learn what customer service is and what soft skills are.

Part 2 contains chapters 3-10. This section details the skills you develop when you work in customer service roles, and why they are important.

Part 3 contains chapters 11-13. This section shows how these skills are important to have in your career, whether it’s within the customer service industry or out of it. It also explains why these skills are important to develop in younger generations.
 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in April 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Spring of 2021.
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Alma Angel is an MBA candidate with over 10 years of experience in customer service, with her latest role within the public sector. She is an independent young woman and works hard for the goals she sets. She is a first-generation college graduate, the first in her family to graduate with a bachelor's degree, and the first to pursue an MBA.

She wrote this book during COVID-19 when submitting job applications, but she would doubt herself because of her experience. However, she knew that the skills she had developed through her experience were valuable to have in most careers. She wrote this book to show students and current customer service employees that working in customer service can help develop skills that they can later leverage in their careers.

Alma enjoys connecting with first-generation students and sharing her experiences, as she can relate to people who are told they don’t have what it takes. She does, and she wants others to learn they do too and not to doubt themselves. She also loves to travel and enjoys the planning and coordinating aspects of her travels. During the winter months, you can find her snowboarding with her sister.

For more information, you can connect with Alma Angel at almaangelauthor@gmail.com and on Instagram at @alma.angel.aa
 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #SkilledWhyCustomerService and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Alma Angel

story:
My Story

Opportunity Day is a book about inspiring and uplifting the voices of Generation Z. It explores the external barriers in our education and social systems that have prevented young people from amplifying their voices and goals, and outlines how everyone can work together to give this generation a larger platform.

My name is Unnati Gupta and I am the author of Opportunity Day. I wrote this book because I want to show the world both the power and struggles of Generation Z, and I want to use the stories of an ordinary teenager to open doors for young people around the world.

I hope that, in reading this book, you will discover the chances for greatness we can create, both locally and globally, by simply listening to Generation Z. I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for amplifying unheard voices. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you understand the power of your voice and unique story.

In this book, you'll learn about the external barriers Generation Z faces in our educational and social systems and the changes we can see in the world by implementing reform in these exact areas. You'll hear stories such as...

  • What happened when I asked 20 young people the simple question, “What’s your story?”
  • How small companies like Fulphil and NextGen have used the power of young people to establish unique and successful business practices.
  • How sneaking into a gala started as a fun adventure and turned into one of my most life-changing moments thus far!

You will love this book if you are a member of Generation Z or want to learn more about how to support them.

Opportunity Day is a nonfiction book that speaks to both Gen-Z and other generations who want to revolutionize the way we interact with young people.


What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.

The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)

The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).

The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling before publication.

The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this Fall 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover edition and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.

  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Introduction and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review them and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!
 

About the Author

Unnati Gupta is the founder of the nonprofit organization Youth@Berwyn, a TEDx speaker, and passionate change maker.

Unnati wrote Opportunity Day to elevate the voices of our next generation. She hopes this book will open peoples’ eyes to the potential of Generation Z, and more importantly, provide them with tangible ways in which they can empower young people. A believer in the idea that young people can change the world with their unique ideas and perspectives, she wants this book to create a path for that to occur.

When not empowering Gen Z, she is a Ramen lover who can usually be found singing and dancing around her house when no one is home. Her secret? She is oddly bad at telling knock-knock jokes.

For more information, you can connect with Unnati at unnatigupta28@gmail.com, @_unnatigupta on Instagram, and https://www.linkedin.com/in/unnatigupta1/ on LinkedIn.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message at unnatigupta28@gmail.com

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family, and network. Please use #opportunityday and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so that we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my pre-sale campaign via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

story:
Story of My Book

Stronger Together is about my personal journey as well as many others’ journeys with Alopecia, an autoimmune condition that causes one’s hair to fall out. Through these inspiring individuals and their stories, I hope that we can break down the societal stigmas surrounding bald men and women and come out stronger together as a result. 

My name is Stephanie Yuen and I am the author of Stronger Together. I wrote this book because I wanted to be a voice for those who are going through their Alopecia journey right now and be able to spread awareness about this condition.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that Alopecia does not change someone’s personality. I want you to see this book as an opportunity to engage with the themes of courage and positivity and learn alongside others about the importance of never judging a person based on their appearance.

 

In this book, you'll encounter multifaceted dimensions of hardship and negating societal stigmas through narratives like:

  • How many Alopecians have been subjected to the “he or she has cancer” stares or questions; however, I hope to negate the mindset that bald individuals are sick.
  • How hair does not hinder nor change one’s personality.
  • How society needs to normalize bald men and women

 

You will love this book if you are all about expressing positivity, changing the world for the better, and working towards unity.

Stronger Together speaks to those with Alopecia and those without who want to grapple with society’s standards and body positivity in a new way.

Ultimately, I hope that Stronger Together inspires reflection and fruitful dialogue, pressing into engaging questions like:

  • How does Alopecia affect one’s mental and emotional health?
  • Does appearance change the way others view you?
  • Why do societal standards play such a crucial factor in peoples’ daily lives? Due to the fact that they are so engraved in our minds that we might not even realize them, how can we negate those types of mindsets?

 

I look forward to exploring these questions and beyond with my readers. I believe discussing coming out stronger as a result of a hardship and dealing with a problem head-on will change us all for the better.

 

The Book - Stronger Together

The book is written in 5 parts.

Part 1 - The Discovery contains the author’s note + 1 Chapter. Reader will learn about the process and chaotic feelings both my parents and I experienced when I learned that my hair was falling out. This chapter also discusses the rundown of the various types of Alopecia and the process I went through in attempt to treat it.

Part 2 - The Decision contains chapters 2-4. In Part 2 of my book, the reader will find out my decision behind shaving my head, my emotions as I head back to school, as well as my lifelong mentor that has helped shape me into the person I am today.

Part 3 - Social Stigmas contains chapters 5-10. Reader will learn the societal stigmas that Alopecians face daily and how we hope to negate that mindset. This part features insightful words from Dr. Angela Rodgers and Dr. Leslie Castelo-Soccio and inspiring stories from Nicolas Srut, Kylie Bamberger, Kevin Bull and Anthony Carrigan.

Part 4 - Masks On contains chapters 11-14. This part demonstrates the “masks” that Alopecians wear as a way to cope with the new look through means of makeup, wigs, etc.

Part 5 - Conclusion: The Way Forward contains chapters 15-19. In this part, the reader will gain insight from various individuals such as Shalice Ader, Chloe Bean, Deeann Graham, and so many more! These concluding chapters express hope for younger generations with Alopecia for there is an increased awareness for our condition through various social media platforms.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this summer.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book when I publish.
  • Your name will appear in the Acknowledgments section of my book.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover and title.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • And much more!

 

About the Author

Stephanie Yuen is a nursing student at Rutgers University with a minor in Spanish. She is an optimistic individual who likes to help and care for others.

Stephanie wrote this book in hopes of being a voice for others going through the same condition as her. She hopes that this book can create a positive impact on generations to come.

Stephanie likes to toss around the old pigskin or immerse herself in activities as long as it involves spending time with friends and family. She likes to joke around and make others laugh. In her free time, she loves to watch all types of movies except for horror. 

For more information, you can connect with Stephanie at stephanieyuen8@gmail.com and at @5teph_08 or @stronger_together2021 on Instagram.
 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #strongertogether and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.

You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.

Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Stephanie Yuen

story:
Story of My Book

Dear the Man Upstairs is a family-friendly story told in letters between a young girl and “The Man Upstairs.” At nine years old, a girl begins writing letters to the“Man Upstairs,” and someone writes her back. It’s not God.

My name is Maytal Booth and I am the author of Dear the Man Upstairs. When I first began writing Dear the Man Upstairs, I did not know it would become a book. I was sitting in a creative writing class when I was sixteen years old and drafting a single narrative letter because that was what my teacher told me to do. I thought about who my classmates would choose as the recipients of their letters. Like every sixteen-year-old, I wanted to be different. I would not write a letter to a classmate, friend, enemy, or lover (because almost all teenage girls dream of lovers). I wanted to be totally outlandish in my letter and yet safely secured away from ridiculous.

So I thought to myself, “Who is the most out-there person someone could write a letter to? Who will no one else think to have as their recipient?” The answer came in a startling epiphany, “God.”

I grew up in a religious Jewish household. My father is a Rabbi and my mother is an educator of Judaism. God and related questions are often at the forefront of my mind, which is why I thought of a divine power so quickly as a recipient for my letter.

Once I had who was being written to, I needed to find out who was writing. As a child, I struggled with the many euphemisms for God. It was inconceivable to me that one being had so many names. So in one way to be funny, and in another way to make the work not explicitly religious, I decided that the writer of the letter was a child. She addressed the letter to “The Man Upstairs,” unaware of what exactly the name represents. It was just someone she’d heard her grandmother talk about a lot.

The letter took form then. She’s a fourth-grader (a grade I remember clearly, different (she gets scared of loud noises easily, like I did back in the day,) and she’s so unapologetically vibrant the people around her sometimes need to shield their eyes.

She’s curious in that first letter, asking questions to a stranger and hoping someone can make order of her chaotic world. When I shared it in class, my seatmate said, “You have to write more.”

So I kept writing and writing. I thought about what people often consider an ideal child: an extroverted, athletic, intelligent, empathetic, disciplined, and obedient angel. (No one really has children like this.)

The main character, in her own ways, has these attributes. Miss W. (that’s the name she calls herself in her letters with “The Man Upstairs” because he’s a stranger and she knows better than to give strangers her full name) is friendly, bright, and loving to those in her life. She is athletic and has discipline when it suits her. Miss W. also has a hard time sitting still, dealing with things that are uncomfortable for her, and understanding social norms. She sees a psychologist to help her develop strategies for a challenging world. Miss W. is hard to be around sometimes. Even if she is not what many people would consider an “ideal child,” she, to me, is still happy and healthy.

After I wrote a few letters, someone began to write my main character back.

The genre of this epistolary novel is young adult, but truthfully I believe it has broad appeal to anyone in a family. Mothers, daughters, fathers, grandfathers, and especially grandmothers will see themselves in some of the characters. My hope is that, in reading this book, you discover that even if you and your children are not always as extroverted, friendly, athletic, empathetic, intelligent, and successful as you’d like yourself and/or them to be, you and they are still beautiful and worthwhile.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

 

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:

 

  • The editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in August 2021.
  • The cover design of my book. (The mockups you see currently are a placeholder!)
  • The layout design for the interior of my book (physical copy, ebook formats).
  • The copy editing for my book to polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication.
  • The launch & promotion efforts for my book when I ultimately publish this in August of 2021.


When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish a paperback and ebook. When I pre-sell 150 copies of my book, I will also publish a hardcover edition. When I pre-sell 200 copies of my book, I will publish a hardcover and an audiobook. When buying a book, make sure to write the country in the shipping information as "United States." 




I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:

  • You will receive a personally signed copy of my book once it is published.
  • You will receive early access to the Author’s Note and other excerpts from my book, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback.
  • You will have the opportunity to be involved in selecting my cover art.
  • You will be invited to join my Author Community and get behind-the-scenes sneak peeks into the publishing process.
  • You will have my immense gratitude!
  • And more!

 

About the Author

 

Maytal Booth is a sophomore at Vanderbilt University. She spent her formative years as an elementary school student shamelessly plagiarizing Disney movies to create short stories about Jewish princesses. Although she is studying medicine because she understands it is challenging to support herself as a writer, Maytal is doing her best to pursue her dream of being a published author. She knows, “you miss every shot you don’t take, and make every shot you don’t miss”. She wrote this story based on her experience as a child and teacher of third through sixth-grade children. Many children are labeled as "problem-kids" simply because they cannot sit still, and this is a manner of thinking Maytal hopes to change with her book. In her free time, Maytal enjoys baking, reading, going on long walks and sleeping in.

For more information, you can connect with Maytal Booth at maytal.w.booth@gmail.com and at her author page.

 

International Preorders

For international preorders, please send me a private message.

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by including the cost of mailing and shipping the signed copies into each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we ship the pre-order rewards to you as early as possible. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as to when my book will publish. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.
 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:
  • Please share my pre-sale campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network.
  • Please use #Dear The Man Upstairs and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press, so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page.
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it via text or direct message on social media.

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support! I couldn’t do this without you!

Thanks again,

Maytal Booth

story:
Vita Kränkta Kvinnor - EN BOK!

I många år har identitetsvänstern dominerat debatten genom hyckleri och mobbning av oliktänkande. Nu har debattklimatet blivit lite bättre men det är viktigt att minnas annars lär man sig inget av historien och det är just därför den här boken är så viktig. 

Tanken är att samla all galenskap vi blivit utsatta för under många år i en och samma bok, en bok som passar väldigt bra i bokhyllan. Att ge både skratt och tårar. 

Vänstern hade facebooksidan Vita Kränkta Män som senare blivit en bok, nu är det vår tur :)

Målet är att få ut boken i butikerna lagom till den 8:e mars 2020

Mer om innehållet:

Likt på Facebooksidan blir det lite gott & blandat, inte endast "vita kränkta kvinnor" som lyfts fram i ljuset utan alla möjliga hycklare och översittare på vänsterkanten. Upphovsrättslagar kommer följas vilket betyder att innehåller kommer vara inom ramen för citaträtten. Ett bokförlag som är villigt att publicera finns, nu måste bara trycket finansieras.
story_txt: Vita Kränkta Kvinnor - EN BOK!I många år har identitetsvänstern dominerat debatten genom hyckleri och mobbning av oliktänkande. Nu har debattklimatet blivit lite bättre men det är viktigt att minnas annars lär man sig inget av historien och det är just därför den här boken är så viktig. Tanken är att samla all galenskap vi blivit utsatta för under många år i en och samma bok, en bok som passar väldigt bra i bokhyllan. Att ge både skratt och tårar. Vänstern hade facebooksidan Vita Kränkta Män som senare blivit en bok, nu är det vår tur :)Målet är att få ut boken i butikerna lagom till den 8:e mars 2020Mer om innehållet:Likt på Facebooksidan blir det lite gott & blandat, inte endast "vita kränkta kvinnor" som lyfts fram i ljuset utan alla möjliga hycklare och översittare på vänsterkanten. story:
OVERVIEW 

The Sensational Wonder Women coloring book was born out of my desire to inspire and empower women. After a traumatic heartbreak, art became my path for healing and self-awareness. I now want to use art to support women in their healing by helping them find joy, relaxation, and purpose through coloring.

 

DEDICATION

This campaign is dedicated to women who have gone through emotional and/or traumatic experiences. I know first-hand what it is like to suffer from despair, feel depressed, and be hopeless. My wish is to bring light and hope to women by inspiring them to look within to find peace and meaning. Coloring helps facilitate this process as people often become more self-aware while experiencing creative moments.

We are witnessing very painful and emotional times in the world. I want to be able to provide moments of joy where women can shift their thoughts from negative to positive through creativity. 

The Sensational Wonder Women coloring book does this by celebrating and honoring powerful, diverse women. It was created with the intention of supporting women to get in touch with their creative senses and achieve a heightened level of happiness and self-fulfillment.

 

Sensational Wonder Women is a:

  • 38-page coloring book printed on quality paper, 8.5 x 11 inches, wire coil bound.
  • Includes 30 stunning illustrations of women, originally hand-drawn and recreated in a digital format to present you with a clean, graphic feel, just perfect for coloring.
  • Encouraging words woven into the hair of many of the illustrations, stating an affirmation or positive message.
  • Designs range in complexity, from simple to intricate.
  • Illustrations printed on one side only so there is no chance of color blotting.
  • Pages are perforated for easy removal for framing.
  • Appropriate for ages middle school to adult.

 

 

MY STORY

My name is Claudia Marulanda, and I am a visual artist. I started my career as a graphic designer, then jumped into entrepreneurship. During this time, I had also begun to develop my art. Now, I am on the path of combining these two passions to make a successful art business.

 

How did I come up with the idea for this coloring book?

Although art has been my number one love since I was a child, my true creative and artistic expression surfaced following a painful experience I went through in 2012. As a result, my life took a turn and it led me to be here with you, sharing this magnificent book.

 

 

WHY CONTRIBUTE?

If you are reading this far down on the page, chances are you are intrigued by my project, which is wonderful. So, here is the bottom line - I need your support. Plain and simple.

 

It is my hope and prayer to inspire, encourage, and empower women. To do this, I need your help in funding this project. The funding will be used to print and distribute this beautiful and powerful coloring book for women to start enjoying it and begin healing.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP?

Please help me spread this message with others. It will mean the world to me if you share this my coloring book with anyone else that you think would love it too.

Indiegogo has great sharing tools! I would love for you to use one or all of them!

 

 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

The content for this book is finished and I have done as much as possible to mitigate the risks involved in shipping it to you. All I need to do is get the book proofed, printed, and delivered to you. There will be no delay between the end of this campaign and the beginning of the printing process. I am using a professional fulfillment partner with a solid and long-standing track record.

 

I am extremely passionate about this project and having you enjoy it means a lot to me. That means delivering the highest quality product to you in a timely fashion, safe and sound.

 

I am very transparent, communicative, and always available. If any issues were to arise, I will immediately post updates to inform everyone. You may also post a comment here or email
claudia@marulandaart.com if you have any questions or concerns.

 

Thank you, Thank you!

I truly appreciate your time and support in finding the best donation level for you. I am so excited about this campaign. It will run until August 21st and I will keep you updated every step of the way.

 

Thank you again. Enjoy this amazing book!

story:
I'm Cassy Fry - writer, poet, blogger, speaker and quirky literary romantic who feels all her feelings and writes them all down. I've already published two books of visual poetry (also crowdfunded and indie published) and this will be my first collection of written poetry. 

'this isn't romance' is a bittersweet collection of poetry about love, lust, romance and infatuation. 

The story so far...

I fell in love. I got my heart broken. It triggered my PTSD, unleashing a backlog of repressed romantic traumas. I wrote a shitload of love poems - some sad and cynical, some sweet and hopeful. I posted them on the internet (because that is what I do) and people liked them. I gathered each tiny heartbreak, every single repeated rejection and resolution and made them into something new - a book of poetry. 

There are three sections: Falling (the fun bit), Landing (the painful bit) and Soothing (the recovery bit).

The work included combines the micro-poetry and my longer poems and spoken word, some you will recognise from my social media shares and other poems are brand new and unseen.

The book is already written, in the final stage of edits/formatting and is almost ready to publish. I just don't have any money to order printed copies - so I'm launching this campaign to fund getting a big batch printed. So basically, by pledging you romantically inclined readers can pre-order your copy of the book.  

See/hear the poems...

I will be reading some of the poems on Periscope and sharing snaps of the shorter ones on Instagram and Twitter @CassyFry #thisisntromance and you can find a few of the longer ones on soundcloud.com/cassy-fry or my blog cassyfry.com. 

I also have a Patreon page patreon.com/cassyfry - if you are already a patron, or if you sign up as one, you'll have access to the PDF version of the book when it is published as well as other exclusive work and updates as things progress.  

Thank you for reading. If you can't pledge, but want to support me, please share this with your poetry loving and romantically challenged friends.

story:
CHILDREN'S BOOK SUMMARY

Ella B. Jenkins, a curious, smart, and vibrant young girl, takes a trip with her family to march for racial justice and against systemic oppression. When a chance encounter leads her to meeting Vice President Kamala Harris, Ella has an experience that will forever shape how she sees herself and her potential for creating social change.  

The ELLA B. JENKINS DOLL can also accompany, comfort and inspire young readers as they embark on their very own adventures.

 

MEET THE TEAM

Eve Lynne Robinson | Author

Eve is an Oakland based artist and holistic healing entrepreneur.

Finding inspiration from all around, Eve Lynne spends her time creating ceramics, illustrations and other mixed media forms. Having grown up in Los Angeles, many of her art reflects her passion for urban culture and the multitude of traditions and experiences that surround her day-to-day. For years she has thrived making art in her home studio, creating personal pieces that integrate a hybrid aesthetic intended to amplify the voices of the underrepresented, collaborations with local activists and motivators of social change, and cathartic community resilience.

Eve Lynne continues to create pieces of art that further reflect the intention of creative therapeutic release and healing and inspire others with the lasting benefits that accompany creative art expression within a multi-culturally rich and diverse atmosphere.

 

Richard Montgomery | Filmmaker

Richard Montgomery is an award-winning filmmaker that provides creative services support for Team Ella B. Jenkins. He has been involved in producing culturally significant projects including documentaries for the 30th Anniversary of the Rev. Martin Luther’s Kings March on Washington and the first Million Man March. Richard also develops award-winning promotional materials and marketing campaigns for clients like the Smithsonian Institute, the NAACP, and numerous other national branding campaigns for private business and federal government agencies. The Hampton University and Howard University alumni currently resides in the Washington, DC area. Richard also makes a special appearance in the book when he provides a car service for Ella when she visits Washington, DC!

 

 

Whitney Jade Gordy | Co-Author

Whitney is a Los Angeles-based Licensed Marriage and Family Therapist (LMFT) and trained art therapist. Whitney received her BA in studio arts and MA in Marriage and Family therapy with an emphasis in Clinical Art Therapy from Loyola Marymount University. She spends her time split between working in community-based mental health in central Los Angeles and illustrating, painting, and writing short stories. Her surrounding community feeds her passion for holistic methods of self-expression, trauma-informed healing, and self-care.

 

Serita Braxton | Campaign Manager 

Serita is a professional writer and published author from Maryland based in Spain. Her wanderlust carries her all over the globe where she writes for various publications. Serita is also the founder of Monita Tequila, a Black female-owned tequila brand. She's lending her vast talents and network in the world of publishing and business to help this campaign be the best it can be.  

 

Jesse Byrd | Campaign Lead

Jesse is an award-winning children's book editor and writer from Oakland, CA whose family has been in publishing for over 31 years with New York Times Bestselling books to their credit.

 

WHAT WE NEED & WHAT YOU GET

 

This $10K will help us produce books and other items at a healthy enough volume that we can be sustainable and continue to create diverse products like this one, in the future.

The money raised will be used in the manner below:

40% | Developing + Printing the first-edition print of Ella B. Jenkins Meets Vice President Kamala Harris

60% | Funding "Ella B. Jenkins" virtual storytime reading, wallet, beanie, and plush doll.

 

THE IMPACT


AUTHENTIC DIVERSITY: According to the Children's Book Diversity Council, less than 10% of children's books in 2018 featured a Black person as the main character. And, half of the books featuring Black characters as leads are not written by Black people. Making matters worse, there are 3x as many books published featuring animals in the U.S. than those centering Black, Latinx, Asian, Native American and African children COMBINED! Let's help to change this. 

A HARMFUL MYTH in the publishing world is that people just don't dig into their pockets to support creators of color in a real way that'll justify printing and publishing their works on a large scale.

Let's prove them wrong and show that diverse books of all kinds deserve a place on the shelf.

 

GOALS & CHALLENGES

 

Traditional Publishing: Our #1 goal for this book is to prove its worth in financial and community support to win a traditional publisher. We want every kid to have easy access to this story nationwide. The best way we can do this is by making a big enough "splash" during this campaign so publishers are willing to give this picture book an honest look.

Being Evergreen: It is critical that we build a true and lasting community to expand the lifespan of this work. Any referrals for storytime readings (virtual now, and later, in-person) plus book purchases for schools, libraries, and organizations will be incredibly helpful!

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP BESIDES $$$

Every purchase, referral, and mention amongst your network truly matters. In addition to fueling this mission financially, please help us out by sharing the word amongst your social and personal circles! We're more effective together and need your help.

Sincerely,

The Ella B. Jenkins Support Team

Follow the Campaign on Social Media!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Hans Manzke, and I am the author of Democratizing Big Ideas. I wrote this book because I want to level the playing field with regard to the big ideas, frameworks, mental models, and insights that make the best leaders and humans so great. We all deserve equal access to what the world’s best thinkers have to offer, no matter our background, age, or profession, and we deserve it now.

My hope is that, in reading this book, you will discover that you don’t need to spend 15 years at a job accruing knowledge and research to tap into the world of big ideas. With this book, I hope to instill in you the same sort of passion and excitement that I have for big ideas and reveal how they help us grow. Ultimately, I want you to see this book as a tool to help you land your dream job, make a big life change you feel unable to access, or learn about yourself and those around you more deeply and profoundly.

In this book, you'll learn about big ideas that shift how the world thinks about itself and how we exist in it, as well as how each of us can:

  • Tune in to mindsets and approaches that supercharge critical thinking and identify and minimize mindsets that discourage critical thinking
  • Learn about the most valuable ideas, concepts, mindsets, frameworks, and insights that leaders from around the world would gift to their younger selves if they could go back in time
  • Push your own thinking and learning to new levels via compelling stories, data, and analysis

You will love this book if you want to begin or continue your own self-awareness journey or are looking for a supercharging force to help you achieve your full potential.

Democratizing Big Ideas is a non-fiction book that speaks to the brilliant and underprivileged, the young and ambitious, and established leaders who are looking to authentically access the next version of themselves and more deeply understanding their teams and environment through the lens of big ideas.

What I Need & What You Get

I’m proud to publish my book with New Degree Press. I’ve created a pre-order structure with different tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. All money raised will go directly toward the following:

  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December 2020
  • The Cover Design of my book - the mockups you see currently are placeholders!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for my book - to help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication
  • The Launch & Promotion Efforts for my book - when I ultimately publish this Winter
When I pre-sell 120 copies of my book, I will publish. Since I was a young boy, I’ve dreamed of writing my own book, and now I need your help to make that dream a reality.

I am also offering some exclusive rewards for people who pre-order my book now:
  • A personally signed copy of my book when I publish
  • A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
  • Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
  • Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book

About the Author

Hans Manzke is a Principal at The Clearing, a small Washington, DC management consulting firm that focuses on partnerships that unlock real transformation. The company believes in, inspires, and outfits leaders to have meaningful lives and to make extraordinary contributions to causes that matter.

Hans has always been a seeker — a constant asker of “why” questions. He has turned that energy to exploring how big ideas can effect us for the good, especially through the lens of access and equity. The world’s best thinkers have much to share with us, and if we listen, our full potential and more happiness at work and in life await.

For more information you can connect with Hans at hans.manzke@theclearing.com and on LinkedIn and Instagram.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is finishing and delivering the completed book to the backer. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier. This means that your support guarantees you a copy of my book, mailed to your best address.

I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone on the road to publication. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter with your friends, family and network. Please use #BigIdeasForAll and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so they can help amplify our efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. All this takes is a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you for all of your love and support.

Hans

A personal, handwritten thank you note for pre-ordering my book
Your name will appear in a Special Acknowledgements section of my book (“with Special Thanks to”)
Early access to the Introduction of my Book and some additional sections of my manuscript, with the opportunity to review it and give me early feedback
The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
A book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book


About the Author
Hans Manzke is a Principal at The Clearing, a small Washington, DC management consulting firm that focuses on partnerships that unlock real transformation. The company believes in, inspires, and outfits leaders to have meaningful lives and to make extraordinary contributions to causes that matter.Hans has always been a seeker — a constant asker of “why” questions. He has turned that energy to exploring how big ideas can effect us for the good, especially through the lens of access and equity. The world’s best thinkers have much to share with us, and if we listen, our full potential and more happiness at work and in life await.For more information you can connect with Hans at hans.manzke@theclearing.com and on LinkedIn and Instagram.

Risks & Challenges
The biggest challenge with publishing a book is finishing and delivering the completed book to the backer. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier. This means that your support guarantees you a copy of my book, mailed to your best address.I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone on the road to publication. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people can't contribute financially, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, and Twitter with your friends, family and network. Please use #BigIdeasForAll and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so they can help amplify our efforts.
You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
Please share my book with 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. All this takes is a text message or Direct Message on social media.

Thank you for all of your love and support.Hans

Update! I successfully funded the production and print of Dream Machine at the end of 2020. 

 

Welcome to my Dream Machine pre-order campaign!

My name is Lizz Larouge and I am a poet, artist and seer.

For the past 10 years I have been writing poetry. What I consider to be downloads from soul and spirit. Over the past year I have carefully compiled a selection of my poems into a book which I have titled 'Dream Machine'. This project is self-published and comes direct to you from my heart. I have collaborated with one of my best friends, visionary artist Christina Mikelis who has brought my words to life in art form through her beautiful illustrations.

As co-founder of global community Colours of Love, I have been privileged to witness hundreds of people speak their dream and manifest it into reality. I stand before you today (virtually!) to activate my dream; To bring my poetry book Dream Machine into reality.

By supporting my dream, pre-ordering the Dream Machine book and goodies, your contribution goes directly to paying the artist, the local business printing my book and all the other exciting limited edition items available to you. 

Why do I need your help?

I am self-publishing this book. This means I front the costs of printing, of design, of production, of everything around the book. I also do the promotions, the marketing and distribution myself.

I have managed to eliminate or reduce a lot of costs, having people I know support me with the proofreading and the editing, doing all the video content and promotional graphics and social media etc myself and making clear and conscious choices where the budget is going.

However, there are still thousands of pounds needed to get a coffee-table-worthy work of art like this off the ground. As an artist and self-employed businesswoman, this project would be hard to make a reality without the support of my global community. YOU!

I have a target to reach of £6517.  Your contribution goes directly to paying the illustrative artist and the local small business printing my book plus all the other exciting limited edition items available to you. 

This campaign is a huge ticket of trust and belief in myself and my gifts. So let me give you the details of the book and how you can be involved!

The book is printed on recycled paper and is available in Softcover and Hardback with a silver foil cover finish. The hardback edition is hand-sewn by local artisan book binders (I will document this process to share with you!) All books are signed by me and include a fold-out A2 poster featuring a brand new poem and art not included in the book itself. Each supporter will be personally thanked by me in print, in the Thankyou section of the book. Each supporter will be sent a mix I have created especially in celebration of Dream Machine. Each supporter will be invited to join me at the conclusion of my campaign for a virtual ‘wrap party’ so I can thank each and every one of you in person (virtually!)

The additional printed items - also limited edition - all feature the poetry and art of Dream Machine.  I have created a 'Dreamy Bundle Set' for both the hardback and softcover - This is perfect option for all you Dream Machines out there and is jam packed with goodies including;

  • Set of 5 Dream Machine Postcards (limited edition)

  • Dream Machine Affirmation Cards (Luxe box set of 24 cards plus booklet)

  • Dream Machine Journal (limited edition)

  • Dream Machine Sticker Packs (limited edition)

  • Dream Machine A4 Prints (limited edition)

 

You can buy the Dreamy Bundle feat. all of these items I have created especially for this campaign to help me reach my goal. BTW, the book has been discounted even further in the Dreamy Bundle. Alternatively, you can add items to your book purchase at checkout to curate your own set.

Also available to purchase;

  • Dream Machine spoken word Vinyl Album produced and spoken by me

  • Dream Machine Audio Recording produced and spoken by me​

 

In addition to this you will be able to support me with higher tiers of funding to access;

 

  • 1:1 Soul Sessions with me

  • Bespoke Handwritten unique poem from me to you (also a great gift idea!)

  • Angelic Dream Machine Tier 

 

The Impact

The impact of succeeding with my fundraising target through pre-sales for Dream Machine is a huge breakthrough in my belief in myself and my place in the world as an artist. If through being vulnerable and standing in my power and in my truth, as Lizz Larouge I inspire others to do the same, that is the greatest gift of all. 

My dear friend Ricki Lake sums it up perfectly in the foreword of Dream Machine, so I have  an excerpt here for you to preview;

“Now, more than ever before, in these times of change and uncertainty, the power of the arts and the platform they provide for self-expression enable potent, powerful messages to be shared, enabling us to connect deeply as a conscious collective, rising up to support, uplift and inspire one another. Thank you Lizz for sharing your beautiful heart and soul with the world, I am honoured to be part of this creation.” - Ricki Lake

 

Risks & Challenges

The only risk was in not believing in myself and making this book. The challenge is in staying true to my vision and holding my nerve throughout this 30-day journey! 

 

Ways You Can Help

Financial

The primary support you can offer to make this book a reality is to pre-order the Dreamy Bundle or a copy of the book and to share the campaign as far and wide as you can. (maybe buy extra copies for friends!)

You can choose one of the higher rewards, from the 1:1 soul session to the Bespoke Poem to the Angelic Tier, The higher-level reward you can support the quicker I can get Dream Machine into your hands.

Promotional

Do you work in media? Radio? Podcast? Will you run a review or story of my book? I will send you a digital copy to review in return for some support in sharing this campaign and getting the word out further.

Not in media but want to spread the word? Please share my work, share my posts and my IGTV's and Stories, share this campaign on as many social media channels as you can. Encourage friends to get a copy!

Industry, Distribution and Publication

Perhaps you are experienced in organising virtual book tours, readings, reviewers, award submissions etc. I would LOVE to speak to you if you think my book is suitable for your particular work, or if you have any support you can offer.

However you can support this project, I thank you. I am in deep gratitude for all the support I have received already.

Lizz x

story:
Hello, we’re Jonas (writer) and Sage (publisher/Sweet Candy Press). We want to tell you about Jonas’s book, The Greatest Most Traveling Circus. It is set to be released in March 2014 by Sweet Candy Press. It will be Jonas’s debut book and Sweet Candy Press’s fourth title.

The Greatest Most Traveling Circus is an anthology of stories about vampires and superheroes, gypsy curses, giant killer robots, psychics, love potions, bar fights over stolen angel wings, imaginary monsters, magical traveling pants and the devil as a red-headed con man. But it’s also a novel about overcoming depression, struggling with suicide, handling loss, and trying to find meaning in a world where the supernatural isn’t the hardest part of life to accept. Above all, it’s about finding friendship when it is least expected--but most needed.

This is the first volume of a two-part story that would later continue as the less surreal, more auto-biographical zine Cheer the Eff Up.


About Sweet Candy Press:

Sweet Candy Press is run by Sage Adderley in Olympia,Washington. Sage has been running Sweet Candy Distro for over nine years, and recently decided to take a leap into small publishing. She is no stranger to the hard work and determination it takes to pull off this exciting venture.

In August 2013, the press released their first title, Heavy Hangs the Head by Taryn Hipp and is currently planning the release of their second title, Everybody Else’s Girl by Sarah Sawyers-Lovett.

Sweet Candy Press uses a local family-owned printing company that has been going strong for thirty-seven years.

Why do I want to support Jonas?

Jonas’s writing is that of a creative old soul. His voice is distinct and raw in the most beautiful way that raw writing can be presented. His characters dance through their life events emitting words that leave us all pondering and questioning. He makes readers feel. He makes us think. Jonas serves a platter of hectic issues, but feeds it to us gently, allowing us to carefully digest each bite.

The funds raised will go towards the printing of The Greatest Most Traveling Circus. We are hoping to raise $2,000 to print 500–600 copies of the book.

Jonas has put together a wonderful variety of perks that include postcards, Cheer the Eff Up zines, copies of The Greatest Most Traveling Circus, personalized zines, lifetime subscriptions, AND oil paintings!

Thanks in advance for checking out our creative project. We are grateful for your support and encouragement.

story:
Writing and publishing my book has always been my dream. I've finished my first book Silenced and it's ready for the next step. I chose to self publish my work and this means all funds for my book comes out of pocket. This can become costly. As an example: Professional Editor, graphic artist, bookmarks, etc.

 

How can you tell I'm serious? Well, check out my blog. I've been writing it for over a year and I've written posts on my journey with writing a book. Here's the link: http://raebethmcgeeswriting.blogspot.com/

Not only have I talked about my work on there but the main part of the blog is to help other authors with their work by providing features of them, interviews, and reviews of their work. This is my way of giving back to the writing community.


After my manuscript has been completely edited I'll be ready for publication and promotion. With any business it's always easier to promote the works when one has various items.


Therefore, your donation will help me provide various types of printed material to help promote my book and the editing. The types of printed materials I have in mind are bookmarks, magnets, tote bags, pens, etc.


Feel free to contact me with any questions you have. I'll answer them to the best of my ability.

Please help me make my dream... reality!

story:
Short Summary

I discovered my love for writing at an early age and can count as a distant relative Richard Henry Dana who wrote the seafaring narrative Two Years Before the Mast.  Born with a condition of Cerebral Palsy, I have found that writing enables me to rise above obstacles that I face.  Beyond personal aspirations, I aim to inspire, encourage, and empower others with the message that they can reach their dreams.

My project is divided into three stages:  website development, book publishing, and product development.  This initial first stage is the development of a website (now in draft status)  providing encouragement to others to see beyond the constraints of what is, and moving forward to what can be.  Incorporated in the website will be my blog (Kuhn’s Chronicles) and pages of personal and inspirational interest.

What I Need

The total of $720 I’m setting as a goal of this campaign reflects the hosting site costs for three years of a website that allows for greater content, reader interaction, and e-commerce.  In the event this goal is not reached, any resources received will go towards funding the hosting service for a lesser time. 

The Impact

Along this project journey I hope that my personal story creates a ripple effect encouraging others that success is best realized when used for the benefit of others.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t contribute, you certainly can still help.   Please pass the word about this campaign site by email, Facebook, Twitter or word of mouth.

story:
Who Am I?

Hello, friends! I am Vera Nazarian, writer, artist, creator of wonder, two-time Nebula Award Nominee.

You might know me as the author of the humorous mash-up parody Mansfield Park and Mummies, the first novel of my Supernatural Jane Austen Series. Or maybe you’ve run into one of my inspirational quotes that are all over the internet, originally posted on my creativity blog Inspired.Us and recently collected in The Perpetual Calendar of Inspiration.

Maybe you’re a fan of my arabesque “collage” novel Dreams of the Compass Rose, or the cult classic epic fantasy Lords of Rainbow about an unrequited love in a world without color (yes, it’s the original “fifty shades of grey,” literally).

Yet again, you might remember me for the strange mythic stories in Marion Zimmer Bradley’s Sword and Sorceress anthologies. Or possibly, you’ve read my snarky pop culture essays on various TV shows and entertainment subjects such as True Blood, The Vampire Diaries, and Charmed, in various Smart Pop anthologies.

It doesn’t matter! We’ve probably “met” already, in one way or another. Now, let me share my project with you.


 

Cobweb Empire is Calling You!

You are here because you genuinely loved Cobweb Bride, book one of the Cobweb Bride Trilogy, my first new major novel in a decade, written and published with the help of another successful crowdfunding campaign.

It is an intricate epic fantasy flavored by Renaissance history and the romantic myth of Persephone and Hades in the Underworld, about death’s ultimatum to the world.

See the official Cobweb Bride website for more description of this compelling book.

So you’ve read the first book of the trilogy, went a little crazy—in a good way—and now you are dying to find out what happens next!  What will Percy do?

Well, get ready—in Cobweb Empire the stakes are now twice as high! In a world where all death and dying has ceased, and only one person can kill, everyone can only expect a miracle. But what if it’s just the tip of the iceberg?

Empires clash, kings and emperors and gods vie for supremacy, the living and the dead are at war, while love stories play out in amazing directions, and new mysteries are born to blow your mind.

A new dark witch rises, and she will make your heart freeze with her beauty and power….

I am currently in the middle of writing book two, Cobweb Empire, and I cannot wait to share it with you!

If you liked the first book, I promise you will love this one! And if you loved the first book, you will be blown away.


What's Needed & What You Get

Cobweb Empire is scheduled for release on September 25, 2013, and I am sprinting to finish it in time. But all my resources are short! I desperately need your help!

In order for this second book to be as professionally presented, edited and packaged and promoted, I urgently need to raise $3,000.

Your money will go toward:

  • Writing and office expenses
  • Copyediting
  • Editing
  • Final Cover design
  • Review Copies
  • Business Software monthly maintenance subscription
  • Promotional and advertizing expenses.

The reward structure is very simple—for anyone who contributes at least $5, you will receive a copy of the finished ebook edition of Cobweb Empire in any ebook format of your choice. That’s a $1 savings off the retail price.

In addition, all contributors will be variously acknowledged inside the book!

  • $5 – Supporter
  • $10 – Patron
  • $25 and above – Benefactor

No need to contribute a huge amount, just $5 or a little above will do. But of course if you really want to be generous in any amount, I can only kiss you!

So that’s the fundraiser!

Short and sweet!


The Impact

Simply put, this will help me bring the book to you as fast as possible, in the most professional package.

It takes time and resources and sweat and basic work hours to make a book.

I am a full-time writer and publisher, and this is my day job.

Everyone needs to get paid for their work, whether you are a factory worker, business person, an entertainer, a computer programmer, a librarian, an accountant, a musician, a food industry worker, a contractor, a doctor, an artist, a teacher, a janitor, or a writer.

Please help me help you start reading Cobweb Empire as soon as possible!


Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough for everyone, and if you are unable to contribute with even a few bucks (believe me, I understand!), you can still help immensely, by spreading the word!

Tweet this campaign, post it on Facebook, Google+, LinkedIn, Goodreads, or your blog, and just make some good noise! For your convenience, be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.

Thank you from the bottom of my heart, on behalf of myself and the hungry cats!

culture essays on various TV shows and entertainment subjects such as
True Blood, The Vampire Diaries, and Charmed, in
various Smart Pop anthologies. 

It doesn’t matter! We’ve probably
“met” already, in one way or another.  Now, let me share my
project with you.

  


Cobweb Empire is Calling You!




You are here because you genuinely loved Cobweb Bride, book one of the
Cobweb Bride Trilogy, my first new major novel in a decade, written and published with the help of another successful crowdfunding campaign.
 It is an intricate
epic fantasy flavored by Renaissance history and the romantic myth of
Persephone and Hades in the Underworld, about death’s ultimatum to the world.
See the official
Cobweb Bride website for more description of this compelling book.
So you’ve read the first book of the trilogy, went a little
crazy—in a good way—and now you are dying to find out what happens next!  What
will Percy do?

Well, get ready—in Cobweb Empire the stakes are now
twice as high! In a world where all death and dying has ceased, and only one
person can kill, everyone can only expect a miracle. But what if it’s just
the tip of the iceberg?
Empires clash, kings and emperors and gods vie for
supremacy, the living and the dead are at war, while love stories play out in
amazing directions, and new mysteries are born to blow your mind.
A new dark witch rises, and she will make your heart freeze
with her beauty and power…. 
I am currently in the middle of writing book two, Cobweb
Empire, and I cannot wait to share it with you! 
If you liked the
first book, I promise you will love this one! And if you loved the first
book, you will be blown away.

What's Needed & What You Get

Cobweb Empire is scheduled for release on September
25, 2013, and I am sprinting to finish it in time. But all my resources are short! I desperately need your help! 
In
order for this second book to be as professionally presented, edited and
packaged and promoted, I urgently need to raise $3,000.
Your money will go toward:

Writing and office expenses

Copyediting

Editing
Final Cover design
Review Copies
Business Software monthly maintenance subscription

Promotional and advertizing expenses.

The reward structure is very simple—for anyone who
contributes at least $5, you will receive a copy of the finished
ebook edition of Cobweb Empire in any ebook format of your choice.
That’s a $1 savings off the retail price.
In addition, all contributors will be variously acknowledged
inside the book!

$5 – Supporter
$10 – Patron
$25 and above – Benefactor

No need to contribute a huge amount, just $5 or a little
above will do. But of course if you really want to be generous in any amount, I
can only kiss you!
So that’s the fundraiser!
Short and sweet!

The Impact
Simply put, this will help me
bring the book to you as fast as possible, in the most professional
package.
It takes time and resources and sweat and basic work hours to make a book.
I am a full-time writer and publisher, and this is my day job.
Everyone needs to get paid for their
work, whether you are a factory worker, business person, an entertainer, a
computer programmer, a librarian, an accountant, a musician, a food industry worker, a contractor, a doctor, an artist, a teacher, a janitor, or a
writer.
Please help me help you start reading Cobweb Empire as soon as possible!
Other Ways You Can Help
Times are tough for everyone, and if you are unable to contribute with even a few bucks (believe me, I understand!), you can still help immensely, by spreading the word! 
Tweet this campaign, post it on Facebook, Google+, LinkedIn, Goodreads, or your blog, and just make some good noise! For your convenience, be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that’s all there is to it.
Thank you from the bottom of my heart, on behalf of myself
and the hungry cats!

story:
Year's Best Weird Fiction

Laird Barron will be editing the inaugural volume of the Year’s Best Weird Fiction for Undertow Publications.

Barron is one of finest practitioners of the weird tale. His work has been nominated for several awards, and has been reprinted in numerous “Year’s Best” anthologies.

Undertow Publications is home to the acclaimed weird journal Shadows & Tall Trees. Our first publication, Apparitions, was a Shirley Jackson Award Finalist.

 

 

 

The publishing landscape has changed. The big publishers mostly still view weird fiction as a strange and esoteric thing. In short, it isn’t seen as a viable commercial opportunity.  But we think there is a need for such a volume. That is why we are appealing to you to help fund this and future volumes of the Year’s Best Weird Fiction. All the funds will be used to pay the editor, the contributors, the designers, typesetter, printing, shipping, etc. Your money will help support what we hope will be an annual and vital volume of the best weird fiction.

Each volume of the Year’s Best Weird Fiction will feature a different editor. Weird fiction is a diverse and eclectic mode of literature, and we are excited to see varying viewpoints. In fact, we are confident that the volume will see little if any overlap with the various other “Best Of” anthologies. And we could think of no one better than Laird Barron to helm the inaugural volume.

Along with up to 100,000 words of the finest strange fiction from the previous year, each volume will include an introduction from the editor, a year in review column, and a short list of other notable stories. If we reach our funding goal, the book will be available in trade-paperback format and as DRM-free ePub and Mobi eBooks. The Year’s Best Weird Fiction, Volume 1, is slated for publication in late summer/early fall of 2014.

Crowd-funding a book is akin to pre-ordering that book. However, we do hope you’ll take advantage of some of our other great perks and rewards. We’re really excited about the Year’s Best Weird Fiction, and hope you’ll support its publication. We can’t make this happen without you.

So … welcome to the Year’s Best Weird Fiction.

What is weird fiction?

The simple answer is that it is speculative in nature, chiefly derived from pulp fiction in the early 20th century, whose remit includes ghost stories, the strange and macabre, the supernatural, fantasy, myth, philosophical ontology, ambiguity, and featuring a helping of the outré. Weird fiction, at its best, is an intersecting of themes and ideas that explore and subvert the laws of Nature. It counts among its proponents older and newer writers alike: Robert Aickman, Laird Barron, Charles Beaumont, Ambrose Bierce, Octavia Butler, Ray Bradbury, Angela Carter, Neil Gaiman, Shirley Jackson, Kathe Koja, John Langan, Thomas Ligotti, Kelly Link, H. P. Lovecraft, and many others.

Weird fiction is not specifically horror or fantasy. And weird fiction is not new. It has always been present. That’s because it isn’t a genre, as such. This makes the prospect of defining weird fiction difficult, and perhaps ill advised. Weird fiction is a mode of literature that is present in other genres. Weird tales were penned long before publishers codified and attached genre labels to fiction. You can find weird fiction in literary journals, in horror magazines, fantasy and science fiction periodicals, and various other genre and non-genre journals and anthologies that are welcoming to speculative fiction of the fantastique.

 

 

There’s been renewed interest in weird fiction, spurred by the writings of the authors mentioned above, and by the likes of Jeffrey Ford, Elizabeth Hand, Margo Lanagan, China Mieville, Reggie Oliver, Kaaron Warren, and by the publication of anthologies such as American Fantastic Tales, Black Water, Black Wings, The Weird, The Uncanny, Strange Tales; and journals such as Black Static, ChiZine, Shadows & Tall Trees, and Weird Fiction Review.

Weird fiction is here to stay. Once the purview of esoteric readers, it is enjoying wider popularity. Throughout its storied history there has not been a dedicated volume of the year’s best weird writing. There are a host of authors penning weird and strange tales that defy easy categorization. Tales that slip through genre cracks. A yearly anthology of the best of these writings is long overdue.

Submitting material for consideration

This is a reprint fiction anthology. Editor Laird Barron is only seeking material that was first published in 2013.

Publishers only are encouraged to send text files, preferably in Word, to: bestweirdfiction@gmail.com 

Physical material is also acceptable. See address below.

Deadline for all material is January 7, 2014, but sooner (much sooner) is better. Late submissions may not receive proper consideration, especially if we receive a majority of the material at deadline. 

Writers: Please do not send unsolicited material. Urge your publisher to send in any relevant work. Feel free to query with any questions or recommendations.

Please note: Only writers whose work is selected for the volume will be contacted.

Physical submissions of books for consideration, and for the year in review column, can be mailed to:

Year’s Best Weird Fiction, 1905 Faylee Crescent, Pickering ON, L1V 2T3, Canada

FAQ


Who will be editing volume 2 of Year's Best Weird Fiction?

We don't know. We have some ideas. Who would you like to see helm the next volume?

Is that the cover art?

No. But if enough people like it, we may consider it.

Can I buy the book even if I do not donate?

The book will be available through all the major online retailers via Ingram. We are exploring physical distribution, as well, and are confident it will be picked up, but our best chance of success is if you pre-purchase through this fund-raiser. 

Will you still accept funds if you reach your goal?

Yes! Any monies raised above our goal will be used to fund future volumes, and to also help fund volume six of Shadows & Tall Trees.

Do you ship outside the U.S.A.?

Yes! But please add $10 for shipments outside the U.S.A. and Canada.

When will I get my reward?

The Year's Best Weird Fiction, and Shadows & Tall Trees 6, will ship late summer/early fall 2014. If you picked another reward, it will ship in January. Tuckerizations may take some time. You'll be notified when your Tuckerization has been published.

Lastly, you can help us out by spreading the word. Please mention the campaign on your social media sites, blogs, forums, etc. Thank you.

-Michael Kelly

story:
Hi folks. If you're reading this, you probably know me. I'm Colin Dardis, a Northern Irish poet, based in Belfast. I try to do my bit to help out other poets and support their work. Some of you might have heard of a few of the projects I help run:

Purely Poetry open mic night at the Crescent Arts Centre;

FourXFour, a quarterly online journal showcasing Northern Irish poets;

Pen Points Press, a poetry micropress, which will be launching later in the year, with publications from three local poets.

I also run www.poetryni.com which is the central hub for all of these. It also provides an events guide and resource list for all things poetry-related in Northern Ireland.

All of this, I do for free, because I love poetry, and I'm passionate about giving people a platform so that their work can be seen and heard, and most importantly, enjoyed. I don't expect to make any money from it; occasionally I get paid a bit for a workshop or a slam here and there, but mostly, it's all for the love of the game. 

So here's the deal: a few months ago I submitted some poems to the Seamus Heaney Centre for Poetry in Belfast, in order to apply toward their annual Poetry Summer School. Some info about the school is here:

http://www.qub.ac.uk/schools/SeamusHeaneyCentreforPoetry/PoetrySummerSchool2014/

Thankfully, and wonderfully, I've been accepted. There's only 12 spots, so the competition is fierce. However, the summer school doesn't come for free. There's the small matter of £400.

What does £400 quid get? A week of sessions, workshops and one-to-ones with the likes of Sinead Morrissey, Ciaran Carson, Leontia Flynn and others. It's a vital resource to any poet in the land, and not to be sniffed at.

Here's where you come in. Honestly, I can't simply afford the price. Currently, I don't work due to a long-term illness (most of you will probably know that too, as I'm upfront about my depression). I don't want to give you a sob story; I'm just stating my fiscal reality.

So I need YOUR help. Give whatever you can, If you can't give anything, then please get the word out and make some noise about this campaign!

You'll see below the perks and rewards that funders get in return. They sure are pretty, if I say so. So please, pitch in, and in advance, THANK YOU!

-Colin.
