story: We are a group of volunteers in Southwest Florida who are tired of sitting on the sideline while corporations and billionaires decide our fate for us. That is why we must do everything we personally can to get Bernie Sanders elected  as our president, so that we - the regular people can have the representation in our government.  One of the things we are going to be doing is a massive, ongoing Bernie sanders flyer distribution here locally in Southwest Florida. We need to order for print 5000 copies of flyers and would like your help in order to accomplish it. If you are Bernie Sanders supporter and would like to do something to help his campaign - this is your chance to get involved. We are going to do this even if we have to bankroll it ourselves, but we are regular people just like you with bills to pay and would like your help to ease the burden. Even a dollar means a lot to us. So please consider donating and helping us to get Bernie Sanders' message out there.

story:
¿Qué?

Ocurrió en Salem nos traslada a la Nueva Inglaterra puritana de finales del XVII, con sus miedos y sus rígidas normas, en una historia que siembra la incertidumbre de qué es real y qué no lo es... hasta que todo se hace evidente.

Salem, 1692. En este tranquilo pueblo de Nueva Inglaterra, tres jóvenes afirmaron ver a sus vecinas practicando la brujería. Los historiadores nos cuentan que la tortura y la presión social que recibieron les hicieron iniciar una carrera de acusaciones infundadas entre la población. Pero, ¿y si dijeron la verdad? ¿Y si en los oscuros bosques de Salem se escondían brujos susurrando hechizos? ¿Cómo hubiera sido entonces su historia?

Ocurrió en Salem es una novela coral en la que sus personajes se enfrentan a la histeria
y a la persecución por una sociedad puritana. Un libro lleno de historias entrelazadas, engaños y traiciones. Un relato en el que la magia retuerce nuestra visión de la caza de brujas más famosa de la Historia.

¿Quiénes?

Tandaia es una joven editorial con voluntad de cambio, de dar la alternativa a autores que no la encuentran en otro lugar, con nuevas y refrescantes ideas como es el crowdfunding.

De este modo eres tú, ahora que te estás planteando cómo colaborar, el que decide si la obra que te presentamos verá la luz pasando a formar parte de nuestro catálogo... porque consideramos al lector parte fundamental del proceso.

Hoy se nos presenta Alberto Ferrera.

Nací en un pueblo de Extremadura, pero a los 18 años me mudé a Madrid, donde estudio Bioquímica en la Universidad Autónoma. Desde pequeño me ha gustado compaginar la ciencia con la literatura. Los experimentos me permiten descubrir cómo funciona el universo en el que vivimos, mientras que los libros me abren las puertas a mundos imposibles, donde poder escapar de la realidad.

He devorado libros toda mi vida, así que un día decidí devolver al mundo parte de todo lo que la literatura me había dado. Como resultado, he ganado varios certámenes literarios a nivel de instituto, conseguido dos accésits en el concurso Manuel Pacheco tanto de relato como de poesía, y aparecido en la lista de Honor de Plata del premio Jordi Sierra i Fabra para jóvenes.

¿Cómo?

Para arrancar el proyecto nos hemos fijado como objetivo 800€; esta es la cantidad que recaudaríamos si alrededor de cuarenta mecenas se hiciesen, cada cual, con un ejemplar de esta primera edición.

  • Teniendo acceso a las galeradas de edición.
  • Recibiendo un ejemplar semanas antes de la salida al mercado de la obra.
  • Si bien, también podrías ver tu nombre en los agradecimientos aportando un poco más.

Los fondos recaudados, se utilizarán como ayuda para sacar adelante esta primera edición de Ocurrió en Salem que saldría pocas semanas después a la venta.

Además...

Sabemos que son tiempos difíciles, también nosotros los sufrimos, y es posible que no te encuentres en disposición de apoyarnos con tu mecenazgo en estos momentos... pero esperamos que si esto te ha llegado al alma, incluso si tal vez conoces en persona al autor, trates de difundir esta campaña (facebook, twitter, blogger, boca-oreja... ) para que alcancemos nuestra meta y Alberto Ferrera vea publicada su obra.

Gracias por vuestro tiempo.

story:
Thank you so very much in taking the time to read about my campaign.

“What Is LOVE? Kids Have The Answer” is my first book to be published. 

I have been working on this book for a few years and I feel that it is now time to share it with the world. 

What We Need & What You Get

It costs approximately $ 4000.00 to publish the books.  I am not a good artist when it comes to drawing so I need to pay someone about 2000.00 $ to illustrate them.  You can give anonymously and you can give in any amount.   I only have a limited time to meet this goal. If 160 people blessed me with $25, I will meet my goal in no time at all. 

Here is what donors receive from giving: 

  • $15 – People, who are living in U.S., will receive a free hard copy of the book, signed by the author. Thank you words on my Facebook.com “fan page” wall.  Plus special thank you video at youtube.com and facebook.com “fan page”.
  • $20 – People, who are living out of U.S., will receive a free hard copy of the book, signed by the author. Thank you words on my Facebook.com “fan page” wall.  Plus special thank you video at youtube.com and facebook.com “fan page”.
  • $60 - Receive a three free hard copy of the book, signed by the author, and special thanks latter by post. Thank you words on my Facebook.com “fan page” wall.  Plus special thank you video at youtube.com and facebook.com “fan page”.
  • $100 - Receive a five free hard copy of the book, signed by the author, and special thanks latter and bookmark by post. Thank you words on my Facebook.com “fan page” wall.  Plus special thank you video at youtube.com and facebook.com “fan page”.

My Story

It all started about few years ago in my native Latvia, one of the Baltic States in northern Europe, across the Baltic Sea from Sweden. On a bleak winter's morning in January 2008, I received an interesting e-mail from a friend I had met in a personal development training course. His intent was clearly to cheer me up. While I am usually cheerful and optimistic by nature, my mood on that gray day was not the best. I also believe that things in life usually happen for a reason.


Here's what the e-mail said: 

    A group of professional people posed this question to a group of 4 to 8 year-olds, 'What does love mean?' The answers they got were broader and deeper than anyone could have imagined. 
    “When someone loves you, the way they say your name is different. You just know that your name is safe in their mouth.”  --   Billy, age 4 
      “Love is when you go out to eat and give somebody most of your French fries without making them give you any of theirs.”  -- Chrissie, age 6

"Love is when my mommy makes coffee for my daddy and she takes a sip before giving it to him to make sure it tastes OK." -- Danny, age 7

Author and lecturer Leo Buscaglia once talked about a contest he was asked to judge. The purpose of the contest was to find the most caring child. 
    
The winner was a 4-year-old whose next-door neighbor was an elderly gentleman who had recently lost his wife. Upon seeing the man cry, the little boy went into the old gentleman's yard, climbed onto his lap, and just sat there. When his Mother asked what he had said to the neighbor, the little boy replied: 'Nothing, I just helped him cry.' 
     
I remember that, after reading these children's observations about love, my mood was decidedly more up-beat for the rest of the day. What a wonderful thing!  I thought that message was worth sharing, and forwarded the email to all of my friends. 

At the same time, an idea was born: How to actively improve my own mood and that of others in just a few short minutes. I was curious to find out how the children in my country would define love. I also wanted to know how they felt in neighboring countries and other continents all over the world.
It was not my aim to seek out the most spiritual child and expound on his beliefs, but to hear the truth -- straight from the heart. The answers were not only interesting, they touched the heart and moved the spirit, just like the ones I had read in my friend's email. 

What Is My Book About?

We interviewed children between the ages of 4 and 10, in the United States, asking the question: "What is love?" then chose the most interesting responses and summarized them in this book.

The aim of our project is to find out how the youngest members of American society define love. To do this, we have interviewed children between the ages of 4 and 10, asking the question: "What is love?" 

We have selected the most interesting responses and summarized them in this book. 

We believe that this book will result in a positive change in our lives and that the content will inspire a healthy outlook and allow more love into your day-to-day lives. This book is for people of all ages who are curious, have respect for culture and religious diversity, and whose hearts are open. 

As a way to personalize the book for each reader, I have put blank pages at the back, where parents can put their children's photos. They could ask them the same "Love" question on each birthday, and note their answers as they grow and their thoughts evolve. They could save the books and present them to their children when they have grown, along with their perception of the meaning of love.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're ready to sign up and help bring this book to publication, thanks so much - it's a real pleasure and honour having you on board as a co-creator! I'm sure it's a win-win for everyone involved, and you'll enjoy the finished product immensely.I hope you can at least help me spread the word to others who might be interested, either through email or social media, or by using the share tools provided by IndieGoGo. I truly believe that this topic deserves more serious consideration. In the end, no matter what your spiritual/religious view (or lack thereof), we should all strive to do right by others, while living life to the fullest. But if we are attempting to understand who we are, and where we are going, in the grand scale of things, it's also important that we consider the idea that our consciousness may survive death. This book will be the ultimate resource for those who want to learn more.

Sincerest thanks,

Edgars Sermuks

story:
Update (October 1) - New Short Story

Only 64 hours left!!! I can’t believe how amazing and generous everyone has been and my words can’t thank you enough. So hopefully you’ll enjoy reading, “Just Breathe,” a short story that will be included in my collection, “From My Heart To Yours.”

 

Update (September 19) - Two new perks!!!

A short story collection has been put together as very special thank you for those who contribute $10 or more.

In addition, writing consultations are now being offered individually and start at only $25.

Welcome to My World!

My name is Ariel Driskell and I am a writer in every sense of the word. When I share this aspect of myself, most people ask, "What is it that you write about?" To be honest, I write a little of everything ranging from dating advice to short stories and most recently, screenplays. Writing to me is much like breathing--I can't picture my life without writing being a part of it in some way, shape or form. 

The goal of my campaign is simple: I want to publish my first completed novel, and to continue to improve upon my craft as a writer and editor. I hope to change and inspire lives, one book at a time. So today, I am asking you to partner with me on this project and help me publish my first  novel,  A Life Less Interrupted.  As we all know, "teamwork makes the dream work!"

What I Need from You

I will keep this part short and sweet, just like me.:) You can contribute as little or as much as you possibly can because every penney helps and there are perks if you contribute a certain amount. 

  • $2,000 to self publish novel.
  • $500 to purchase advance copies of novel, along with other promotional materials.
  • $500 for workshops and to enter writing contests which will provide me with constructive feedback needed to take my writing to the highest levels.

What's in it for YOU?

Please see the perks listed to the right of the page!

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that times are hard, and you may not be able to contribute financially, even if you really want to. But don't beat yourself up, you can still help by sharing my campaign with others! You can also show your support by visiting my blog, From My Heart to Yours, where I share short stories as well as inspirational musings to help myself and others get through our daily lives.

Also you can stop by my Facebook fanpage, Just Ask Ariel, and "Like" it while you're there!  As I mentioned above, I cover a number of topics in my writing, so if you have questions about the campaign or would like some personal advice, find me on Facebook or email me @ aedriskell@gmail.com.

Also, please enjoy the following "teaser" from A Life Less Interrupted. Thank you again for your time and support!

Teaser (Excerpt):

As the two women sat in the car waiting for their friend, Sharice decided there was no better place or time to find out if Nicole had given any more thought to when she was going to tell Lawrence about the baby.  She tried not to bring that subject up too often, but Nicole had had her first doctor’s appointment a week ago, and she felt that Lawrence should have had the option of being a part of that process as well.

“Of course I have,” Nicole replied, sighing.  “It’s all I think about, other than the wedding.  I just keep waiting for the right time, but when is the right time to tell someone that?”

Recognizing that was a rhetorical question, Sharice knew better than to answer that directly.  “Well, you know he loves you.  So I am sure he will be fine when you do tell him. You’re definitely going to tell him before the wedding though, right?” 

“Of course,” she retorted, shaking her head and throwing her hands up in disbelief that Sharice would even ask her that. “Besides, I will probably be showing by then,” Nicole said, laughing, trying to lighten the mood.

“Okay, okay,” Sharice said, laughing and shrugging.

Nicole laughed a little harder and apologized for answering her so harshly, and Sharice apologized for being so inquisitive. She now realized her question had been a little invasive, but having tried to keep the pregnancy a secret had already put a strain on her relationship. So she could only imagine what keeping it from Lawrence was doing to Nicole.

 “You did tell Tracey what time we were coming to pick her up, right?” Nicole asked, looking at the clock.

“Of course I did,” she said, pulling out her phone. Sharice welcomed the change of subject.  “No answer,” she said, shrugging.

“Hmm, well her car is here,” Nicole replied, looking around the parking lot with a puzzled look on her face.

Sharice began to unbuckle her seatbelt, preparing to get out and go inside just as she saw Tracey emerging from the building.  “There she is,” she said, sitting back. Then she saw another figure pull her back inside.

“What in the world?” Nicole asked, returning Sharice’s confused look.  “Isn’t that the doctor she was dancing with at the club?”

“Yeah. I mean, it looks like him from what I can see.” She began to strain her eyes, trying to see inside the glass doors. Her mouth dropped open, not believing what she was seeing. 

Nicole grabbed Sharice’s arm. “You have got to be kidding me.”

 The two figures had all of a sudden become one. They were embracing and seemed to be sharing a rather passionate kiss.

“They can’t be,” Nicole said as she lowered her shades.

“I knew she had been acting weird lately, but this is on a whole other level of craziness.” 

As the two exited the building grinning from ear to ear, Nicole and Sharice looked at each other with blank stares.  Their minds were reeling, but neither knew what to say.

“So what do we do? What do we say?” Sharice was beginning to feel herself panic.

“We say nothing.”  Nicole threw up her hands again and began to shake her head.  “Tracey is a grown woman, and you can’t tell grown people anything.”  She waved at Tracey as she approached the car and unlocked the doors.

“Grown woman my behind, Nicki.  She’s also engaged!”

“Don’t do it,” Nicole finished saying just as Tracey opened the side door.

“Don’t do what?” Tracey asked as she hopped into her seat, completely oblivious to the fact that they’d seen her kissing her client.

“Don’t ask why in the hell you were just kissing a man who isn’t your fiancé?”  Sharice turned around in her seat to face her cousin, whose smile had quickly faded.

“Here we go,” Nicole said, leaning back and rubbing her forehead with her hand.

“Sharice, for once just mind your own business!” Tracey yelled back at her.

“Just tell us what’s going on with you?  Who is this guy?” Sharice knew she was pushing it, but she didn’t care.  She didn’t want to see Tracey to do something that couldn’t be undone.

 “He’s a client––not that it’s any of your business.”  Her tone was becoming more defensive by the second.

“Since when did you start tonguing your clients?”  Sharice was concerned, but she wasn’t expressing it in a way that was making Tracey want to open up to her. 

“Sharice, chill out,” Nicole said, finally chiming in. “Tracey, we love you, and we are concerned about you. We are your family. You know you can tell us anything.”

“Well, don’t be. I just need some space right now and time to figure things out by myself.”

“Doesn’t look like you are doing a very good job at that. What if Derrick finds out?” Sharice asked.

“Look, Sharice, I don’t even know why I expected you to understand.  Silly me, thinking you could feel some type of empathy for what I am going through, especially with your track record of failed relationships.”

 “What is that supposed to mean?” Sharice could hear her voice beginning to rise, but at that moment, she could have cared less.

“Okay, you guys, everyone just needs to take a breath and calm down.” 

“I can’t deal with this right now,” Tracey said as she opened her car door.

“Oh, no you don’t,” Nicole said, trying to stop her.  “You’ve been absent during all of the planning thus far.  And today I need both of my girls with me, so get your butt back in this car right now. I am pregnant, and I am getting married, and ya’ll are not about to wreck my nerves,” Nicole said as she slid her sunglasses back on and began to turn the keys in the ignition.

“Nicole, I am really not in the mood to do this today,” Tracey said.

“Well, do like you were doing a minute ago and suck it up, and get back into this car.”  Nicole knew she shouldn’t have said that, but she didn’t care anymore. Tracey was being selfish and reckless, and despite the fact she told Sharice to butt out, Sharice had a point.

“Now you are riding me too!” yelled Tracey.

“No. What I am doing is trying to plan a wedding in less than three months, and you are hindering me from doing so, so get your butt back in the car.”

“Don’t know why I expected more from you two.”  Finally tired of hearing what they had to say, Tracey slammed the door behind her and stormed off in the direction of her car.

“Now you wait one minute,” Nicole said, using her catlike reflexes and jumping out in pursuit of her runaway maid of honor.  “I am trying to get your cousin off your back, so don’t direct your anger and guilt toward me.”

“And why are you in a rush to get married anyway, Nicole?  Trying to trap another one?  Is the baby even his?”  The words flew out of her mouth and stopped Nicole dead in her tracks. But that didn’t stop Tracey from ripping into Sharice, who had gotten out of the car as well.

“And as for you,” Tracey said, pointing her finger at Sharice, “if you don’t stop sabotaging your relationships because you feel badly about what happened with Charles, then you will end up alone and miserable.”  And with that, she turned her back to them and began to walk away.  “And I refuse to be the rock for either one of you when your relationships begin to fall apart!” she yelled at them as she threw her things into her car.

“That red heifer done lost her mind,” Nicole said, finding her voice again. Infuriated, she turned around and began to walk back to her truck.  Sharice followed behind her, feeling as though she’d just lost a part of herself.

They sat in silence for what felt like hours, but in actuality only a few minutes passed before Nicole spoke, breaking the silence.

“You know that––”

Sharice placed her hand on top of Nicole’s, letting her know it was okay. “I know Lawrence is the father, Nicki.”

Nicole managed to muster up a small smile and squeezed Sharice’s hand.  “I don’t really feel up to dress shopping anymore,” she replied as she started the car again.

“I know what you mean,” Sharice said, looking out of her window at the raindrops that had begun to fall.

“Home it is then.”

They sat in silence for what felt like hours, but in actuality only a few minutes passed before Nicole spoke, breaking the silence.
“You know that––”
Sharice placed her hand on top of Nicole’s, letting her know it was okay. “I know Lawrence is the father, Nicki.”
Nicole managed to muster up a small smile and squeezed Sharice’s hand.  “I don’t really feel up to dress shopping anymore,” she replied as she started the car again.
“I know what you mean,” Sharice said, looking out of her window at the raindrops that had begun to fall.
“Home it is then.”

story:
ABOUT:

A girl picks up and moves from downtown Toronto to small-town Slovakia. At 21, the world is her oyster; a journey filled with self-explorative magic and torture. Not without blissful highs and poignant lows, this is a collection of writing and photographs documenting her move from one life to the next. 

WHY WHAT YOU ARE DOING IS A TREMENDOUS HELP:

Understandibly, working on a book, producing the writing, and tediously preparing such an endeavor is hard work. Hard work filled with optimism and eagerness, albeit little financial reward. The goal of raising money is to help the funding of the printing of the project, so that it can be distributed without pressure of immediately defending such a large investment.

Your money will aleviate up-front printing costs, and nothing more. Every penny raised will go to the printing of the project, which, due to the high-quality of the images, paper and binding will be beyond the writers means to pay up-front.

The perks are intended to both inspire donation, as well as begin and promote the release of the book. The books will be sold throughout independent book stores and collectives upon its release, and by chosing to donate money now you are ensuring your copy comes directly to you. All prices detailed in the perks are the prices upon release. Not only are you getting a copy of the work as soon as it comes out - you are ensuring the work comes out altogether by donating now. 

All printing completed in Portland, Oregon by independent printers who care as much about writing and art as the writers and artists themselves. This process is about disseminating work by people who are passionate about writing, independence, and the production of creative and unique work. 

THE IMPACT:

The impact of your donation determines both when and how this project will be completed. As noted above, every contribution will go to getting this project printed and ready for distribution. Without your help, the project will be postponed almost indefinitely. Every dollar helps. 

Please note, the $900 goal is not the final printing cost of the work, but merely a goal that will greatly impact the finality of the project. There will still be costs beyond the goal total, so every dollar is crucial.

If the goal is NOT reached, you will recieve a full refund of your contribution. So please, help ensure it is reached by supporting! 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Every contribution helps. If you can, please donate. However, if you cannot - support this project by passing it along to people who may be able to.

Your support - regardless of its size or financial value - is entirely and graciously appreciated.

Our Story

Hello! My name is Aindrias de Staic I am a  actor/writer/musician who performs in theatre and film. 

I have devised my own theatre shows and films that have been successful at many international festivals including Edinburgh Fringe.   www.aindrias.com

 I have a great Idea for a feature film called 'The Year I got Younger' about a musician who needs to needs to find sobriety before he can really play from the heart. Its a kinda 'coming of age road movie bout an Irish musican who transforms durign a tumultuous but rewarding year backpacking accross Austrlia.'


 It has already been a surprising success as a  theatre show , and short-doco but now i need help to get a feature script developed. 

I work w story-telling and music but  being quite dyslexic Im really lookin fwd to workin  with a script writer and typist to get this great story script on paper. 

As i work a lot w music, and story-telling form the oral tradition, my previous work has always been devised orally and not rarely written down but this script deserves to be written professionally as I will be working with other actors.

The Impact

We are planning to enter many international film festivals with the film and we are expecting the gain awards as we feel the story is very powerful, a story of sturrggle agaisnt addiction yer with a heart rendering subplot and rewareding happy but realisitic happy ending... and it will turn out to be a truly effecting film-script.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Any money we might achieve through here will be helpful for our film. 

If we receive a generous contribution we are planning to include them in our credits as well as send them a copy of the finished product!


Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help us please spread the word so we can help raise some money. Thanks for your help!

If you would like to get involved in the project please email us on latchiko@gmail.com

story:
In the middle of hectic Tsim Sha Tsui

a spot of tranquility hides.

Scultptures, trees and tai chi.
Birds and benches. Turtles in a pond.
And a rainbow in the fountain.


This is one of my poems. I wrote it while I was in Hong Kong. To me, poetry can be magical. And it also makes for good exercise to put your thoughts into words. That’s why I love it, and want to share that passion with the world. This year, I started a project I call A Poem Each Day. Simply by publishing a poem each day on my blog. 

 

But I want more. Even when I was little, I had a fascination for the written word. I loved reading, but also making little magazines. Later in life, I ended up taking a bachelor’s degree in the art of publishing. All the while, I dreamt of my name on a published paper book. As the author, of course. This year I will make that happen. From the poems I write this year, I will select some and publish them in book-form. And you can be part of that dream!


Be part of my Poetry Book Dream

Just as I like to share my poetry, I like to share making my dream come true. That’s why I’ve started this crowd funding campaign, so you can be part of my Poetry Book Dream.


For an initial run of 1000 copies, I need 5000 US Dollar, which will include some design work for the cover. To become part of my dream, all you need to do is help fund that initial print run.


If you support me in publishing the book, you'll get something in return. More than words alone. Just have a look in the 'Perks for your contribution' section to the right to find the perk that looks best to you. If you contribute the amount linked to a perk, you get it. It starts already at $8, which will get you a mention on the website and in the book. I will include a section (both on the website and in the book) in which people who made the book possible will be thanked.


As an example of what you can expect: this is one of the postcards with a handrwitten poem, selected by one fo the funders.



The book will be published by the end of the year. However, if I reach my fundraising goal here, I will do so in the summer already. By then, I have written enough poems to select the best 80-100 poems.


Let others become part of my dream, too!

You have read this far, which, I will conclude, means you have a thing for poetry. Apart from funding this campaign, you can be of great help by sharing it with your friends. This campaign, but also, of course, the A Poem Each Day website. Whether you do that on Pinterest, Facebook, Twitter, email, Google Plus, or simply over drinks in a bar, every share is very much appreciated! You can easily share this campaign by using the options in the box above.


A little extra about the perks

For clarification: in the perks, I am talking about a series named after you (or a loved one, or your company). There is some flexibility in there. One option is to have the name in the post title. For example: 'The Arjan series: Title of poem'. Another one is to have your name/logo in the first part of the post text: "This poem is made possible through the generous support of ..." If you select one of these perks, I will contact you to work out the details.

story:
Fae Fatales: A Fantasy Noir Anthology

Of all the fairy-rings in all the worlds, she walks into mine...

First of all, thanks for coming out to have a look at our book, Fae Fatales: A Fantasy Noir Anthology. Hopefully you'll find something that interests you!

Update: We have reached our first goal to make this happen, but this doesn't stop here. Now we'd like to commission artists to do art for each story. If we reach $2160, then we will have enough to have art for each story. See below for more details.

Though this is the first publication from Solarwyrm Press, we are not publishing inexperienced writers. The anthology itself was put together by Jax Goss, winner of a Highly Commended Prize in the Commonwealth Short Story Writing Competition for her short story "Icarus" in 2011. Several of the other writers placed highly in the online writing competition LJ Idol over the 2010-2011 season, which was made up of over 250 contestants. Sally Bell, Daniel Heichel, J.M. Templet, and Dominica Malcolm placed 2nd, 3rd, 6th and 12th respectively. These 5 writers, along with Jeremiah Murphy, also have stories published in Idol Meanderings, a book that grew out of the competition.

All of the stories within this anthology are previously unpublished, so you'll be getting completely new stories by each of our writers.

Okay, but what exactly is fantasy noir? Consider it the gritty side of urban fantasy. If you're a fan of urban fantasy but not really familiar with the original 1940s noir films (where the noir genre began), then you'll enjoy this collection. If you already love noir and fantasy, then you'll LOVE it.

We will be updating this page with additional information about the writers, and adding perks throughout the campaign, but for now, here's some extra information to get you started.

The ten writers are:
Dominica Malcolm
Everett Warren
Jax Goss
J.M. Templet
J. Pauler
M. Kate Allen
Tom Trumpinski
Sally Bell
Jeremiah Murphy
Daniel Heichel

Now let us tell you a bit more about some of the stories and writers you'll be reading in the book (more descriptions will follow).

Dominica Malcolm's story Siren is about a Hawaiian man being haunted by a mermaid in 1946. For a free sample of Dominica's writing, you can read Bridging the Divide (featuring the same mermaid in 1894), which was published at Plunge Magazine in February. Both of these stories are set in the same universe as her upcoming novel, Adrift. In Dominica's "Writer Pack" perk, you receive a physical copy of the anthology and have the choice of having her draw a cartoon of you (samples here) or write a 5-10 page short film screenplay dedicated to you, based on your suggestions (existing screenplays here).
For more information about Dominica, you can check out her web site or find her on Facebook.

"You don't talk aelfen royalty and hobgoblin kingpin tangled together without attracting some untoward attentions from every Tam, Dick, and Houri from Brú na Bóinne to Hy-Brasil." And yet, that's exactly the kind of tale a certain hard-boiled PI is going to tell you all about in The Hollow Man, Everett A. Warren's contribution to the anthology. Everett has published "Cautionary Fables: Warts & All", a collection of short fiction, and "Poetry from the Porch Period", a collection of poetry, both of which can be ordered from your bookstore of choice. You can find out more about him and read a number of Everett's works online by checking out the Writing section of his website, everettawarren.com.

Lady Isabel and the Elf Knight is what happens when you take a Child Ballad and set it in a noir detective story. A hard boiled jaded detective, a beautiful mystery woman with a secret. And a little twist of magic. That's what you can expect from Jax Goss. Prior to this anthology, Jax published a collection of her own short stories in a book called The Edge of the Map. You can read some reviews of this book on Goodreads. In Jax's "Writer Pack" perk, you can receive a copy of both the anthology and a signed version of The Edge of the Map, along with a hand written custom short story, just for you, based on a prompt or character of your choice.
For more information about Jax, see her blog or find her on Facebook.

J.M. Templet's contribution is called Bleeding Ink, which tells the story of love and addiction in many forms. You can find an example of her flash fiction at Dig, where she won an honorable mention for her story about an actor playing a corpse. You can read more at her website; jasminet.net.

J.L. Pauler's The Brooch features a unicorn detective named Amaya, a missing brooch, a kelpie -- er, differently equestrian -- slum lord named Mavis, and a client who isn't entirely on the level. Amaya gets unexpected help in locating the missing brooch when the man accused of stealing it turns up floating in Mavis's river.

"I could understand where they were coming from; I’d read James M. Cain on my lunch breaks." Sally Bell actually studied Film Noir: Style and History at university... which doesn't really mean much except that she can recite huge chunks of Double Indemnity from memory.

Here's a short sample of what you'll read in Jeremiah Murphy's Beautiful Music:
“Her pout reminded me how much I ached to kiss those lips. ‘I was just being polite.’
With a shrug, I admitted, ‘I guess your kind does believe in tradition.”
“‘What do you mean, my kind?’
“‘Sweetheart,’ I said, ‘I thought you said we weren’t going to be playing games.’
She shook her head and chuckled again. ‘So,’ she asked, ‘are you going to invite me in?’
“‘Not a chance.’”
***
The door of Detective Beran, Private Investigator, was open to all kinds—witches, warlocks, vampires, werewolves, fairies, dragons, ghosts, and regular old people—until it closed not too long ago. But when a femme fatale comes knocking, how can you not answer?

How long is the anthology?

About 250 pages.

What does your contribution go towards?

We're asking for $1,500 to cover the costs of printing your copy, sending it to you, paying the writers for their stories, and paying someone to develop the book cover.

What happens if the campaign doesn't reach its goal by the target date?

It has! YAY! We are very excited, and very very happy, and super grateful to everyone who has supported us so far! 

What happens if we go over our goal?

We're over it! So let's start talking stretch goals. :) The first thing we'd like to do is be able to commission art for the book. What I'd love is to be able to find ten artists, give each of them one story, and ask them to do a piece based on it. Then we could include a set of postcards with each book ordered based on the art. 

I am a big fan of paying people for their art, so I'd want to pay the artists. For each extra $66 we get, I can commission ONE ARTIST. If we get to $2160, I can commission an artist for each story, and include a set of postcards with the first 50 physical books bought. 

So that's the new goal! I'll be putting out a call for artists as soon as we hit the first $66 over the target. 

What else can you do to help?

It would be awesome if you could help us spread the word about this anthology. If it sounds like your sort of thing, then chances are you know someone else who would also like it. Post on social media, tell people directly, send them our way!

story:
Philadelphia:
 
The state of our court system speaks for itself.  If our judges aren't accused of fixing tickets, they're being convicted of felonies.  Why is this happening?
 
It starts at the source.
 
You deserve to know who's running for judge, but too often, judicial candidates don't advertise, and now we have a bench of insiders and scandals, instead of common sense.  Because candidates game the system to get on the bench, it's no surprise they game the system when they're on it.
 
And it's time for a change.
 
Visit www.conorforjudge.com to learn all about the reasons why, on May 21st, you should Make Conor Your Honor.
 
You deserve to know who your judges are, and we'd like to introduce you to Conor.  Get to know him.
 
-  Andre Stephano, Treasurer
   Committee to Elect Conor Corcoran

The state of our court system speaks for itself.  If our judges aren't accused of fixing tickets, they're being convicted of felonies.  Why is this happening?
 
It starts at the source.
 
You deserve to know who's running for judge, but too often, judicial candidates don't advertise, and now we have a bench of insiders and scandals, instead of common sense.  Because candidates game the system to get on the bench, it's no surprise they game the system when they're on it.
 
And it's time for a change.
 
Visit www.conorforjudge.com to learn all about the reasons why, on May 21st, you should Make Conor Your Honor.
 
You deserve to know who your judges are, and we'd like to introduce you to Conor.  Get to know him.
 
-  Andre Stephano, Treasurer
   Committee to Elect Conor Corcoran

story:
Our names are Gabriel and Diana Zang, and we were writers for the fan movie STALKER: Monolith's Whisper, Exodis (a national award winning sci-fi short movie) and The Chamber, a short movie set in the STALKER universe as well as a Board Game designers.

Through this campaign we aim to accomplish two things:

  • Share this mind-blowing story and universe with you
  • Give our first step to become sci-fi writers, basically fulfill a dream :) 

With your contribution you will not only help us grow, but you will be fueling and giving tangible life to the rich universe within the books and the board game.

If you loved STALKER: Monolith's Whisper, The Chamber or any of our works, you'll love Norilsk Incident even more. If not, our you haven't seen any of those yet, give it a shot anyway, you'll love it as well.

Norilsk, a city in the far frozen plains of Siberia is struck by an unknown object falling from the sky and all the city inhabitants dissapear without a trace.

For almost a year, military and private parties tried to lead successful expeditions to find out the reason to the dissapearance of almost 200.000 people, but every group who tried to reach Norilsk dissapeared as well.

Now four separate parties, without knowledge of each other are to try as well.

"The Marauders", as they call themselves, formers residents of Norilsk, thieves and looters are willing to reach the city and reclaim it as their own property.

I.F.R.I.T. Spec Ops, Mercenaries under contract are to extract the object, of classified nature, that crashed into the city.

The Ex-Professo scientific group, comprised by some of the best scientists in the world intend to reach the crashsite to gather as much information as possible and retrieve the object as well.

A modern Cult called The Cult of Pappsukkal believes "The Messenger" has arrived to give the world knowledge and technology that would start a new era. To fulfill the prophecies found in ancient Babylonian texts, they intend to meet Papsukkal, the messenger from the skies.

The funds we gather will be invested in:

  • Edition and design
  • Book printing and publishing
  • E-book conversion and edition
  • Board Game manufacturing
  • Shipping costs for the previous items
  • Artwork
  • Advertising + Con-Booths (yes! comic conventions!)

Since this is a two branch project, there are perks for those who like reading but don't like board games, those who like board games but dislike reading, and of course, to those who want to live the Norilsk Universe to the limit :D

We LOVE freebies, and we'll give freebies! Book Chapter previews, Artwork, and a few contests we have planned throughout the campaign. All you have to do is add us in Facebook and stay sharp for news! 

You can grab the freebies at FZ Ideas or through the Gallery Tab above.

Should we not meet the goal by the end of the campaign, don't worry, you'll still get what your perk included. We'll figure out a way and make sure you don't miss a single bit of this story.

It's because we realize the potential this Universe has that we want to reach as far as we can to have it expand as much as possible.

This book and boardgame project could easily be turned into a movie, TV series or even a videogame, once you lay your hands on the free chapters and the books you'll see what we're talking about.

We also want to serve as inspiration to other people so they dare to take the same leap of faith we're taking. STALKER: Monolith's Whisper inspired many people, and we think this brand new project will inspire even more!

Besides getting perks we strongly encourage you to:

  • Share this campaign on your favourite Social Network
  • Flood your favourite forums with this news
  • Spread the word at school, work and so

What marked most of our projects' success wasn't the media nor classic channels but YOU, the ones who loved our projects and to whom we have devoted our time to.

story:
Wehat We Need & What You Get

The Austin Weird City Sisters are building a float to ride in for the Austin Pride Parade on September 7th (8pm parade time), and we need a little help with the expenses. Pride charges us $132 just to be in the parade. It's another $50 if we want to throw anything out (we like to distribute Bliss Kits--safe sex kits). We also plan to have a DJ on board our float, so we also would like to rent a sound system to rock your parade experience. Then there are other incidental expenses, like decorating the float.

  • We will be happy with donations of any size. Even $1 or $2. If you want some sister schwag, you can give a little more. If you really love us, and want to ride with us on our float, consider a larger contribution!
  • If we raise more than we need for the float, we will put the additional funds towards paying to get our 501c3 status.

We will be happy with donations of any size. Even $1 or $2. If you want some sister schwag, you can give a little more. If you really love us, and want to ride with us on our float, consider a larger contribution!
