story:
CLICK HERE FOR ENGLISH

Si tenéis problemas con la dirección al pagar, la solución está en poner cualquier cosa en la segunda línea. Aquí tenéis una lista de problemas habituales al hacer los pagos y su solución.


¡Logramos la edición en español!

Hemos logrado los objetivos para la edición del libro en inglés y en español. ¡Gracias! Ahora vamos a por el francés!

Como hispanoparlantes nos gustaría sacar el libro en español y asegurar la calidad del texto para lo que tenemos que contratar a un editor y a alguien que haga la maqueta de la edición papel. 

Nosotros hacemos el trabajo más gordo: escribir el libro y traducirlo al español. Aunque cueste creerlo lo estamos escribiendo directamente en inglés, para asegurar que pueda llegar al máximo de gente posible en todo el mundo. Sabemos y creemos que es importante poder disponer del libro en diferentes lenguas, porque a todos nos cuesta menos cuando leemos en nuestra propia lengua. El problema está en que traducir y editar cada lengua cuesta muy caro. 

Llevamos algo más de €1700 y para costear los gastos de la edición española debemos llegar a los €3000 (a no ser que alguno de vosotros sea editor o maquetador profesional y se ofrezca voluntario para hacer el trabajo).

Qué es el manual del coworking

El libro es un manual práctico para los proprietarios y gestores de espacios de coworking y de trabajo colaborativo. Nuestro objetivo con esta guía es ayudar a las personas que van a lanzar o están poniendo en marcha un coworking para que tengan más éxito, tanto en el plano económico y de viabilidad de su iniciativa, como de activación de las comunidades de profesionales que albergan y en las que están incrustados. 

Los temas que tratamos van del marketing a la parte económica, pasando por la activación y gestión de comunidades de autónomos y emprendedores (los principales clientes). 

La base del contenido es nuestra propia experiencia en la creación de espacios de coworking. 

Ramón abrió el Betacowork Coworking de Bruselas en 2009 y ya tiene casi 200 miembros. 

Jaime es uno de los fundadores de workINcompany en Sevilla, que este año se ha ampliado a una nueva planta. 

Ramón ayuda a otros emprendedores con sus talleres en las conferencias Americana, Europea y Española de coworking. Jaime suele presentar en la española y este año también en la Europea. 

En estas conferencias las mismas preguntas vuelven a aparecer una y otra vez. Nos gustaría que aquellos que no tienen la oportunidad de asistir a las conferencias- o para quienes les pilla demasiado lejos en el tiempo- puedan avanzar en su conocimiento y proyecto. Queremos hacerles más fácil el trabajo y que tengán más éxito.

Cómo es el libro

El contenido del libro es de orientación práctica. No somos académicos ni nos interesa hacer trabajo teórico. Para eso ya hay un montón de gente preparada y con mayor interés que está trabajando en las universidades y de otras organizaciones.

Además, no somos los únicos y verdaderos profetas del coworking, por lo que he querido sumar a otras personas al proyecto involucrando a la comunidad del coworking. A día de hoy hemos distribuido los borradores de los 5 primeros capítulos (que recibirán todos los que compren el libro en esta campaña), para que otros puedan reaccionar y compartir su visión. Estamos en contacto con otros propietarios y gestores alrededor del mundo para poder incluirles en el libro, para transmitir su visión sobre los diferentes aspectos que tratamos. Tienen total libertad y saben que pueden negar la mayor, esto no es una ciencia exacta :) 

Cuanto cuesta

Durante la duración de la campaña tenemos precios especiales, después será más caro. En función del paquete hay diferentes precios, desde los €9 hasta los €10.000 (tenemos que intentarlo :) ).

Hasta cuando  

Esta campaña acaba el viernes 20 de diciembre. Después pasará un tiempo hasta que se pueda comprar y además el precio será mayor.

Ayudadnos a compartir la campaña

Además de vuestra contribución económica, necesitamos vuestra ayuda para que todo el mundo mundial llegue a esta página, nos descubra y contribuya. 

Si conocéis a alguien que está pensando en abrir un espacio de coworking o que lo haya abierto y necesite ayuda, mandadles el enlace para que lo descubran.

Por favor, compartid esta campaña en Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin... incluso en Google+ ;) Dadle difusión para que llegue a todos aquellos a los que podamos ayudar con el libro. 

Si conocéis a periodistas, ¡dadles la tabarra para que hablen de nuestro libro!

Sí tenéis un blog, os agradeceríamos que hicieseis un artículo, aunque sea simplemente copiando y pegando este texto. 

Para hacer más fácil compartir la campaña hemos creado estos dominios que son más fáciles de recordar que la dirección de Indiegogo y que redirigen a esta misma página: 

  • manualcoworking.es
  • manualcoworking.com

El sitio web

También hemos creado un sitio web, donde estamos compartiendo partes del libro y donde vamos a añadir más material útil: coworkinghandbook.com

De momento los posts con más éxito (y a nuestro entender los más útiles) son estos dos para ayudar desde ya al marketing de los espacios de coworking: 

  • Las ventajas del coworking
  • Las desventajas del coworking

En unos días estarán también en español.

GRACIAS POR VUESTRA AYUDA

ENGLISH

If you have a problem with the address when paying, please make sure that the second address line is not empty. Just say hi :)  Here you have a list of common contribution errors and their solution.

We reached the English & Spanish goals!


Thanks to all for your contributions and for sharing our campaign :) For those that are wondering, yes I support Movember and with my moustache I'm also raising funds and awareness to fight prostate and testicular cancer. 

Strech Goal Reached! €3000 for the Spanish edition

The English edition is secured thanks to you, thanks! Now we are going for the Spanish edition. Help us reach this €3000 goal with your funding and support to spread the word. 

Gracias a vosotros hemos logrado cubrir la edición inglesa del manual del coworking, ¡gracias! Ahora tenemos que dar un paso más y lograr llegar a los €3000 para asegurar la edición española del libro. Ayudanos con tus compras y promocionando esta campaña entre tus círculos de amigos y conocidos. 

What is the Coworking Handbook

The Coworking Handbook is a practical guide to open, grow, and  manage a successful coworking space. 

We, Jaime and Ramon, have already created two successful coworking spaces in two different countries, with large, hyperactive, and motivated communities. Learn from our mistakes, so you can avoid them, and from our successes, so you can replicate them.

If you have been at the Global, European, and Spanish conferences you have seen our presentations and probably also discussed with us how to improve things: we share our knowledge and are always looking into learning and putting in practice what we learn.
We know that what really matters is doing. We want to help you to do more, faster, and better, with the support of a helpful team.

The Coworking Handbook is meant to be a helpful practical guide for the managers of coworking and other collaborative work spaces. We provide help in a practical way, covering every aspect of the management of your space: marketing and sales, community activation, administration and finance… We focus on value and insight, not on number of words. We want to help in the thinking process, and we also provide checklists and templates to run your space in an easier and more productive way.

The best way of learning is from other people going through the same up and downs as you, who have real experience with the issues that matter. We know we are not gods, nor do we want to be, so we are exchanging practices and proposals with the community all along the drafting of this book, just like we have been doing since we started thinking about opening our own coworking space. We are tapping on the knowledge of other coworking space managers to bring more value to all, even if it goes agains the way we see it. If you want to contribute, contact us. 

The Impact We Want To Make

We want to have more coworking spaces that thrive and have collaborative communities all over the world. With your support we can help more managers succeed in building sustainable coworking spaces that bring value to their communities. 

Is the Book Ready? 

Almost! We have already released the drafts of five chapters and another one will be released this week. We will be sending out the electronic versions of the book in English after the winter break (earlier if possible), and the paper versions ASAP (we depend on the printer for exact timings.)

What We Need & What You Get

We need help to edit the book, do the layout and to bring it to as many space managers as possible, in different languages and formats to better help them to have sustainable coworking spaces.

Specifically, we want money to:

  • Proofread and layout the English version of the book. 
  • Translate it to other languages and do the layout. 
  • Give conferences, seminars, and courses to help others learn from our experience. 

You get all our knowledge, conveniently packed and boiled down to the core. Ah, and also perks ;)

REACHED!!!! Main Goal

Proofread the English version. We have a very good English for non-native speakers (we actually write better than we speak), but we want to make sure that the book is cristal clear.

Strech Goals

  • Professional English layout when we reach €1500 REACHED
  • Spanish translation & layout when we reach €3000 REACHED
  • French translation & layout when we reach €8000
  • Portuguese translation & layout when we reach €13000
  • Presenting the book at the Global Coworking Conference Unconference GCUC in Kansas and giving coaching and workshops to help coworker managers €19000 (IN OUR WILD DREAMS)
  • Tell us what to add here :), check the translation perk if you want the book in your language :)

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you cannot contribute you can still help us :

  • Promote this campaign among your friends and followers. Social Media are awesome, but if you can send emails or talk to the people even better. 
  • Retweet, share, and like our updates on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Talk to your contacts that may benefit from the book. 
  • Talk to journalists and online influencers about the Coworking Handbook and try to convince them to write about the campaign and the book. 
  • Talk to your school directors and teachers.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and any other thing you can think of :) 

If we have forgotten anything, let us know so that we can add it and make the book and this campaign Better. 

Easy Sharing

Use this web address for easy sharing and remembering: www.coworkingmanual.com

Utiliza esta dirección para compartir: www.manualcoworking.com

Who Are We


Ramon Suarez
Ramon is the founder of the Betacowork in Brussels, a thriving coworking space with over 180 members, built around the largest community of tech entrepreneurs and professionals in Belgium: the Betagroup.
Entrepreneur and marketing professional, Ramon can be found at the main European conferences helping others run successful spaces. He also actively promotes the Belgian tech startup ecosystem through different initiatives. The coworking space was born on the first day of the first Coworking Europe conference in 2010.
Find more about him and connect in Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+ and his blog.



Jaime Aranda
Jaime is the cofounder of WorkInCompany, the coworking space that is revolutionizing the entrepreneurial ecosystem of Seville, Spain. An architect by training, he knows by heart that a coworking space is not an space: it is built upon the interactions of its members, of its community. In a little over a year they have managed to grow and activate a rich ecosystem of professionals willing to change their city and the world. Jaime has also organized the largest pop-up coworking space in Spain at EBE, a social web conference with over 1000 participants.
Find more about him and connect in Twitter.

Special Thanks To

Stefano Borghi for the fantastic pictures he takes at every coworking conference and for giving us the picture for the campaign. 

Yann Heurtaux for supporting this crowdfunding campaign before it even started and donating part of the money he raised with his crowdfunding campaign to come to Coworking Europe. 

Liz Elam, organizer of GCUC, for donating the first ticket of the conference to support the Coworking Handbook. 

Manuel Zea, founder of Coworking Spain, for contributing to the campaign with his book, a ticket to the Spanish conference, and 2 premium memberships.

CLICK HERE FOR ENGLISHSi tenéis problemas con la dirección al pagar, la solución está en poner cualquier cosa en la segunda línea. Aquí tenéis una lista de problemas habituales al hacer los pagos y su solución.
¡Logramos la edición en español!Hemos logrado los objetivos para la edición del libro en inglés y en español. ¡Gracias! Ahora vamos a por el francés!Como hispanoparlantes nos gustaría sacar el libro en español y asegurar la calidad del texto para lo que tenemos que contratar a un editor y a alguien que haga la maqueta de la edición papel. Nosotros hacemos el trabajo más gordo: escribir el libro y traducirlo al español. Aunque cueste creerlo lo estamos escribiendo directamente en inglés, para asegurar que pueda llegar al máximo de gente posible en todo el mundo. Sabemos y creemos que es importante poder disponer del libro en diferentes lenguas, porque a todos nos cuesta menos cuando leemos en nuestra propia lengua. El problema está en que traducir y editar cada lengua cuesta muy caro. Llevamos algo más de €1700 y para costear los gastos de la edición española debemos llegar a los €3000 (a no ser que alguno de vosotros sea editor o maquetador profesional y se ofrezca voluntario para hacer el trabajo).Qué es el manual del coworkingEl libro es un manual práctico para los proprietarios y gestores de espacios de coworking y de trabajo colaborativo. Nuestro objetivo con esta guía es ayudar a las personas que van a lanzar o están poniendo en marcha un coworking para que tengan más éxito, tanto en el plano económico y de viabilidad de su iniciativa, como de activación de las comunidades de profesionales que albergan y en las que están incrustados. Los temas que tratamos van del marketing a la parte económica, pasando por la activación y gestión de comunidades de autónomos y emprendedores (los principales clientes). La base del contenido es nuestra propia experiencia en la creación de espacios de coworking. Ramón abrió el Betacowork Coworking de Bruselas en 2009 y ya tiene casi 200 miembros. Jaime es uno de los fundadores de workINcompany en Sevilla, que este año se ha ampliado a una nueva planta. Ramón ayuda a otros emprendedores con sus talleres en las conferencias Americana, Europea y Española de coworking. Jaime suele presentar en la española y este año también en la Europea. En estas conferencias las mismas preguntas vuelven a aparecer una y otra vez. Nos gustaría que aquellos que no tienen la oportunidad de asistir a las conferencias- o para quienes les pilla demasiado lejos en el tiempo- puedan avanzar en su conocimiento y proyecto. Queremos hacerles más fácil el trabajo y que tengán más éxito.Cómo es el libroEl contenido del libro es de orientación práctica. No somos académicos ni nos interesa hacer trabajo teórico. Para eso ya hay un montón de gente preparada y con mayor interés que está trabajando en las universidades y de otras organizaciones.Además, no somos los únicos y verdaderos profetas del coworking, por lo que he querido sumar a otras personas al proyecto involucrando a la comunidad del coworking. A día de hoy hemos distribuido los borradores de los 5 primeros capítulos (que recibirán todos los que compren el libro en esta campaña), para que otros puedan reaccionar y compartir su visión. Estamos en contacto con otros propietarios y gestores alrededor del mundo para poder incluirles en el libro, para transmitir su visión sobre los diferentes aspectos que tratamos. Tienen total libertad y saben que pueden negar la mayor, esto no es una ciencia exacta :) Cuanto cuestaDurante la duración de la campaña tenemos precios especiales, después será más caro. En función del paquete hay diferentes precios, desde los €9 hasta los €10.000 (tenemos que intentarlo :) ).Hasta cuando  Esta campaña acaba el viernes 20 de diciembre. Después pasará un tiempo hasta que se pueda comprar y además el precio será mayor.Ayudadnos a compartir la campañaAdemás de vuestra contribución económica, necesitamos vuestra ayuda para que todo el mundo mundial llegue a esta página, nos descubra y contribuya. Si conocéis a alguien que está pensando en abrir un espacio de coworking o que lo haya abierto y necesite ayuda, mandadles el enlace para que lo descubran.Por favor, compartid esta campaña en Twitter, Facebook, Linkedin... incluso en Google+ ;) Dadle difusión para que llegue a todos aquellos a los que podamos ayudar con el libro. Si conocéis a periodistas, ¡dadles la tabarra para que hablen de nuestro libro!Sí tenéis un blog, os agradeceríamos que hicieseis un artículo, aunque sea simplemente copiando y pegando este texto. Para hacer más fácil compartir la campaña hemos creado estos dominios que son más fáciles de recordar que la dirección de Indiegogo y que redirigen a esta misma página: 
manualcoworking.es
manualcoworking.com
El sitio webTambién hemos creado un sitio web, donde estamos compartiendo partes del libro y donde vamos a añadir más material útil: coworkinghandbook.comDe momento los posts con más éxito (y a nuestro entender los más útiles) son estos dos para ayudar desde ya al marketing de los espacios de coworking: 
Las ventajas del coworking
Las desventajas del coworking
En unos días estarán también en español.GRACIAS POR VUESTRA AYUDA

ENGLISHIf you have a problem with the address when paying, please make sure that the second address line is not empty. Just say hi :)  Here you have a list of common contribution errors and their solution.We reached the English & Spanish goals!Thanks to all for your contributions and for sharing our campaign :) For those that are wondering, yes I support Movember and with my moustache I'm also raising funds and awareness to fight prostate and testicular cancer. Strech Goal Reached! €3000 for the Spanish edition
The English edition is secured thanks to you, thanks! Now we are going for the Spanish edition. Help us reach this €3000 goal with your funding and support to spread the word. Gracias a vosotros hemos logrado cubrir la edición inglesa del manual del coworking, ¡gracias! Ahora tenemos que dar un paso más y lograr llegar a los €3000 para asegurar la edición española del libro. Ayudanos con tus compras y promocionando esta campaña entre tus círculos de amigos y conocidos. What is the Coworking HandbookThe Coworking Handbook is a practical guide to open, grow, and  manage a successful coworking space. We, Jaime and Ramon, have already created two successful coworking spaces in two different countries, with large, hyperactive, and motivated communities. Learn from our mistakes, so you can avoid them, and from our successes, so you can replicate them.If you have been at the Global, European, and Spanish conferences you have seen our presentations and probably also discussed with us how to improve things: we share our knowledge and are always looking into learning and putting in practice what we learn.We know that what really matters is doing. We want to help you to do more, faster, and better, with the support of a helpful team.The Coworking Handbook is meant to be a helpful practical guide for the managers of coworking and other collaborative work spaces. We provide help in a practical way, covering every aspect of the management of your space: marketing and sales, community activation, administration and finance… We focus on value and insight, not on number of words. We want to help in the thinking process, and we also provide checklists and templates to run your space in an easier and more productive way.The best way of learning is from other people going through the same up and downs as you, who have real experience with the issues that matter. We know we are not gods, nor do we want to be, so we are exchanging practices and proposals with the community all along the drafting of this book, just like we have been doing since we started thinking about opening our own coworking space. We are tapping on the knowledge of other coworking space managers to bring more value to all, even if it goes agains the way we see it. If you want to contribute, contact us. The Impact We Want To MakeWe want to have more coworking spaces that thrive and have collaborative communities all over the world. With your support we can help more managers succeed in building sustainable coworking spaces that bring value to their communities. Is the Book Ready? Almost! We have already released the drafts of five chapters and another one will be released this week. We will be sending out the electronic versions of the book in English after the winter break (earlier if possible), and the paper versions ASAP (we depend on the printer for exact timings.)What We Need & What You GetWe need help to edit the book, do the layout and to bring it to as many space managers as possible, in different languages and formats to better help them to have sustainable coworking spaces.Specifically, we want money to:
Proofread and layout the English version of the book. 
Translate it to other languages and do the layout. 
Give conferences, seminars, and courses to help others learn from our experience. 
You get all our knowledge, conveniently packed and boiled down to the core. Ah, and also perks ;)REACHED!!!! Main GoalProofread the English version. We have a very good English for non-native speakers (we actually write better than we speak), but we want to make sure that the book is cristal clear.Strech Goals

Professional English layout when we reach €1500 REACHED

Spanish translation & layout when we reach €3000 REACHED

French translation & layout when we reach €8000

Portuguese translation & layout when we reach €13000

Presenting the book at the Global Coworking Conference Unconference GCUC in Kansas and giving coaching and workshops to help coworker managers €19000 (IN OUR WILD DREAMS)

Tell us what to add here :), check the translation perk if you want the book in your language :)


Other Ways You Can Help
Even if you cannot contribute you can still help us :
Promote this campaign among your friends and followers. Social Media are awesome, but if you can send emails or talk to the people even better. 

Retweet, share, and like our updates on Facebook and Twitter.

Talk to your contacts that may benefit from the book. 

Talk to journalists and online influencers about the Coworking Handbook and try to convince them to write about the campaign and the book. 

Talk to your school directors and teachers.

Use the Indiegogo share tools and any other thing you can think of :) 

If we have forgotten anything, let us know so that we can add it and make the book and this campaign Better. Easy SharingUse this web address for easy sharing and remembering: www.coworkingmanual.comUtiliza esta dirección para compartir: www.manualcoworking.comWho Are WeRamon SuarezRamon is the founder of the Betacowork in Brussels, a thriving coworking space with over 180 members, built around the largest community of tech entrepreneurs and professionals in Belgium: the Betagroup.Entrepreneur and marketing professional, Ramon can be found at the main European conferences helping others run successful spaces. He also actively promotes the Belgian tech startup ecosystem through different initiatives. The coworking space was born on the first day of the first Coworking Europe conference in 2010.Find more about him and connect in Twitter, LinkedIn, Google+ and his blog.Jaime ArandaJaime is the cofounder of WorkInCompany, the coworking space that is revolutionizing the entrepreneurial ecosystem of Seville, Spain. An architect by training, he knows by heart that a coworking space is not an space: it is built upon the interactions of its members, of its community. In a little over a year they have managed to grow and activate a rich ecosystem of professionals willing to change their city and the world. Jaime has also organized the largest pop-up coworking space in Spain at EBE, a social web conference with over 1000 participants.Find more about him and connect in Twitter.Special Thanks ToStefano Borghi for the fantastic pictures he takes at every coworking conference and for giving us the picture for the campaign. Yann Heurtaux for supporting this crowdfunding campaign before it even started and donating part of the money he raised with his crowdfunding campaign to come to Coworking Europe. Liz Elam, organizer of GCUC, for donating the first ticket of the conference to support the Coworking Handbook. Manuel Zea, founder of Coworking Spain, for contributing to the campaign with his book, a ticket to the Spanish conference, and 2 premium memberships.

Updates:

It's come to my attention that my page lacked my work. A severe oversight that I'm terribly sorry for, but have now fixed. 

Note: This is not indicative of the quality of work I'll be putting into the audiobook. That will be done on high-quality audio recording equipment, and will sound much better. I promise.
(There seems to be a problem posting videos to this area. If the video does not appear above, please use this Link)


(There seems to be a problem posting videos to this area. If the video does not appear above, please use this Link )

So what's all of this about, anyway?

Ladies and gentlemen, boys and girls, children of most ages, welcome to my very first crowdfunding project. I am Sean Walter, a writer living in Portland, Oregon (yes, that one) and I have, in the last several years, written a novel-length collection of short stories.

A little about myself: I've been writing of my own accord since I was 8 years old, and some of the ideas used in this book have been with me for that long, growing and maturing as I have. I've worked a multitude of jobs meeting many interesting people along the way, but none of these jobs have brought me as much joy or simple contentment as writing has. I would like to make it my full-time career, and this is the first step.

What is this book?

The book itself is full of what is considered by some to be "dark literature." That is to say, it's not suitable for people who don't enjoy or cannot handle dark or strange things – things such as demons, death, brutal honesty, drinking, bureaucratic gods, disgruntled imaginations, and plots that make you ponder reality.

It will be printed in paperback on common paperback-quality paper, and is roughly 200 pages in length. I will also be making an e-book for those of you who prefer your reading in a digital format, and an audiobook for those who like to listen. 

And what will I get out of all of this?

That entirely depends on what you wish to contribute, however, everyone who contributes will receive thanks in the book itself.

Oh look, a list:

  • The Undecided: For $2, you will be sent a letter from me, hand written with the very pen that I write the first drafts of stories with, and you will have my thanks.

  • The E-Reader: For 4$, you will receive a full e-book download of the short story collection, along with a hand-written letter from the author.

  • The Magnetic: For $5 (includes shipping within the United States), you will receive one of three magnets with lines from the book on the face, along with a letter from the author. (Third magnet coming soon)

  • The Listener: For $6, you will receive a quality mp3 download of the short story collection as read by the author. (I promise, my reading skills are much better than my acting skills.) You will also receive a hand-written letter of thanks from the author.

  • The Reader: For $8 (includes shipping within the United States), you will receive a signed and numbered printed paperback copy of my book of short stories, along with a hand-written letter of thanks from the author.

  • The Specialist: For $12 (includes shipping within the United States), you will receive a personalized printed paperback copy of my book of short stories. These are still signed and numbered, but if you want a personal message, a doodle, anything like that, this tier and the ones above are for you. Again, you will also receive a hand-written letter of thanks.

  • The Collector: For $20 (includes shipping within the United States), you will receive everything included in The Specialist, The Listener, and The E-Reader, along with all magnets of The Magnetic tier. That is to say, you will receive all three magnet cards, a personalized print-copy of the book, an audiobook download, and an e-book download, along with a letter of thanks from the author.

  • The Caffeinated: For $50, if you live in the Portland area, or can make it here, I will treat you to coffee (or other caffeinated beverage. I quite like most tea, as well) at a location of your choice. Ever wanted to sit down with a writer and talk about every little thing? Now's your chance. I will also include a paperback copy of the short story collection.

  • The Librarian: For $60 (includes shipping within the United States), you will receive a signed and numbered, handmade, leather-bound special edition of the short story collection, along with a letter from the author. The leather for these books will be hand picked by the author, and the covers will be gorgeously decorated. These will be limited to ten copies. There will never be more like them. They're perfect for the reader who just loves the look and smell of leather.

  • The Unique: For $75 (includes shipping within the United States), you will receive a hand-bound one-off Hardcover edition of the short story collection. These will be printed, constructed, and bound by the author, and covered in unique artwork inspired by the stories in the book itself. The artwork will be done by various local Portland artists. These books will truly be a work of art all on their own, and will look grand on any bookshelf.

  • The Character: For $100 (includes shipping within the United States), I will make you a character in a future short story*. These stories will be one of a kind, and written only after I have had the opportunity to talk to the contributors. Once complete, I will send these individual stories out, presented in the most beautiful way I can manage. While you wait, I'll also send you a paperback copy of the short story collection this campaign is funding. *These stories, sadly, will not be included in this short story collection, but I am hopeful that I will be able to include them in the next collection that gets printed somewhere down the line.

  • The Shrewd: For $150 (Includes shipping within the United states), I will send you a hard-cover copy of the book described in The Unique above, plus make you a character in a future story, as described in The Character perk. A combination of the two with a lower price as my way of saying thank you.

  • The Diner: Live in the Portland area? Like food and conversation? Fantastic! Then, for $300, I can come to your house and cook for you. I've been cooking almost as long as I've been writing, and would be happy to make a special trip and meal for a contributor or small group of contributors, including your very own hand-bound copy of the book, with a cover designed by myself.

Where is all of this money going?

Editing: $200
Isbn's and Barcodes: $300
Rewards:$400
Indiegogo's cut: ~$100
Cover design: $100
Printing/binding: $1500
Total cost = $2600

Any funds above and beyond will go directly into improving this publication (larger print run, better quality paper, etc.) or towards adding further rewards to those who have already contributed.

So, it's a book

That's right, and with your help, it'll be a great book. Contributing here will help a writer get off the ground, and you will gain a collection of stories you can tell your friends about.

Other Ways You Can Help

Don't have the funds and want to help anyway?
Fantastic. I would very much appreciate if you would spread the word about this page to other people who are interested. Post it to your websites, show it to your friends, get the word out any way you like.

F.A.Q.

Q. What happens if I live outside of the United States, and want something mailed to me?

A. There are several ways to go about that. Really, shipping international is a fairly expensive proposition, especially for the hardbound books. I would be happy to split the cost of shipping, but since every country I've checked thus far has been different, I suggest paying for the perk level you want, and I can send a message to the email you used for your contribution and let you know the shipping rates and what you can expect to pay to receive the item(s).

Q. What happens if your campaign gets more funding than its original goal?

A. That all depend on how much over the original goal it goes. A little over means that I just get to pay my artists more for their hard work. If it goes over by a lot, I plan on several fun surprises. I'm currently investigating how much it would have to go over to have extras added to people who have already contributed. As soon as I'm certain on an amount, I'll post it as a "Stretch-goals" update.

Q. What's with the hat?

A. What? It's a top hat. I like my top hat. Why does everyone ask about my top hat?

story:
Story of My Book

My name is Jessica McCarter and I am the author of 75 Days of Jo. I wrote this book because I wanted to tell a story like the ones I used to love reading as a teen (and if I’m being honest with myself, I STILL love these types of stories.)

My hope is that, in reading this book, you’ll get to escape from the stresses of everyday life, which is something I’ve always loved about reading - getting lost in a story. I also hope that you’ll be able to relate to the characters of this book and what they go through, even if you aren’t currently a freshman in college (the time in Jo’s life in which this book takes place).

75 Days of Jo is a fictional young adult novel that follows the life of Jo throughout her first semester of college. Jo, a kind yet insecure 18-year-old, is left feeling anxious and distraught when her parents wave their final goodbyes after moving her into college. The reality of being in a new place, knowing no one, without her family nearby, weighs heavily on Jo. Lucky for her, she meets Ginger, a quick-witted, fiercely loyal, and brutally honest girl that lives in the room next door. Jo and Ginger become fast friends and together they navigate the highs and lows of being new college students - dealing with crazy roommates, going to parties, and meeting boys. Emphasis on meeting boys.

You will love this book if you like to read light, yet entertaining, teen romance novels while:

  • Sitting on the beach on a warm summer day
  • Cozying up in a nook at Starbucks on a rainy Tuesday
  • Laying in bed until noon on your day off from school/work
75 Days of Jo speaks to anyone who has gone through a time in their life feeling insecure and lonely but has come out on the other side stronger and more confident. This book also speaks to anyone who loves getting butterflies when they meet someone special.

 

What I Need & What You'll Get

This book will be published with New Degree Press. I set up the pre-order tiers to help cover the costs for publishing my book. Money raised will go towards the following:
 
  • The Editor I will work with to revise and publish my manuscript in December, 2020
  • The Cover Design of my Book - the mockups you see currently are a placeholder!
  • The Layout Design for the interior of my book (Physical Copy, Ebook Formats)
  • The Copyediting for My Book - to make help polish the grammar and spelling prior to publication

  • The opportunity to help give me feedback and be involved in selecting my cover
  • I will do a book topic/workshop seminar where I will share experience the experiences of writing my book
  • And more...

 

About the Author

Jessica, a Pennsylvania State University graduate with a degree in Supply Chain, has always loved reading, writing, and being creative. Outside of her career in e-commerce, she finds ways to express herself through blogging, podcasting, and most recently writing a book! One of Jessica’s biggest accomplishments was co-founding an organization that raised money in the fight against pediatric cancer. Through this experience, Jessica learned the importance of being part of a community that encourages everyone to be themselves and share their stories.

75 Days of Jo pays homage to that exact sentiment - anything is possible if you surround yourself with the right people and the right community.

For more information you can connect with Jessica on the following social media platforms:
Facebook: Jessica McCarter
Instagram: jesslynnmcc
Linkedin: Jessica McCarter

 

Risks & Challenges

The biggest challenge with publishing a book is delivering the finished book to the backer, specifically my mailing of the book to you. I have eliminated this risk by building into the campaign the mailing and shipping costs of your signed copies to you within each pre-order tier.

The risk of delivering the pre-sale copies of my book is contingent on the publisher we use. I will be working closely with New Degree Press to make sure we get the earliest possible ship date of the signed book copy to you. We will keep all pre-sale backers up-to-date as my book hits each key milestone and publishes. You will know when the copies of my book you pre-ordered are expected to ship.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please Share my Pre-sale Campaign on Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn with your friends, family and network. Please use #75daysofjo and tag me as well as my publisher, New Degree Press so we can help amplify your efforts.
  • You can easily share my Pre-Sale Campaign Page via Indiegogo at the top of the page
  • Please share my book to 5 friends, family members, or co-workers who you think would enjoy it. Please do this as a text message or Direct Message on social media.

 

Thank you so much for of all of your love and support!

Thanks again,
Jessica McCarter
story_txt:
Story of My Book
My name is Jessica McCarter and I am the author of 75 Days of Jo. I wrote this book because I wanted to tell a story like the ones I used to love reading as a teen (and if I’m being honest with myself, I STILL love these types of stories.)My hope is that, in reading this book, you’ll get to escape from the stresses of everyday life, which is something I’ve always loved about reading - getting lost in a story. I also hope that you’ll be able to relate to the characters of this book and what they go through, even if you aren’t currently a freshman in college (the time in Jo’s life in which this book takes place).75 Days of Jo is a fictional young adult novel that follows the life of Jo throughout her first semester of college. Jo, a kind yet insecure 18-year-old, is left feeling anxious and distraught when her parents wave their final goodbyes after moving her into college. The reality of being in a new place, knowing no one, without her family nearby, weighs heavily on Jo. Lucky for her, she meets Ginger, a quick-witted, fiercely loyal, and brutally honest girl that lives in the room next door. Jo and Ginger become fast friends and together they navigate the highs and lows of being new college students - dealing with crazy roommates, going to parties, and meeting boys. Emphasis on meeting boys.You will love this book if you like to read light, yet entertaining, teen romance novels while:

Sitting on the beach on a warm summer day
Cozying up in a nook at Starbucks on a rainy Tuesday
Laying in bed until noon on your day off from school/work

75 Days of Jo speaks to anyone who has gone through a time in their life feeling insecure and lonely but has come out on the other side stronger and more confident. This book also speaks to anyone who loves getting butterflies when they meet someone special. What I Need & What You'll GetThis book will be published with New Degree Press. story:
Summary

"Tears are words that need to be written."  Paolo Coelho

Grief is a lonely place, especially for those who can't find the words, or don't know the language of grief to express the depth of their loss, the numbness and disbelief, and the persistent sense of unreality.  

With Words, We Grieve is a collection of writings from people who did find the words, who wrote poems, essays, stories, blogs, emails and letters about their own grieving processes and were willing to share them.  

After two years of soliciting submissions, with now 450-plus received from writers of all ages nationwide, I have more than enough submissions/stories from which to choose for a collection of writings -- over loss of spouses, children, family, friends, pets, and for the here-but-not-here loss of loved ones to Alzheimer's.  

This anthology is for those who don't have the words; writings that, rather than tiptoe around the edges of  death, acknowledge a life that mattered is gone and that one's own life can be forever changed by that death.  Writings that speak to and for others unable to find the words. 

Each voice is unique, some humorous, some angry, many sad and poignant, but uplifting as well.  These poems and essays, and the immediacy of emails, letters and blog entries affirm that there is life after loss, and that we do find ways out of grief.  

I have been passionate about this book for more than three years, the last two focused on gathering material via calls for submissions to writing groups, newsletters, grief counseling groups, friends and colleagues, and the response has been overwhelming.  Interest and enthusiasm for the book on the part of other writers, grief counselors, ministers and editors as well have been positive and encouraging:

Thank you for compiling this important anthology.

It is a great contribution to be doing a grief anthology.  So needed!

...a very rewarding project that could have a deep impact on readers.

What a truly wonderful source this will be for grieving people.

Your book idea is great.  And will be much appreciated, I'm sure!


Funding Need

Am seeking support simply to "buy" time for completion of this book.  While fortunate to have created a freelance niche that keeps me consistently busy, my work load and deadline schedules have been such that consistent, concentrated book work has been virtually impossible (and sadly, freelancers don't get paid vacations!).  I can't willy-nilly not work -- like anyone, I have monthly financial obligations to meet, and ongoing business expenses will have to include employing someone to maintain client needs, so as not to jeopardize ongoing client projects.  I am asking, therefore, for a stipend to carry me through the 6-8 weeks of dedicated book time -- a bookathon -- I estimate is needed to complete the anthology for submission by late fall of this year.


About Me

I wish I could list a slew of already published works to my credit, but there are none, though I've written stories for children for as long as I can remember, and newspaper feature and human interest stories for many years, some of which have won awards in those categories for a regional weekly paper.  I studied creative writing at the New School for Social Research and NYU in New York City, and nonfiction and opinion writing at University of Southern Maine, from where I graduated summa cum laude  with a BA in communication and linguistics.  I've also taught creative writing workshops and attended many -- in short, lots of writing but no books. This will be my first serious attempt, and certainly my first try at an anthology.

My professional field is oral history, and documentary, literary and academic transcription, proofreading, editing and research services.  I have operated as a freelancer D/B/A TranScripDirect for nearly 20 years, with clients nationwide ranging from universities, museums and archives to television production, U.S. government departments, academic dissertations, and independent fiction and nonfiction authors and filmmakers.

Oral history, however, is the mainstay of my work.  I am a listener of stories, and while my work and travel experiences have honed my appreciation for language, it is voice that moves and fascinates me, how people tell their stories, the words they choose and how they arrange them.  

The writings for this anthology have voice.  From thoughtful pieces revisiting past loss to the immediacy of loss more recent, they speak to the universality of grief. There is nothing like it currently in publication, a collection in diverse genres by both published and unpublished writers willing to share their experiences of grief in their own unique ways, some because they were given the opportunity to do so, others because they need to do so, and some in the hope that their words will bring comfort to others.


Impact of Anthology

While the anthology was inspired  partially by my own experiences with grief -- with a large family encompassing five living generations, we certainly aren't strangers to death -- I was inspired,  too, by the many losses shared of and with friends and colleagues, and the letters, late-night conversations and emails from those who expressed their thoughts and feelings throughout their own grieving processes. This anthology is, to a great extent, their stories as well.

I truly believe this collection will be a welcomed addition to the literature of grief. Spanning loss through age or illness, accident or suicide, the writings will resonate with anyone seeking, not instruction for how to deal with grief, but an expression that is similar, kindred, and that pierces the isolation of grief.  


Goals of Funding

The bulk of requested funding will be allocated toward ongoing expenses to maintain  my freelance client base over that period of time, specifically, as already mentioned, employing someone to assure that client projects are not compromised by my absence.  Some funding, of course, will have to be allocated to that portion of lost income necessary to cover basic monthly financial obligations.

Additional expenses will include some travel to meet with grief groups and counselors, costs incurred through personal communications with those writers whose work will be included, ancillary anticipated and unanticipated expenses relative to the book, and fees incurred for this campaign.

If I do not reach my funding goal within the allotted 60 days, I will use whatever time afforded by funds raised and plan for later than hoped for completion of the manuscript.  

If I exceed my funding goal -- it happens! -- I have already outlined a second anthology, a collection of drawings and writings by children only, illustrating how they experience grief.   Have collected some material toward this second project so would apply extra funding toward pulling that book together as a companion volume to With Words, We Grieve.

Three years into this anthology and I'm still excited, motivated, and committed to seeing it published -- more so even than when I began!  


Other Ways You Can Help

Any and all contributions toward "buying" time will bring the anthology toward completion. You can also help enormously by simply posting the campaign link on Facebook or other social media, and/or circulating the link among family, friends, and colleagues and asking them to circulate it among their own contacts as well.  The greater the circulation, the better the chance of reaching my funding goal within the 60 days the campaign remains active.


Perks

ALL donations will receive written acknowledgment in the finished book.  

Other perks listed are offered courtesy of local businesses and individual supporters of this project.

story:
Hola! I'm Emilly Prado and I am Chicana writer based in Portland, Oregon.

I've been accepted to attend Las Dos Brujas Writer's Workshop in San Francisco this summer and I'm thrilled to participate in my first conference. Over the five-day conference I'll spend mornings in a memoir workshop led by author Denise Chávez and participate in mini workshops during my afternoons covering topics like resistance through prose and poetry, publishing 101, and strengthening my voice.

This will be my first formal writing coursework since high school almost a decade ago and I'm excited to continue my growth as I work towards writing a book. I am so thankful that you're reading this now to learn about this opportunity, the importance of it in my life, as a person and a writer, and the gifts I'm offering in exchange for your financial support in making it possible.

¿Cuanto Cuesta / How Much?

I’m asking for a total of $675 and am excited to make and gift a few perks for every donor.

Here is a breakdown of this campaign goal:

  • Tuition (Discounted Student Rate), $575
  • Application fee, $35
  • Estimated Indiegogo fees (8% overall [5% platform plus 3% + $0.30 per transaction]), $65

Any additional funds will go towards roundtrip airfare (around $160), food, and transportation. I'll be able to stay with family nearby.

Para Ti / For You

Four perk packages are offered with detailed descriptions below:

  • Homies: one beautifully designed sticker
  • Chingonxs: one sticker + a hand-written postcard
  • Mami + Papi Chulos: one sticker + one hand-written post card + one set of five blank post cards
  • Bidi Bidi Bom Boms: one sticker + one hand-written post card + one set of five blank post cards + one bilingual zine, Con Las Dos Manos/With Both Hands

Stickers will be of impeccable quality and designed by yours truly. Maybe it'll be an inspiring quote, maybe it'll be my face which is also inspiring. Who knows?! I'll post an update as soon as I've made up my mind.

Hand-written Post Cards are basically an excuse to send you something via my favorite form of communication (ahem, snail mail!) and tell you why I appreciate you. My hand will definitely get a work out, but it's an honor to get the chance to tell you why you're great and thank you individually for showing support.

Post Card Sets will showcase five fancy designs. There's a rumor that I might make loteria inspired post cards about my life, but you'll have to wait and find out. Again, my way of imposing my love for snail mail onto you.

Con las dos manos/With both hands is a zine that I made during my time as an artist-in-residence at the Guapamacátaro Center for Art & Ecology this January. I raised funds to finance my trip through a different zine called ¿Quien Soy? so it only made sense to gift you this creation as well. And of course it's part of the best named group, IMO, in a nod to my idol Selena (RIP).

Gracias / Thank You

Your contributions are funding my professional development as writer and will allow me to refine my work so that I can publish a book in the future. In my work as a freelancer, I focus on amplifying the voices of folks from marginalized communities because I recognize the hurdles people of color, LGBTQ, and others face. Authors of color are critically needed because our words are not published as often as our white counterparts and neither are our experiences (you can read more on this here and here). Equal representation in media creates a sense of belonging, especially for folks who are othered, and helps eradicate the stereotyping that is perpetuated through one-dimensional depictions.

While we have a long way to go before writers of color are represented equally in publishing, supporting my writing and journey into publishing is one small step you can take alongside me in helping to close that gap.

Don't have the resources to contribute to this campaign financially? Sharing it through your social media is a huge help on its own! Gracias and thank you for making it down to the end.

story:
Picture a world where people understand themselves and one another. Imagine you are at peace with yourself, either free of or wisely transforming insecurities and fears.  What if everyone was like this?  Wow!  Imagine you live with clean air, water, earth, amidst trees and plants, whether you live in the city, suburbs, country or elsewhere. Image great relationships.  How do we create this? Where do we begin?

To me, everything starts at home, with children and the people who take care of them. My vision is to have Enlightened Moms and Dads, Evolved Kids (c), every child consciously conceived, born and raised with love and wisdom. I see peaceful, alive, vital people and families.  I see respect and honor for each child. Yes, I know what a tall order this may seem . That’s one of the reasons I wrote WHAT IF? 

Take a FREE peek at WHAT IF? here!  Download now! Print it out!  Color!  Enjoy!


                                      

                                        

Why is this book important to YOU?

  • WHAT IF? is designed to spark children’s learning, imaginations, creativity, self-esteem, communication skills, reading ability, vocabulary and ingenuity. Kids need an adult to read through the amusing, deep, fun words.
  • WHAT IF? entertains and enhances the intelligence and wisdom in both child and adult.
  • WHAT IF? inspires stream-of-consciousness thinking. The kids and adults love inventing stories about all the words. This builds children’s self-confidence, communication ability, and love of learning.
  • WHAT IF? will be a printed book, beautiful, brilliant and beneficial to kids, adults, and planet because this book will be printed on 100 percent post-consumer recycled paper that actually helps save the earth. This will be my first printed book.
  • WHAT IF? engages the mind, heart, body and essence of both child and adult, a superb way to integrate learning. Playing around with the book’s art literally shifts the reader’s brain patterns, causing more creativity, ingenuity and intelligence, opening the way to new family dynamics.  Each letter of the alphabet has both its own picture as well as its own stunning design and vocabulary, adding up to 52 pages available for coloring.


Why does 100 percent post-consumer recycled paper benefit you and your family?

Because our beautiful planet is undergoing ecological challenge and I am absolutely committed to having a sustainable present and future for our children, all my books will be printed on 100 percent post-consumer recycled paper.

According to GreenPressInitiative.org, approximately 30 million trees are used to make books sold in the U.S. – 1,153 times the number of trees in NYC’s Central Park. Many of these trees are sourced from endangered forests with devastating impacts on the people and wildlife that rely on them. This is unacceptable to me!

 If we continue to refuse to use 100 percent post-consumer recycled paper we get:

  • Deforestation, which accounts for 25 percent of human-caused CO2 emissions, a direct cause of global warming that can be stopped.

story:
Short Summary

 

This is a project as well as a small business dedicated to all things Maryland.

 

Joshua Rudderforth started www.marylandunderground.com in the hopes of sharing what makes his home state so important and unique

 

We want to give undiscovered people, places, and talent a spotlight in which their stories can be shared with people all over the world.

Contributions will allow us to operate for a small period of time in order to bring original content, photos, stories, and causes to the eyes of readers.

 

Sharing that which is personal and in our own back yard.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

We are trying to raise $5000 in order to maintain operating costs such as fuel, printing materials, computer upgrades and promotional Items. As well as money used to pay struggling freelance journalists for their contributions to the site. As well as to create a marketing plan that would entice Maryland business to advertise with us and take Maryland Underground to the next level.

Maryland Underground wants to utilize Maryland Based Advertisers. Not only for monetary purposes, but to highlight unique Maryland based businesses that are the leaders in their industry.

 

If we do not reach our goal of $5000 the money that is raised is still put to use as planned. We will have to stretch every dollar to make it count towards our operating costs. Since our operating costs at this moment are $0

 

The Impact

 

By donating to Maryland Underground you are helping small business in Maryland. As well as artists, musicians, and anyone with an interesting story to share. You will bring light to causes, and unique opportunities that make Maryland the greatest state.

 

The importance of your donation is much more than helping a small business. It is a donation to the people in your own back yard. Give your neighbor a voice.

 

Im Josh Rudderforth. Military Veteran, Father, and Writer for Maryland Underground. Thank you for taking the time to consider making a contribution.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

 

Share with your friends, send in your own idea for an article, and leave a note of support for us at www.marylandunderground.com

Try sharing with the Indiegogo share tools!

 

And that’s all there is to it.

story:
Background

Long Story, Short Journal was established in 2012 as a labour of love. Founding Editor Jennifer Matthews wanted to create a home for longer short stories, 4000 words or more, which often had difficulty being placed in traditional journals in Ireland fiction submissions are often limited to 2000 or 3000 words. Why is size so important? While smaller short stories can be satisfying reads, they're also limited in the scope of what they can accomplish. Rarely do you see a professionally published collection of short stories where every piece is so diminutive--so where is a budding writer to hone her skills if professional literary journals won't accept longer work?

 

The current funding situation

From the beginning the Founding Editor has been happy to fund the webhosting and templates from her own pocket, in the hopes that funding applications might help out eventually with author payments, etc. A modest 'tip jar' was added to the site, but donations are rare. Funding applications with government arts agencies have also similarly been unsuccessful, despite the unique resource this journal provides. And so, writers and artists continue to generously contribute their work despite lack of funding for payment.

 

How will the money raised be used?

Here's the plan: this funding drive hopes to raise enough to pay each writer from 2012 through 2017 a modest sum. After that, funds raised will supply a modest gift to our tireless volunteers who have kept this journal afloat over the years--including our proofreader and our two guest editors for 2017. They have generously donated huge amounts of their own time to others, with no expectation of recompense (and at the expense of their own time to write).

(Founding Editor/ Editor-in-Chief, Jennifer Matthews, will  NOT be on the receiving end of any payment--this remains her labour of love; and this journal remains a not-for-profit enterprise.) 
The remainder of the money raised will go towards paying the crowdfunding fees.

 

How you can help

For those who have a bit of extra cash to send our way, among our thank you offers in this campaign is Sunset Drinking the Black Ocean, a unique fiction anthology we've compiled from selected past, present and future contributors to Long Story, Short Journal. The anthology is 100+ pages of very short forms including flash fiction, portraits, short shorts and prose poems--from start to finish a quirky and addictive read!

We of all organisations know that cash contributions are not always easy to make. It's why we'd like to keep our journal subscription-free. If you're a lover of literature, you can help us by sharing this campaign or sharing a favourite story from Long Story, Short Journal on social media! Retweets and Facebook shares for your bookish friends are always warmly welcome. If you'd like to be added to our newsletter to be notified when new stories are published, send us an email to longstoryshortjournal(AT)gmail.com

story:
The Problem

When teens at Girls for Gender Equity conducted participatory action research on the state of sexual harassment in NYC public schools, they found that 1 in 4 students is sexually harassed daily. The acts of violence range from verbal (71%) to physical (63%) to sexual assault (10%). Forty years after the U.S. federal government passed Title IX to end to sex discrimination in schools, sexual harassment continues to plague the lives of young women and LGBTQ youth.


Research shows the effects daily harassment has on youth can range from social alienation to poor grades to destructive behaviors, like dropping out of school and suicide. Still, many dismiss this form of gender-based violence as a rite of passage for adolescents, as a "normal" part of school. However, this doesn't have to be the case and teen girls in NYC prove just how powerful their voices can be as a force for change in Hey, Shorty!: A Guide to Combating Sexual Harassment and Violence in Schools and on the Streets. The book is a new resource for young people and adults to use to spark conversations in in their communities about how to cope with sexual harassment while working to increase safety in schools.

The Solution

Girls for Gender Equity is taking Hey, Shorty! on the road -- making stops at bookstores, schools, and community centers to lead conversations with youth and adults that will build connections among organizations and individuals doing anti-violence work nationwide and encourage young people to become agents of social change. Our goal is to provide them with the model that is working in New York City so that they may learn from our successes and setbacks in order to replicate this work in their community. We want to facilitate 25 events between May and December, and this is why we need your help!

Who We Are

Hey, Shorty! is written by and about Girls for Gender Equity (GGE), a grassroots organization in Brooklyn, NY that encourages communities to remove barriers and create opportunities for girls and women to live self-determined lives. Since my co-authors, Joanne N. Smith and Meghan Huppuch, have this amazing nonprofit to run, I (Mandy Van Deven) will be representing the organization's work for the bulk of the tour. However, Joanne, Meghan, and a few of the young women organizers will join me at stops along the way. 


The experiences we have on the tour will be shared on our Hey, Shorty! on the Road blog, which will be frequently updated with notes from the road, stories from folks we meet along the way, and a map of the tour stops. (Check out the virtual tour as well!)


The Impact of Your Support

Girls for Gender Equity is known for its ambition and to be successful with this project, we need your financial assistance. Traveling around the country to engage folks in discussions and mobilize communities to make schools less hostile to girls, women, and LGBTQ people is expensive.


We already have 22 events confirmed and additional dates are forthcoming (for example: Washington, DC; Chapel Hill, NC; Boston, MA; New Orleans, LA; Ithaca, NY). All we are missing is the monetary means to cover the requisite expenditures.

What Your Contribution Will Fund

Every effort will be made to keep costs as low as possible! The necessary expenses include:


Transportation: Getting from one place to another isn't cheap. We need a car and gasoline to move between different cities. Planes will be taken sparingly, but these expenses are the bulk of the cost. And they add up quickly.

Lodging: When I can wrangle free accommodations, like staying with friends and colleagues, I will. But when I can't, I will need to stay in an inexpensive hotel or hostel.
(If any lodging facilities would like to offer up a tax deductible place to sleep in-kind, please email me at media@ggenyc.org!)

Food: A girl’s gotta eat, right? I’m sure our hosts will be willing to provide some meals, but probably not all of them. I’m pretty resourceful in this regard, and I can easily get by on lots of PB&J sammies.

Books: It would be a nice gesture of thanks to give a copy of Hey, Shorty! to the people who graciously host us, not to mention a great organizing strategy to provide copies to our allies. Our publisher will allow me to purchase copies at a reduced rate, but they can't give me copies for free.

Your partnership in this tour is critical to its success! If we are not able to raise $5K then we will not be able to complete our goal.

What You Get In Return

Although helping make schools safer is a reward in itself, supporters will be sent these fabulous rewards:


HELPER ($10): A Hey, Shorty! postcard dropped in the mail from some place on the road.

FRIEND ($25): A “Street Harassment is a Crime” poster that was designed by the teen women organizers at GGE.

SUPPORTER ($50): A copy of Hey, Shorty!, signed by all the authors

ADVOCATE ($100): A signed copy of the Hey, Shorty! book & a Hey...Shorty! DVD

CHAMPION ($250): All of the goodies listed above!

CHANGEMAKER ($500+): I will make a special trip to a city of your choosing – so long as this amount will cover the travel expenses.


Everyone who donates to this project will be listed on our Facebook page and the Hey, Shorty! on the Road blog with a note of thanks you for your contribution.


In addition to donating, you can help out by spreading the word about this project. Ask people you know to make a contribution. Email them a link to this fundraising page. Share it on Facebook, Twitter, or Tumblr. Post a write-up on your blog. Every action you take adds up and we can't tell you how much we appreciate your support!

What People Are Saying About Hey, Shorty!

A full list of our press coverage can be found here. But here is a sampling:

“Hey, Shorty! is an invaluable piece of work. Within each short story lies a lesson or a reminder of how valuable it is to listen to members of your community when you’re organizing, and give a voice to the underrepresented, the silenced, and the quiet members, too. Hey, Shorty! will lift you up when you hit obstacles and show you that there really is always a will and a way. It will lend insight into how to circumnavigate your campus and how to rally your troops.” - Carmen Rios, teen organizer from SPARK Summit


“Hey, Shorty! offers a detailed blueprint for how to make the streets and schools safer for our girls (and everyone else) – by empowering young people to take leadership on this issue and supporting them to develop effective strategies. These girls’ work is a potent example of youth activism: they successfully raised awareness about an issue that has too often gone ignored.” – Elizabeth Mendez Berry, journalist


“This book is full of great ideas for youth organizing and coalition work. What’s most impressive is how GGE encouraged girls to articulate their issues and goals, and then worked with them to learn the skills they needed to achieve their goals. The result? A whole new generation of smart, knowledgeable, articulate and empowered young women. Women who will change the world.” – Ms. Magazine


“The book provides a model for action through the example of Girls for Gender Equity’s work, in particular the model of prioritizing youth leadership on issues that relate to youth because, as Joanne N. Smith notes, they are the experts on these issues and they are the main stakeholders.” – Holly Kearl, author of Stop Street Harassment


Special thanks to the teen women of Sisters in Strength for demonstrating a fierce determination to make sure concerns for one's safety don't impede a good education. And much love to Feminist Press for seeing our potential and helping us to bring it forth!

(If any lodging facilities would like to offer up a tax deductible place to sleep in-kind, please email me at media@ggenyc.org!)

Food: A girl’s gotta eat, right? I’m sure our hosts will be willing to provide some meals, but probably not all of them. I’m pretty resourceful in this regard, and I can easily get by on lots of PB&J sammies.

Books: It would be a nice gesture of thanks to give a copy of Hey, Shorty! to the people who graciously host us, not to mention a great organizing strategy to provide copies to our allies. Our publisher will allow me to purchase copies at a reduced rate, but they can't give me copies for free.



Your partnership in this tour is critical to its success! If we are not able to raise $5K then we will not be able to complete our goal.

What People Are Saying About Hey, Shorty!
A full list of our press coverage can be found here. But here is a sampling:


“Hey, Shorty! is an invaluable piece of work. Within each short story lies a lesson or a reminder of how valuable it is to listen to members of your community when you’re organizing, and give a voice to the underrepresented, the silenced, and the quiet members, too. Hey, Shorty! will lift you up when you hit obstacles and show you that there really is always a will and a way. It will lend insight into how to circumnavigate your campus and how to rally your troops.” - Carmen Rios, teen organizer from SPARK Summit

“Hey, Shorty! offers a detailed blueprint for how to make the streets and schools safer for our girls (and everyone else) – by empowering young people to take leadership on this issue and supporting them to develop effective strategies. These girls’ work is a potent example of youth activism: they successfully raised awareness about an issue that has too often gone ignored.” – Elizabeth Mendez Berry, journalist

“This book is full of great ideas for youth organizing and coalition work. What’s most impressive is how GGE encouraged girls to articulate their issues and goals, and then worked with them to learn the skills they needed to achieve their goals. The result? A whole new generation of smart, knowledgeable, articulate and empowered young women. Women who will change the world.” – Ms. Magazine

“The book provides a model for action through the example of Girls for Gender Equity’s work, in particular the model of prioritizing youth leadership on issues that relate to youth because, as Joanne N. Smith notes, they are the experts on these issues and they are the main stakeholders.” – Holly Kearl, author of Stop Street Harassment
